I bought this along with a grinder(bur mill cuisinart for $40) and a bag of quality beans all also available here. It produces a wonderful shot and also creates that cappuccino which I crave in the morning. All said this cost just over $100 and within a month and a half it will have paid for itself. The only thing that I would warn about is that this is not turn on and walk away unit. You have to manually turn off the brewing process and you have to clean it yourself instead of Barista at Starbucks which means that all said it will take about 15 minutes in the morning to brew and clean up the machines. That being said the coffee really takes less than 2 minutes to brew the first shot so you can pause it for satisfying the craving and then finish the brew. I do not find this a tremendous imposition and I have fallen in love with the machine. Things to be aware of: - the scoop that comes with can be used as a tamper but it is easier to have a proper tamper to tamp the grinds. It requires about 49mm tamper to cover the filter completely maybe a mm or two more would fit as well. - does not come with a frothing pitcher which is needed for creating a cappucino, latte, etc. -I would recommend reading up on espresso making so that you understand the possible mistakes that can be made(how to store beans, reasons for bur mill over blade grinder and such) -Be careful to unplug the machine and then switch to steam in order to release the pressure so that you do not burn yourself when removing parts for cleaning.
reviews.review_header: For the price, cannot go wrong

reviews.review_text: I bought this for a gift. I have one I bought a few years ago and we use it at work almost daily. It’s great
reviews.review_header: I bought this for a gift. I have one ...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: UPDATE: I've been using this espresso maker daily since I got it 10 months ago. Works just great. Dependable! Does what it's supposed to. I like it. I found this Mr. Coffee espresso machine to be just fine. Good and inexpensive. It makes espresso just as it's supposed to. The only gripe I have is that the reservoir top is an odd shape which makes it tough to screw on and off. I've had this for about 2 months and use it almost daily. Time will tell if it's as long-lasting as my old Krups machine that I had for about 15 years! Go ahead and get this one, though. It's good and will save you some cash.

Know its limitations before you buy. You'll only be able to make one batch of espresso (about two shots by my count) because you'll have to let it cool down for at least an hour before using it again. The espresso itself was okay, a little bit watery by my taste.
reviews.review_header: You'll only be able to make one batch of espresso (about two shots by my count) because you'll have to let it cool down for at l

reviews.review_text: This coffee maker is a good machine. One drawback: a long-lasting taste of plastic .
Nice little unit for making latte. Would have given it a 5-star if it came with the metal milk warmer.
reviews.review_header: Nice little unit for making latte

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my daughter who is known by sight at Starbucks. I also bought her a Starbucks reusable Iced Coffee Mug. The machine is easy to use and she saves time gas and money every morning. It really adds up! I gave it one less star because sometimes it leaks water and the carafe handle twisted off when we washed it and we had to get a replacement. Still cheaper than a daily Americano!

This isn't the Porsche of espresso machines; this is the jeep or pick-up. Before this one, I had a fancy espresso maker that looked stunning, but started breaking after 1 month and was dead in a year. The Mr. Coffee version is going 2 years strong. I bought one for my dad (a farmer who is hard on things) and myself. While his brew/steam knob is balding and hard to read, it is perfectly operational after 2 years. When polished up, mine is new looking. As for the coffee it is a solid 8/10 -- I get many complements on it from guests. The only complaint I have is the steamer. It doesn't froth particularly well, but not bad either.
reviews.review_header: For what it is, it is great

reviews.review_text: It took us a week to refine our barista skills but we are getting good cappuccino every time now. Some tips - keep coffee off the edge of the filter basket, warm the milk in a microwave before frothing, empty the reservoir and clean the top seal after every use. We first used this product in a vacation rental and were surprised that we could buy one at this price. Pump machines are faster but the espresso tastes the same and is just as strong.
reviews.review_header: True espresso drinks for two at very reasonable price

reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this! You will not find better for the price!!! Just keep in mind your espresso shops use shots not cups 😉 So if you're used to Starbucks adjust your mixing accordingly.
reviews.review_header: A kitchen must have for coffee drinking awesome people

reviews.review_text: Love this! Works great! I got this to replicate mine and my mother in laws favorite Starbucks drinks. Havent perfected them yet but it's awesome that we have our favorite drinks in our own home.

Update December 2012: When I first purchased this machine, I wasn't very happy with it as my below review reveals. However, since writing it 20 months ago, this espresso machine has provided me with daily lattes despite its issues. I'm revising my rating to give this little workhorse the credit it deserves. It's a great machine for the price, but don't expect years of service or to operate as the specs outline. I've found in the three espresso makers I've purchased, they last between 1-2 years. My current Mr. Coffee ECM160 is on its last legs, as the frother screaches more than froths the milk, even with daily cleaning, but I will be replacing my Mr. Coffee ECM160 with another just like it. Review April 2011: I first purchased a DeLonghi EC155 Espresso Maker from Amazon about 14 months ago. The machine lasted for about a year and then just stopped working. But, during the time I had it, I became addicted to having a latte every morning, so when it died, I started looking for a replacement. I decided against purchasing another DeLonghi as the prices had increased significantly and it only lasted a year. Based on the reviewer ratings for the Mr. Coffee ECM160 4-Cup Steam Espresso Machine and the price, I decided to give it a try. Since receiving it around 2/25/11, the machine is prone to not brew the coffee and the frother never does the same thing twice. Sometimes when I turn the frother on, the steam starts immediately, other times, I have to wait for a few minutes and then this cannon of steam shoots out and makes a small explosion sound. In addition, sometimes I hear the water boiling for the coffee side of it and other times the water starts pouring as soon as I turn it to brew. It's my own fault for buying cheap chinese goods. I hope to keep you from making the same mistake unless you have money to burn.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Having been a coffee drinker for over 25 years and used to all types of coffee machines - percolators, french press, drip machines .... Unless you are willing to spend a grand on a coffee machine - I've found Mr Coffee to be the best coffee machine overall. Here is why: (1) Produces excellent coffee as long as you use the right coffee (2) Never fails - used it for over 3 years now - still working well (3) Excellent for single serve as well as can brew up to 4 cups of coffee. What is not good: (1) Forget about using the steam wand - is useless - it produces so much of water to heat the milk that by the time you have your Latte - it would be watered down heavily. If you are buying this machine exclusively to prepare Lattes & cappuccino and planning to use the steamer - forget about buying this machine. Safety: As a safety precaution - before you open the top lid for water, turn the on-off knob to the steam position to release all the steam and then open the top lid to pour the water in Recommended coffee: (1) If you are tight on budget - try Great Value 100% Arabica or 100% Columbian coffee - for under $3 - it is as good as starbucks or any other premium brand (2) If you are ok to shell out a few $s more - Lavazza Espresso Roast is the best coffee
reviews.review_header: The only cheap thing about this machine is its price

reviews.review_text: My office loves this machine. Great price for a machine that makes great coffee and latte's.

I am in remote location overseas and desired a budget solution to make my own espresso. I bought this machine for the low price to make espresso at the office. Here are a few comments. The machine makes adequate espresso for what it is. You can not expect it to make the same quality drink as a higher brand such as Di Longhi or Saeco. With the coffee dispensing out of a single drip mechanism, it puts the entire shot in a mini coffee pot. The coffee has a descent taste to it, a little bitter due to the shot becoming dead while trying to fill the entire pot. It dispenses with crema(Light colored foamy part of an espresso shot) about half way. The initial trickle drip is slow and dark and starts to foam about after ten seconds. The coffee will get a slight burnt taste if allowed to drip to the full 4 shot mark on the pot. This is due to the steam being fully charged near the end of the dispensing. Once you are done the grounds pop out in a nice packed chunk, My only critique of this type of machine, (not just this brand) is that you can not pre-heat the water. If you wanted to steam the milk first then brew the coffee you can not really do it because there is not enough time to steam the water. You can only brew coffee first, then turn the lever to the steam position to actuate the wand. All in all if you are in a pinch and are looking for a quick disposable machine where you can leave it behind without being without some coin this is a good machine for the money.
reviews.review_header: It does the job for a low priced machine

reviews.review_text: As others have noted a steam espresso machine like this one will not produce the visually appealing crema that one expects with espresso. It does, however, produce an excellent, very rich and very dark cup of coffee that you will never get from a drip coffee maker. It is easy to use and the first cup of espresso was excellent. I roast my own coffee beans so while I am not an expert on espresso I do take my coffee drinking seriously. I likely will never use the frothing feature but that doesn't make this machine any less of a bargain. BTW, the tamper sold by Amazon has a 51mm diamter that will work with this machine even though it touches the sides of the basket (but at a level below that used for even one shot). 3 month update: I still believe this espresso maker is an incredible bargain. The only advice I have is use espresso beans and don't use too much ground coffee. Over packing of coffee may or may not shorten the life of the machine but it will definitely produce coffee with a bitter taste. 8 month update: I purchased the De'Longhi EC155 that I now use at home. The steam espresso machine is now in my office. At work I prefer an actual cup of coffee and as noted above it produces a very strong dark coffee of java. Better than any drip coffee machine can. 12 month update: Still working perfectly and producing excellent coffee. I've come to appreciate the espresso made by the De'Longhi with its incredibly thick crema but at work I seem to need a larger cup of java. Two of the three tabs on the coffee pot lid have broken off but the lid stays on when you pour out coffee. I inadvertently left the machine on brew for about an hour when there was no water in it and surprisingly it has continued to work perfectly. This machine may outlast several drip coffee makers I've owned!
bought as a gift. propt delivery and as advertised, but my son didnpt want it so I sent it back
reviews.review_header: bought as a gift. propt delivery and as advertised ...

reviews.review_text: I love this thing. The milk would not get any foam in the beginning and I was disappointed. However I need milk with my espresso, so I heated the milk for a minute in the microwave and then tried to froth it and it worked. So the trick is to heat up the milk first. Works like a charm..... I prefer this than going to Starbucks. I even buy the good espresso from Italy. It's so good!

I love it! i just started drinking americanos at starbucks and got addicted! my starbucks habit reached 120 buck a month! no its down to 60-70! machine is easy to use! not to comfy with the steamer only tried it once! lots of bubbles but milk was still cold! need some practice!
reviews.review_header: I love it! i just started drinking americanos at starbucks ...

reviews.review_text: This was purchased as a gift for a Barista and he was ecstatic, it makes the perfect espresso, will even foam SOY (which is a terrible thing to work with) and overall the recipient of the gift adores it. The only downside is that it doesn't come with a damper.
Great quality coffee maker that has a life of about 7 yrs.
For the price, this is a really great product. There is a light plasticy taste, but you have to expect that if you're paying less than $100 for an espresso system
reviews.review_header: this is a really great product. There is a light plasticy taste

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: i love my Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System its a nice one

If you really like espresso and want a super simple machine, this is it. Not only does the machine work well for espresso but the foaming action is great. Very powerful. The unit is very easy to clean as well. The bottom drip tray pulls out and apart for easy cleaning. The insides that hold the coffee are all metal so you can scrub them if they get clogged.
reviews.review_header: This is the only espresso machine you need.

reviews.review_text: Very basic, but for $40 it works great and it has several thoughtful features.
reviews.review_header: A great value; makes a great cup of espresso without any "fru-fru"

reviews.review_text: For $32, this is a wonder machine. The reason for only 4 stars is the poorly designed cap for the water filler (as well as the oval shaped brew/steam controller on the side). A gecko would be able to turn them just fine, but for normal human fingers, it's nearly impossible to get a grasp on the slippery, sloped top of the cap or the side controller. I suspect Mr. Coffee is following some kind of tradition in designing it that way... I can't think of any other reason, but come on, think outside the box and design a cap that one can properly grasp since it needs to be tightened somewhat so the steam doesn't escape. Other than that, the machine makes great espresso. I tossed the black plastic cover on the frothing wand and the naked, metal wand works just fine.
reviews.review_header: For $32, this is a wonder machine, but a lousy cap.

reviews.review_text: I have not used this machine yet so my star rating is not valid. It came this morning in manufacturers packaging only. This item was meant to be a surprise for my husband and literally the only gift under the tree for him this year. Im so upset that he received this delivery and saw it.

I had a combo espresso and coffee maker. The steamer port would steam while brewing, and I didn't with to purchase another combo and just went with this stand alone unit. Everything is great! There could be knurls or bumps on the steam lid to open if you have slight moist hands. I guess maybe this is a safety feature so people will not open it as often hot like the older style. Dislikes: The plastic top to the glass container is horrible! It will not stay latched in the container and I have to take it off while pouring out my coffee, or I get that in my cup as well. They changed the pour "tear drop" on the glass container and it is not as big as the previous model that I had in the combo. It spills out coffee unless you pour it out very slowly. So, you have to pour it into your coffee cup over the sink, not a big deal! Overall, very happy for the price. The size and easy-to-clean bottom catch pan is nice. Would purchase again.
at the beginning was good, a week later is broke.
This little machine makes a great espresso and cappuccino
Works as advertised. Makes a nice study pot of esspresso in morning, and for dinner geusts. I like the steamer. I can clean it easy too. Easy no fuss!

I like to joke around that this espresso machine has been my best investment yet because I'm a college kid and this thing has lasted me over two years which is just amazing at the affordable price. It was perfect for my wallet, I am able to make delicious espresso drinks every morning, and it has lasted me quite a while! I have to admit the steamer doesn't work too well which for me is fine because I prefer to just heat up my milk and save time. But everything else about this little guy is the basic necessity you need in an espresso machine. It's not top of the line but you get a good reliable caffeine monster for the price.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: It does what it's suppose to do. Low maintenance.

I bought this for my sister, she wanted to learn how to make latte art. This machine works really well she uses this on a daily basis, a few times a day. It still runs like it did new. You can easily make latte art with this machine it just takes a lot of practice and cannot be learned really quickly.

I bought this from Amazon for $29.99 for my Christmas present. My husband and I had recently started frequenting the local coffee house for lattes and mochas, and at $3 a pop it was getting expensive. This product was one of the least expensive espresso machines, but got great reviews so I decided to give it a try. After owning it for about a week I am totally impressed! In addition to the machine, I bought a tamper for about $6, a 20oz steaming picture for about $12, and a Mr. Coffee bean grinder for about $19.00. I bought some espresso beans, vanilla syrup and chocolate sauce from my local grocery store. Overall, I made about a $75 investment. The machine works GREAT! I have managed to make DELICIOUS lattes and mochas that taste just as good as what we were buying at the coffee house. My friends and family have been impressed with my drink creations. This machine and accessories will totally pay for themselves in a couple of months. I can't comment on the durability of the machine since I've only had it for a short while, but even if it dies in a year it would have been completely worth it.
reviews.review_header: Awesome product! Save money...make your own lattes & mochas!

reviews.review_text: What can I say? I too had fallen to the obsession with espresso drinks! I read about espresso and its history and all the different types of espresso drinks, and began to really want my own espresso machine, but I didn't want to pay tons of money. Just when it was beginning to look hopeless, I discovered this machine, $40 and great reviews? Well, like so many others here, I just bought it because I figured with the low price and great reviews it was worth the risk. And I must say, this machine works great for my purposes! The drinks I make taste just as good as in any coffee shop I used to frequent, plus I can customize them and experiment however I want - even try weird additions. But in the end, I do keep returning to the basic cappuccino, so delicious in its simplicity. I haven't bought a drink in a coffee shop for so long, now that I have my own espresso machine. I have noticed, however, that if you try to make 4 shots at once then the espresso doesn't turn out so great and you don't really get a good crema on the top. So the only issue I've had with this machine is I try to only make 2 shots at once. But, since I'm really only making these drinks for myself, that's probably a good thing. It also seems to take a long time for the steam to be heated up enough to make espresso and froth some milk, but since this machine only cost me $40 I am not complaining about those nit-picky things.
reviews.review_header: Makes great espresso drinks, very good deal

reviews.review_text: This machine has been a lifesaver. We were spending around $10.00 per day on our mochas so purchasing this machine has saved us so much money. It's easy to use, comes with everything you need, and works great. So glad that we purchased this. We are 100% satisfied.

A very basic espresso machine, great for home and family. it's quite compact, it fits on my kitchen counter perfectly. And most of all, the reasonable price for this quality is appreciative. I used to own the older models of this machine from the same manufacture before. I used it for maybe 4-5 years and i loved it, it worked great until it broke. so im counting on this one too.
This is an inexpensive but useful expresso maker. I use it for vacations.

I am not sure what other customers want out of a $40 expresso maker, but for the price this product is great. I just bought my second one (1st one I had for 4 years). It works great, shipping was fast, and product is as advertised. I have been drinking expresso since I can remember. For the one person I read that said the "coffee" didn't taste good all I can say is change coffee brands. Really? You are blaming that on the coffee maker?
It works perfectly.

Granted this is not the same quality of machine that Starbuck's uses however for the price and the ease of use, I am extremely happy with it. I haven't used the frothing feature yet but brewing espresso is no more difficult than brewing a regular cup of coffee. I believe pricier models have the ability to have the clock set and preprogrammed brew times but 4 cups of espresso brew in less than 5 minutes with this.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Works great and makes great expresso!

I'm not a coffee connoisseur by any means, but for me, this gets the job done! It brews espresso quickly and efficiently and I would suggest it to anyone. The milk frothing wand is not quite as powerful as I maybe would like, but you also get what you pay for and this machine is great for what it is!
reviews.review_header: The milk frothing wand is not quite as powerful as I maybe would like, but you also get what you pay for ...

reviews.review_text: This was a gift for my son's recording studio. He has a unique studio/bed & breakfast, so now his sleepover clients can wake up with a jolt of cappuccino. I have an older version of the Mr. Coffee steam espresso machine and have used it daily for several years.
reviews.review_header: A great way to start your day and way cheaper than driving to Starbucks

reviews.review_text: Love it works great
Best espresso maker I use it every day

I finally decided I could not continue to pay $4 a day for my latte and set out to find a espresso machine so I could start making my own at home. After doing a lot of research and reading the reviews I purchased this machine and I am soooooo happy I did!! It's "bone-head" simple to use and makes a perfect latte every time! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is you have to watch it while it brews and stop it mannually when it's brewed the desired amount. Not a big deal but it would be nice if you could select how much you want to brew and have the machine stop brewing automatically.
Nice little espresso maker for a very reasonable price. Haven't figured out the frother yet, but perhaps I just need more practice.
Mr Coffee has done a fine job of suppying me with a fin expresso pot at a very reasonable price. Makes a perfect cup of coffee in record time. Thank you!
reviews.review_header: Expresso pot with good price and good coffee.

reviews.review_text: I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of this product. My Senseo machine died after just a year and I was not ready to spend $200 to replace it. This looked like an interesting product since I like using a pressurized coffee maker. This makes a great strong cup of coffee or latte if you like to add milk. The milk steamer is easy to use and allows me to make a latte using home ground Starbucks coffee for a fraction of the price of going to Starbucks. Plus there are no filters to buy or replace so it is ecologically friendly! If you buy it go ahead and get the frothing pitcher and tamper - I ended up buying them after the fact as they are pretty handy.
reviews.review_header: Surprised by the Quality of this product

reviews.review_text: great little machine for price...this is perfect for a couple or single person...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I am very impressed by this machine. I developed a pretty strong latte addiction while working as a barista. I always wanted to be able to feed my addiction at home with my own coffee and organic or non dairy milks, especially since getting a "real job." I thought I needed to throw down at least $500 to get anywhere close. I was using a stovetop espresso percolator and battery operated foaming wand. I could never quite satisfy my cravings. But this machine is getting me really close. I don't know if I'd quite get it if I didn't have the barista experience though.
reviews.review_header: Smith Coffee House is Now Open!

reviews.review_text: Makes a killer espresso. Just haven't perfected the milk steam thing.
reviews.review_header: Great espresso maker, takes years training in the Himalayas to make a good latte with the cool designs

reviews.review_text: This is a dang good coffee maker! Makes 2 cups of coffee in less than 3 minutes.
Love it! While it's not true Espresso I love the coffee it makes with some Lavazza Classico and steamed milk. Easier and quicker to use than my french press.
Perfect! Just what I wanted.
A really good machine for our morning espresso.

I love this little machine. Makes great espresso and cappuccino. It's a little time consuming, but I think that's the way espresso and cappuccino machines are. Make up to four servings at a time. I have no complaints.
reviews.review_header: Makes a great espresso and/or cappuccino.

reviews.review_text: Maybe not the fanciest unit but excellent for the price. This is our second. Our first worked every day for about 4 yrs. But we neglected to run cleaner thru it and mineral built up until it was unrecoverable. But it did yeoman duty. So we got another and now run cleaner about 1 per month.

I got mine for $33 out the door, free super saver shipping. I only drink espresso, so for me it was a waste of time waiting in line at starbucks for something that literally takes 20 seconds to make. I now buy the ground esspresso beans from starbucks, and make my own. The only thing is I don't see how it can make 4 cups (or shots I guess), because I have to fill the esspresso grounds to level 4, to give me 2 cups of perfect made espresso ( I bought a doppio espresso from starbucks with my grounds, came home and then compared my espresso to starbucks, made a few changes and now I can replicate a starbucks doppio). That said, I don't see how you can make 4 cups unless it comes out weaker (even with fine ground beans). Since this is just for me, I don't have to worry about making 4 cups. I wish I bought this sooner, it would have saved me a lot of money and time and I wouldn't be a Gold Member at starbucks lol. If you like simple espresso drinks, buy this. You can't go wrong for $30!!
What a surprise! On my first try, my latte tasted as good as i would get at Starbucks. Honestly, this was a surprise.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I am glad to buy this small coffee maker. For its price, it is worth it.
Great little compact espresso machine....love it?
Bought it for my husband he likes it so far thumbs up

I ordered this espresso machine bc my husband and i were spending alot of money at starbucks and i was trying to save some $$$. When we first got it, it was easy to use and the directions were clear. it is a very basic espresso machine. The steamer worked great- it just took a few minutes to heat up the 20 oz of milk-- but i like my coffee very hot. the machine is easy to clean and doesnt take up much space on my countertop. we got it in july and its now dec and it wtill works but has some problems- the espresso isnt heated now- comes out cold. and the steamer works sometimes. i think that we just used it too much :) i would order this again bc it is cheap and got the job done. just wish that it would have lasted a bit longer.
Very good for price!
AMAZING product for the price. I was skeptical at first and figured for the price it was worth a shot. Love it and great choice for a beginner to make latte's and stuff.

I don't like how careful you have to be about getting burned by the steam! You have to wait to add more water to make another cup, cause when you open the cap a lot of steam comes out if you do it too soon. It works very well however!

Every morning I make myself an Americano on this machine. It is easily the best machine I've purchased for my morning wake-me-up. Besides having to refill and empty the espresso ground reservoir, it works just as well as my single-cup Keurig. I hope this lasts for a while because this is a great espresso machine to use for one person.
reviews.review_header: It is easily the best machine I've purchased for my morning wake-me-up

reviews.review_text: I love this. I have owned 2 in the last 15 years and use it every day. You get a nice cup of espresso for little cost. It doen't take up much room on the counter. I hope they never stop making it.
reviews.review_header: Very good espresso maker for very littlle cost.

reviews.review_text: Not perfect, but really great for the price! My wife and I make make 8 shots of espresso in this everyday! It has held up perfectly.
reviews.review_header: Not perfect, but really great for the price

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Good value for the price. It is definitely a little awkward and slightly tedious but it does make a good cup of coffee.
reviews.review_header: good value, but a few obvious drawbacks

reviews.review_text: I love it
Item came incredibly fast and item was exactly as described.
Solid machine that makes great coffee
Works well for son. Nice!

I bought this when Amazon had it on for $20. I was a little hesitant given the price and my previous experience with Mr. Coffee products, but this machine makes great espresso! Make sure you read the directions. For the espresso to be right, you need real espresso beans, they need to be fine ground, and you need to compress the grounds just a bit. For now, I've said good-bye to paying $2.45 a day for a triple shot espresso at Starbucks!
good product, very fast , steamer could be a little bit longer but it is ok for home work.
Use it almost every day, since I'm of Cuban decent I love my Cuban coffee in the morning. If you follow the directions and clean it properly, it should last for a long while !!

Bought this for my folks, they like it, it makes very good coffee fast, but the pressure vessel lid and the function nob are a little hard for elderly fingers to grasp. A simple round notched shape would work better than the coned off nobs used on this device. But all in all not a bad coffee maker.

We love this little machine. We use regular, "good" coffee and just grind it a little longer and it turns out perfect. No need for special espresso. It is fast and easy. We use it at least 2-3 times daily (many people) and it keeps working well. Whenever it looks like it is running a little slowly we do a vinegar cycle and it is all better again. We tend to do a vinegar cycle ever 6 months or so.
reviews.review_header: Will never use another coffee maker again

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Best and cheapest coffe maker. I used to use nespresso but with having to use the small pods it gets annoying and expensive. This is amaaizng, I can use any coffee I want and the foam maker is also good. Great price! I had 3 of my friends getting the same one and they love it.
reviews.review_header: Cheap and does the job! Good buy

reviews.review_text: I should have bought the 6 cups one for my house, but this coffee maker is excellent! Great coffee in no time!
reviews.review_header: but this coffee maker is excellent! Great coffee in no time

reviews.review_text: My husband and I bought this to cut down on our "run out for a coffee" addiction. It has helped us save money and it tastes just as good as the coffee house coffee. Very pleased.
reviews.review_header: Great alternative to those $5 coffees at Dutch Bros or Starbucks

reviews.review_text: Great for beginners! Do not place any of it in the dishwasher; it will not ruin it, but it will tarnish the metals.

I had this machine for about 18 month. Use it weekly. So far experienced no problems. It performs as expected and makes delicious espresso. The black cap screwed on top of the water chamber is awkward in shape and uncomfortable to grip. May be a big deal for arthritic hands.
So nice. So very nice.
Christmas gifts!

I've only have it out of the box for about a month, thus far 110% satisfied. I read many of the reviews that claimed leaking or that they didn't like the tamper, whaa. It is used 4 times daily and has yet to do anything other then work perfectly. It always handles 4 shots at once, however it will not set any speed records. It takes up very little space on the counter. It is simple and easy to use. As a guy, reading directions is not a big part of things. Even still, it's pretty hard to screw up. The first few times I used it I had some variety in results, but due to getting the perfect grind and tamping and not due to a defect in the machine. The steam powers through my finely ground beans with no problem, and the tamper is just fine. Same with the steamer, it works great. I bought five of these in 2010, four as Christmas gifts and one for myself. Never got a chance to use it as I was soon back overseas. When I came to do this review, I actually thought I had paid $79.95 for it, only to find it was only $39.95. As good as it works, I would have been happy either way. Update; 12/14/12 It's been nearly 7 months since I posted my review. Happy to say after around 600 uses it is still going strong, even though there have been days where I have ran 10 four shot lattes through it. Important: make sure you release the pressure as soon as your done(best to just release any steam left over through the wand) I love mine.

I can't tell you how please I am with this purchase. I read the reviews and kept them in mind when I ordered. Well, I can't agree with any of them! You don't need a tamper because the back of the scoop works for that and as far as a frothing pitcher, I just use a cup I already have. It just has to be deep enough to hold the bubbles, but not so deep that you can't get the tip into the milk properly. The latte's I make now are just like the ones I paid $5 bucks a piece for a SB! The bag of SB ground espresso (haven't bought whole beans yet) is under $7. So I am saving a bundle!

Worth every Penny, Just remember to be safe with it and depressurize it with the steamer before releasing the cap on top. It comes with a set of directions to use it properly. I use it with pre-ground espresso and it tastes like it should.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Makes great coffee. Took sometime to master, but it's fun. Looks great on counter.
reviews.review_header: Makes great coffee. Took sometime to master

reviews.review_text: The steamer was hard to keep clean.

A really good coffee maker for the price. Not "true" crema, but if you grind your coffee right and steam your milk correctly (which this unit can do), lattes come out exceptional. This replaced a similar Krups version I had for 16 years, the new Krups I bought about 4 months ago to replace the original Krups went into the garbage after I purchased the "Mr Coffee". Krups has gone waaaay downhill in QC in my opinion.
reviews.review_header: A really good coffee maker for the price

reviews.review_text: for the amount paid , it is nice item
Wonderful for it's compact size.
Love this thing! We tried a couple of different ones, but this one in my opinion is the best (especially for the money)
This is by far, my favorite and the absolute best espresso machine I have ever purchased. Nothing digital. Very basic, but simple. I love it!
reviews.review_header: my favorite and the absolute best espresso machine I have ever ...

reviews.review_text: 'Came back from Europe yearning to make coffee like we had had, especially in Belgium. 'Not ready to spring for an expensive machine but wanted a way to experiment making espresso and cappuccino. This machine fits my goal for now. As with most tools and appliances, the materials and the user make a big difference. Bad coffee makes bad espresso, no matter how expensive the machine. Frothing isn't automatic; you have to practice it. (I've had to deviate from the instructions in the manual.) I've made decent espresso and cappuccino with this machine, but I'm still learning. One learning note: I bought a 20-ounce frothing pitcher, but the frothing arm isn't long enough to reach close to the bottom. I recommend a 12-ounce pitcher instead.
perfect size to be put on the desk and no one can see from the outside of the cubicle! it makes very good coffee and makes my co-workers jealous to me!
reviews.review_header: perfect size to be put on the desk and no ...

reviews.review_text: love this machine

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: You can't beat this price if you want to dip your toe into the cappuccino-making waters. -1 star for a frothing-aid stem which is too short. It requires you to hold the cup far too close to the machine, and is a little awkward to use. However, at this price point, I think small gripes like that are acceptable - it's a great little machine for trying your hand at home-made cappuccino.
reviews.review_header: You can't beat this price if you want to dip your toe into the cappuccino-making waters.

reviews.review_text: I've never had an espresso/cappuccino maker before, but I'm a huge fan of cappuccinos. So I got this one and I love it! I steam the milk right into my coffee mug so I didn't have to buy a frothing cup. I also buy freshly ground coffee at the local market (they grind it for you according to your instructions). The foam is actually too much for me sometimes :) But I am not complaining. The only issue I have is that the coating on the frothing tip (under the black cover) is coming off and I can't find the cleaning instructions. I kinda want to scrape it off completely cause it looks unappealing but I'm not sure how important the coating is? I'd appreciate any advice on this.
GIFT FOR GRANDDAUGHTER

So far it's a great little machine.....not as good as my other Mr Coffee Latte maker but they quit making that one.....don't know why they did tho it is a great latter maker and much easier than this one.
Works great!
This is our third Expresso machine from the same company. We love it, we use it until it literally falls apart, years later.
reviews.review_header: We love it, we use it until it literally falls ...

reviews.review_text: I have owned this Mr. Coffee espresso maker for about a month and, so far, it's working out wonderfully. It is obviously not the most expensive espresso maker one can buy, but, for the price, it's a great value. You cannot steam milk and brew espresso at the same time, as long as you work relatively quickly to assemble your drink, it's not a problem. It does not come with a tamper, but the scoop has a flat bottom that works fine for this purpose, no need to buy a tamper. I would recommend getting a stainless steel frothing pitcher, I tried with a number of pitchers I already owned, and none of them worked as well as the stainless steel version. Although I was never a Starbucks addict, if you are, this machine will pay for itself very quickly. After a couple of practice trials, I made lattes and espressos that taste better than what I can get at Starbucks. It does not take up very much counter space, which is a premium at our house. As long as this lasts a couple years, I don't think you'll regret buying this little guy.

The espresso machine does exactly what I wanted. The only recommendation I can give is: find good ground coffee to brew, this is because all the cappuccino's you are going to be making depend on the quality of this. The machine itself is not to blame. The frother (steamer) works great especially with the 20 oz stainless steel pitcher. This produces more than enough of that lovely foam for one or even two cappuccino's which makes it great (It does take some practice though). A slight detail, this machine doesn't produce good "crema" so for all you espresso aficionados I recommend the model above this one. This machine is great to save a few bucks instead of going to the local coffee store and spending 4 bucks or more on a cup of coffee. I would recommend this product to a friend.
Takes some practice and a couple youtube videos on the best process but now makes a perfect Expresso.
reviews.review_header: ... some practice and a couple youtube videos on the best process but now makes a perfect Expresso

reviews.review_text: Works great!

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Years ago we had an early model of this Espresso Machine, but after a couple of years of daily use, it wore out. We then moved up to a Mr. Coffee pump model. It was OK, but not great. When that wore out we moved up to a Delongi pump model. It was disappointing, very slow, but we used it for a couple of years. The other day, we decide to go back down-scale and purchased this Espresso Machine. We couldn't be happier. We drink lattes, and I think these are at least as good as what we get at either Micky D's or Starbucks. It brews and froths very quickly. I thought about moving up to one the expensive ($500+) automatic Italian machines, but in the end decided to go this way. Even if we have to replace it every couple of years, I think it is still a great deal.
reviews.review_header: This is a great little espresso machine

reviews.review_text: I really love my Mr Coffee espresso machine! Right out of the box (with the very wonderfully detailed steps to making a great latte written by an earlier reviewer) I made my first latte macchiato and it definitely rivaled Starbucks!

Mr. Coffee ECM160 4-cup Steam Espresso machine makes great coffee, but if you are not familiar with this kind of a coffee maker, the manual is of no help. It is poorly written and pretty much useless. However, I figured out how to make coffee, only wish manufacturers would pay more attention to writing their manuals also for first time users. How about some explicit instructions, point 1, point 2 etc... or do this first, then that and so on. with accompanying pictures and arrows. The frothing arm splatters milk all over the place, too, but maybe I have not figured out how to use it correctly, and the manual certainly is of no help. I gave it 4 stars because the coffee tastes good... All in all, if I'd have to include the manual, two stars would be the most I could give it.
awesome!
Got this for my birthday and I've used it nearly everyday since. Never had a problem and it makes great espresso. Still getting the hang of frothing milk but I read that's a learn d trait
Works perfectly as intended. Easy to use. Though it's a little annoying that you can't use the steamer wand independently from making coffee...the only way to use it is after brewing coffee.
reviews.review_header: Easy to use and works great

reviews.review_text: This machine does exactly what I wanted it to! It works well, it's easy to clean, and it's small size makes it easy to store. Most complaints were about the lack of a tamper, the coffee scoop worked well enough at first. I found a metal measuring cup that's the perfect size, I've just been using that. I've had people ask for coffees every time I'm making one, so I intend to purchase a bigger machine at some point. Otherwise this is perfect! I'd say it's worth the money completely.
reviews.review_header: Great machine for a great price!

reviews.review_text: Worked fine.
I didn't have very high expextions because of the price but I'm happy to say that after 4 months, in a high dust and heat environment... it continues to work as advertised.
reviews.review_header: ... very high expextions because of the price but I'm happy to say that after 4 months

reviews.review_text: I have had so many types of espresso makers over 15 yrs with some of them being very expensive. This latte maker works great, simple to use, quiet, easy to clean and makes a very good cup of latte, just as good as the most expensive one I used to use. Highly recommend this product.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: This was my first espresso machine. I wanted something cheap in case I turned out to be terrible at making it and the reviews convinced me it was worth a shot. I'm so happy I bought this; after getting a tamper, a frothing pitcher, a grinder, and some syrups, I was in business and now I have fresh lattes whenever I want, for a fraction of the price I was paying at the store. It really only takes me about 5-7 minutes to grind the beans (by hand!), brew the espresso, steam the milk, and assemble my drink, so it's a time saver, too. I was nervous from some of the other reviews, but it's been working very well for me. I disassemble and clean it after every use, which only takes a minute. It took me a while to learn how to steam the milk properly. I tried it with and without the plastic "frothing aid," or whatever it's called in the description, and I definitely get better results without it. The frothing wand is very short, which means you need to choose your frothing pitcher carefully; I have a 12 oz one that I usually fill with 5-6 oz of milk and it works well. I can submerge the wand, the milk has room to move, and I have enough room to get the amount of foam I like at the end. Great beginner's model!
reviews.review_header: Has a learning curve, but worth it

reviews.review_text: Made my money back first day of use. The coffee with this is better then dutch bros. Well worth the money. I debated on getting an expensive espresso machine it would had been a waste of money this one perfect i would recommend.
reviews.review_header: Same shots every time great price great coffee.

reviews.review_text: Great coffee at a great price. A real workhorse for the money.
reviews.review_header: Coffee time is a good time

reviews.review_text: This is a great espresso machine overall. It is simple and easy to use. It heats up water fast so you're not waiting long on your espresso. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because only a month after I purchased it, the filter holder broke.
reviews.review_header: This is a great espresso machine overall

reviews.review_text: I only have one or two espressos a day - so this little machine is perfect. Love it.
works perfectly

I love this espresso maker! Thank you. I have had one for over 10 years, was time to get a new one. Not because it broke, but because it's accessories are worn. These lil machines can "take a licking and keep on ticking"!
reviews.review_header: if you like strong coffee?? this is way better then a k-cup!

reviews.review_text: It's great for latte art, it's kind of annoying that you have to: 1- Brew 2- Depressurize 3- Steam 4- Depressurize But how can you complain about that for it's price? If it's used to make just 1 cup, it works really great, comparable to 100 USD machines
What can I say, I got this because it was the least expensive espresso machine I could find but I tell you what, it makes awesome espresso.
I bought this for my daughter at Christmas time. She has had no issues with it and she loves it. We were both very surprised at how well it has held up. I would buy it again.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I just ordered our second one of these. We purchased the identical model almost 10 years ago and it finally died. We make a full batch of espresso every single morning for homemade lattes with the occasional second round (if we have guests or want an early afternoon bonus latte on the weekends). The device is simple. Because there aren't any fancy options or electronic buttons, there are less possible things that can break on it, which is a plus for me. Since we make two lattes every morning (= 4 shots of espresso total, or one full carafe) I find it more efficient to microwave the milk instead of using the built in steamer/frother. As a former barista, the froth on top was fun, but not worth the effort at home. In the last ten years, we have had to purchase a replacement carafe once because the original was accidentally set down too hard on the counter and shattered. Update 7/11/15: Moving from 5 to 2 stars. The first one we order years ago was WONDERFUL. Unfortunately, when it finally died, the replacement leaked all over. When brewing, water would drip from the top and get all over the counter. Clearly it was defective. We contacted Mr. Coffee directly to let them know about the issue. They rushed a replacement to our house (thanks!) and it worked well at first. After 1-2 months of daily use, this "leakage" problem is re-occuring with increasing frequency. While this USED to be a quality-made product that stood the test of time, I'm not going to give them another shot. Sad. Update 6/5/16: Don't buy this. 10 years ago this was an awesome machine. I'm now on #5 because I refused to believe that the quality had dropped that much and I wanted to leverage all of the spare accessories that I'd accumulated. Go with something else. Not only have all of the new ones leaked to varying degrees, but filter holders now are all made of cheaper parts and the handles snap off easily. I was putting up with it, but now they don't make spares of those! RUN!!!

This product began breaking with in 40 days of very minimal use of 1 to 2 drinks maybe 3 to 4 days a week. The plastic tube on the steamer nozzle began cracking and fell apart - threw it away for safety reasons. The black plastic plate cover on the top where it says "Mr. Coffee" has separated on the right front and does NOT PRESS DOWN IN PLACE. Steam does escape. The plastic on the coffee pot handle cracked and broke near the glass. Over all this product is of very poor quality and I would say a safety problem due to the small parts that may flake off or break and end up in your drink.
reviews.review_header: Over all this product is of very poor quality and I would say a safety problem due ...

reviews.review_text: My husband and I had this model 10 years ago. I was hoping that this one would be just as reliable and easy to use. Unfortunately, I was wrong. The body is light and the espresso arm did not snap into place strait, like it was supposed to. It's too tight a fit. Sorta strait was the best we could get it to... Also, the main knob was stiff to turn, making the transition to espresso to steam messy and they CHANGED THE STEAM WAND. Now, this plastic nozzle has holes at the top that forces the user to completely immerse the tip and NOT be able to make foam like a regular barista. It fries the milk and leaves it flat. You should be able to put the tip near the top and pull foam for a latte. With this model, if you do that, it sprays milk all over the place. And the steam wand gave way too much powerful steam and not in a consistent stream, but irregular blasts! It's dangerous, in my opinion and it makes poor quality, bad tasting espresso on top of that. If the steam wand wasn't so horrible, it might have salvaged a 3 star review, but this is so disappointing, I want to return it. I betcha it's made in China, now. It is.
reviews.review_header: Not what it used to be.

reviews.review_text: This version is garbage. They had another version which is good. Either my unit is defective or there is a major design flaw. It won't form a seal when the metal filter is locked into the base even when making sure it's completely clean around the rim, so when it's brewing it just dumps water everywhere when the pressure gets high making a huge mess. It also has a ridiculously short power cord. It feels a lot cheaper than the last one of these I had which I guess was an older version. I'm throwing it away, it's crap.
reviews.review_header: doesn't form a seal, makes a huge mess

reviews.review_text: Before this product I had a Krups coffee and espresso combo that lasted me 15 years. The Krups espresso maker I used once per day for the last 10 years and in May 2017 it ended with a small explosion in the kitchen (loud but no fragments exiting the plastic containment - I always wondered if this could happen). The Krups machine cost about $200 at Macy's. Anyway, I found this on Amazon for about $35. I figured it should last at least 2 years. I read the reviews about the plastic taste in the coffee. And it is true, after 6 months it is finally going away. However, after about 6 months of use the plastic knob to switch from brew to steam twisted off completely. Now it is stuck n brew. I will not be purchasing this again. I will probably purchase a Krups.
reviews.review_header: Plastic taste and poor design on steam knob.

reviews.review_text: Initially, I was really excited about this product and thought that I had finally found a good coffee machine for a decent price. I opened up the box, made my first brew, and it tasted great. The second time around, I decided to use the steamer. The steamer did not work and would not heat up the milk. I was a bit disappointed because I was expecting the steamer to work on a brand new product. I then used the coffee machine several additional times and the coffee started dripping out slower and slower. By the fifth time, the coffee would not brew at all. So now I cannot make any coffee and I cannot steam any milk after 5 attempts. Do not bother buying this product. It's not worth the headache. Returning and getting a better one.

I bought this machine to replace one that died, the price was good, but, like they used to say, you get what you paid for. The price is good but this machine is for low usage. Overall the machine works fine and easy to use, the design is compact and it will fit in anywhere in your kitchen. Like other reviews said, the pump goes out. I work from home most of the time and I like coffee (strong) and I use this machine twice a day, it lasted for about 8 months, then the pump just died, it started making less and less coffee until it just died. Again, if you’ll be using this 1 or 2 times a week, it will probably last for 2 or 3 years, but, if you’re going to use it more than that, consider buying a better one.
reviews.review_header: Poor quality, for little use only...

reviews.review_text: overall for the price it is a good machine. the little plastic on the frother I removed after only one use as it just didn't work. But after getting used to it and a few tips from the barista at my regular coffee shop. I am making my favorite coffee one the weekends too. I haven't had any issues with it but also plan on upgrading to a higher end machine soon. Update: 8 months and the think does what everyone else is finding leaks water all over the place and no longer makes a good cup of coffee. after reading all the other reviews now needing a replacement I will upgrade and buy a better machine. It's time Mr. coffee steps up or steps out. you can't call yourself Mr. Coffee making crap coffee makers.

We used the machine less than 20 times and the handle to the brew basket holder fell apart less than a year after purchase.. I called Mr. Coffee's warrant line. The lady was very indifferent; said they had no replacement basket holder, said they did not have a comparable replacement machine; gave me a case number and told me to call back in 4 -6 weeks!!! I told her I wanted to resolve the problem today and she said she couldn't.
reviews.review_header: We used the machine less than 20 times and the ...

reviews.review_text: Eight months later...a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!!! On May 4, 2016, I purchased this machine because it was a best seller, inexpensive and the most important factor - I LOVE COFFEE! Did I not pay close attention to it's gurgling and sputtering halt during the initial performance? No! Did I not note the very suggestive warranty purchase during check out? No! Did I assume being single and used only during the weekends, that it would last me 4-5 years? Yes! This wonderful, useless contraption hasn't even stood-fast for 8 months!!! It's early Saturday morning, and the deception won't even brew...sigh. Oh, well..hats off to the littel engine that could - take this straight to the dump! Like Grandma often said: UGET EXACTLY WHAT YOU PAID FOR, FOLKS!

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Machine looks fine. Dont work so fine. The round metal trim that attaches the handle to the carafe broke after a couple of uses. I put some wrap around the top edge & used it without the handle. Then after some more uses, the handle attached to the expresso filler also broke. The seller reimbursed me after first breakage. Don't know what to say except stay away.
reviews.review_header: Machine looks fine. Dont work so fine

reviews.review_text: I purchased one in a store for myself, and was excited that I could cut the daily coffe house bleeding. After figuring out the actual brewing directions, with some frustration the first day, I was on my way! I was excited enough to purchase the same model for my daughter in another state from this site. Unfortunately, after not using my brewer even daily for a month, the coffee portion has died. I have searched the Mr Coffee website for helpful tips to revive if without success, and am sad to say I have replaced it with a much higher end model from a competitor.
reviews.review_header: and am sad to say I have replaced it with a much ...

reviews.review_text: Do not waste your money. The metal and plastic seam all along the front (above the red "on" light) came apart. It overflows if the grind is fine, which should not be a problem because that is what espresso grind is supposed to be. The milk "frother" works about as good as blowing bubbles with a straw. The frothing neck is too short and too close to the unit so you can barely fit a small metal frothing cup next to it. Get a stovetop espresso maker like the Italians use in their homes. Cheaper but works MUCH better. Then invest in a Epica Automatic Electric Milk Frother and Heater Carafe. Best foam EVER!

I owned the previous model, and that was a much higher quality product. This unit is simply made in a very cheap way. The rubber feet keep falling off the unit, the plastic top on the glass container doesn't fit right and keeps falling off, and the piece that holds the espresso coffee is also a poor fit to the unit. I wouldn't waste your time on this thing, and I wish I could just get another unit of the previous model - it was MUCH, MUCH BETTER!!!
reviews.review_header: and the piece that holds the espresso coffee is also a poor fit to the unit

reviews.review_text: If you're hoping this is that secret inexpensive but amazing espresso maker you've been dreaming of, prepare to be disappointed. Don't get me wrong, it was easy to use and did make delicious espresso drinks. However, after a month and a half of using it several times a week, the dial broke off while twisting from "steam" to "brew". So, unless you plan to only use it rarely, I wouldn't recommend this espresso maker.

This is my 2nd Mr. Coffee Espresso maker. I was very happy with the 1st one, also ordered via Amazon, until the brew selector dial broke about 8 months after I purchased it. This unit is much less expensive than most steamer units and I did not expect it to last for years but I hoped it would at least last one. So I ordered another one via Amazon and the water tank on that one smelled of plastic or glue so badly that it rendered the cappuccino undrinkable and never washed out now matter how may times I flushed it with water. I now have a 3rd unit purchased directly from Mr. Coffee and although the water tank has only a slight odor to it (which leaches into the coffee), steam flowing through the steamer stem into the frothing milk tastes as bad as the coffee from the 2nd unit. Just a shame - the first one made delicious cappuccino.
reviews.review_header: I was very happy with the 1st one

reviews.review_text: Nice design but poor quality. This espresso maker will not contain the hot water when brewing 4 cups. The hot water shoots out around the filter holder. The rubber seal above the filter appears to be defective. UPDATE: After some experimentation, I have found that I can safely brew 4 full cups by tamping the grounds lightly and by unplugging the power cord if the machine begins to hiss loudly. This should eliminate the excess steam pressure in the machine. My machine works better as it gets older.

This product was virtually unusable. It leaked and spewed steam all over, and the carafe ended up being only 2/3 (or less) full. We tried it 5 or 6 times cranking the grounds filter as tight as possible, but no improvement. The leakage went all over the machine and the counter. Some of the leakage was brown, creating an even bigger mess. We noticed other reviews that noted the same problem. DO NOT purchase this item, unless you are prepared to return it!! It may be this is a "Best Seller" because people return it and reorder it thinking it was defective. One review said they had purchased FIVE of these, but had to return them all!!
reviews.review_header: This is a do not buy!

reviews.review_text: The plastic handle on the coffee grounds holder broke off after only 6 months. It's poorly and cheaply made - not suitable for an item where you would expect to use a moderate amount of force on a daily basis. Read the one star reviews - they summarize this cheaply made unit very well. Not recommended.
reviews.review_header: This new generation product is cheaply made. Not recommended.

reviews.review_text: I've used this model of Mr Coffee espresso system for years and replace them when the o-ring starts to make more noise which indicates it will blow out soon. This time the new one I ordered was faulty. The machine leaked, it didn't make the full amount, and the coffee it did make tasted awful. I called the number provided for warranty, was told to return the item to Amazon. Had thrown away the box and didn't want to pack and pay to ship the item back to Amazon, too much of a hassle and not cost-effective. So I'm out 26.99 and have to buy one at a local store which will cost more but at least be easy to return if need be. So buyer beware, I guess these machines aren't as good as they have been in the past

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: The steamer on this machine is incredible. Hands down the best steamer I have used. However, the espresso side leaves something to be desired. This makes great coffee if you are using it as a percolator, but for mochas, it doesn't do it. The coffee ends up WAY too bitter because the temp for the coffee isn't right. It's a pretty durable machine though.
reviews.review_header: Hands down the best steamer I have used

reviews.review_text: Broke within two weeks. This is after being shipped with missing parts. I had a replacement sent and that unit is no longer working. Truly disappointed in the decline in quality. The first unit I purchased lasted 4 years before breaking. This second purchased was a true disappointment and the decline in quality is very obvious. And both units broke in the same manner. The unit heats but the water does not pass through the coffee grinds to brew.
reviews.review_header: Decline in Manufacturing Quality is Obvious

reviews.review_text: I've had this for almost 3 weeks, the design is classy and compact and matches my other appliances, the arm for foaming works well. The directions say to clean the machine parts (espresso cup, carafe, steaming arm) thoroughly and run water through the machine before using(the reservoir doesn't come out for cleaning). I ran water through the machine 2x and cleaned all parts before using. I was now sooooo excited to use my freshly ground espresso in my first DIY latte!!! Just ew. It tasted like chemicals, it smelled like a mechanic's workshop and tire rubber. I ran water through two more times noting that the metal reservoir is what reeked of chemical smells. 2nd espresso just as bitter and chemical tasting. I ran water through it 10 MORE TIMES which was very time consuming and still my 3rd espresso attempt tastes like poison. Just ew. So now, I have an expensive milk steamer that can't make espresso. So disappointed because I was trying to save money by purchasing this but instead I just wasted more of it!
reviews.review_header: chemical smelling reservoir & toxic tasting espresso for that special frenemy in your life!

reviews.review_text: Straight out of the box, this machine didn't even work. We followed the directions perfectly, and it spit hot water all over the counter & towards me. Honestly, I'm lucky I didn't get burned. It took forever, but it finally did brew a little coffee .... minus the water being sprayed everywhere. We then moved on to try the milk steamer & nothing. Literally nothing happened. For the price I didn't expect something amazing ... but I expected it to operate and not pose a danger to me 😡

It is less expensive, but does not function as well as, some of the "fancier" Euro brands that appear to have gone up in price a lot since I last bought one. It brews okay, but is hard to get good milk frothing from this unit. I use a different attachment than comes with it, but the tube is short and does not reach very far into a taller cup without the attachment that comes with it. The steamer lid is slippery and shaped in a way that makes it hard to lift, a silly poor design. The steamer basket attachment is plastic, not metal, so I don't know if it will last very long. Within a couple of weeks the carafe had a chip/hole in it after coming out of the dishwasher. Not sure if that was our doing, but I have used other carafes for years without issues.

This espresso machine is just dangerous trash. The frother barely works at all and you’ll be lucky to get more than hot milk. I used it to make maybe 5 cups of espresso before the portafilter exploded out of the machine with enough force to shatter the glass carafe. Shards of glass and coffee shot all around my kitchen. I can’t believe this pressurized machine doesn’t have a release valve of some kind. It’s inexcusable and negligent. Luckily no one was injured and thankfully Amazon refunded me fully for my purchase. Buyers beware.

So far so good, but time will tell. This little espresso machine does what I want it to do as far as making espresso. I have read the other comments and some suggest to wait some months and see how long it will last. I don't make espresso every day so maybe I'll be lucky. I don't use the steamer.
reviews.review_header: So far so good. Time will tell.

reviews.review_text: For whatever reason, this machine also seems to die in about 6 to 9 months (this is the 6th or 7th I am buying over the years, for lack of anything better. Delonghi makes one but that also dies in about a year, slightly better than this). And with the design issue: the control as well as the water lid both are tapered and so they are both a little difficult to hold and operate. Normally you have some extra protrusions or rings around the edges to hold these well, but Mr. Coffee went the other way - they tapered the end and made it smooth. Mr. Coffee people, if you read this, please fix this design issue. Other thant these 2 issues, I have no issue with this machine. It is quite good, fast and makes reasonable espresso for the price range.
reviews.review_header: Design issue: why taper the control and the lid? Making it difficult to operate..

reviews.review_text: Just bought this.Although I like it, poor customer parts service, as I can't buy a replacement filter basket holder ANYWHERE on line. I already lost the rubber piece and the plastic handle could break. Mr. Coffee: No, this filter holder (on our website) is designed for use with the ECM20-23NP model espresso maker. At this time, the filter holder for your espresso maker (ECM160) is no longer available. We have authorized service centers available that may have the filter holder available, and you can view the service centers that are near you here: [...]. I also confirmed on 1-800-672-6333 with Mr. Coffee, although they offered to replace the ENTIRE UNIT for free :)
reviews.review_header: Replacement filter basket holder NOT available anywhere on line!

reviews.review_text: This is a very cheap product. The very first time I went to use it the handle snapped off of the part that you put the coffee in to be brewed. I was still able to use it, I just had to use a hot pad to remove it after brewing. I felt like I could never get the steamer wand clean enough and it always seemed to have some burnt mild on it. If worked well enough for what we needed for a short amount of time and then we found a higher quality machine that I like better at this time.
reviews.review_header: You Get What You Pay For ... and it's too late for a refund

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: It's not great. The machine came quickly and was packaged nicely, and I've made 7 lattes so far. I bought the Mr. Coffee espresso maker to replace the more expensive DeLonghi machine Ive been using for the past few years. My DeLonghi broke probably due to me not cleani mg it enough but it was an impressive little guy. But going by the reviews on here I decided to be more frugal and go with a cheaper model. Having been a barista back in college, I am somewhat of an espresso connoisseur. This Mr. Coffee machine does not pull a good creme on the espresso. The coffee is also a bit bitter, even using the same brand as I had used with my DeLonghi. It froths good enough I guess. I also find it inconvenient to have to add more water between the espresso and frothing in order to steam the milk. I wish I had bought another DeLonghi, but I guess I will get used to the Mr. COFFEE.

I ordered two and one was fine and the other gave the coffee a bad taste. At first I thought it was the coffee, but when I used the other machine with the same coffee, it was fine. I think it was plastic I was tasting and smelling. Very odd taste. I also noticed the machines were not identical. One was lighter and appear more cheap. But after reading everyone's reviews, it appears there is no remedy to the bad taste and too late to return.

There is so much i love about this espresso system! Unfortunately though, I have only had it for a couple of months and the top plastic black portion has not remained in place and is coming unattached from the top metal part (to the top right above where it reads "Mr. Coffee". It appears that this system does not hold well through steam and the steam is pushing it apart. I would like a replacement but that is not an option since 30days have already past.

Yes, I still use it, but I would not recommend it. I don't know how, but some grounds got stuck in the duct and it took about a half hour of running water through it in reverse to get them free. Back pressure from the frothing wand sucks liquid from it back into the tank, so after each time you turn the frother off, let it run for a second to get any foreign liquid out of the pipe. The plastic cover for the frother wand broke after about three months. If you're looking for something cheap, I'm sure there are better options to consider if you want to pay a just a little more.
reviews.review_header: TL;DR, it works, but it's very cheap and has lots of problems\

reviews.review_text: The first Mr. Coffee machine I purchased at Walmart was amazing for $35! This one is terrible...half the grounds are dry with every cup of espresso so our "coffee" literally tastes like flavored cream water. The frother doesn't work well either. Miss my old Mr. Coffee espresso maker. If I wasn't in Japan I would request a full refund.

Broke 1 month after purchase, sadly just 3 days out of Amazon's 30-day return policy. The espresso maker is shoddily made. The part that broke down first for me was the milk frothing wand. The plastic part just fell off and the steam shot everywhere. The machine had not seen extensive use either. At about 4 lattes a week it had probably only made 16 drinks before it broke down.
reviews.review_header: Broke after 1 month of moderate use, just outside of Amazon return policy.

reviews.review_text: We had one for 10 months. For the cheap price, we accepted that it slowed down and took forever in the end and decided to replace it -- since we love the small size and ease of using it. From then on, we had bad luck. The first replacement made very loud noise, steam and pressure were extreme, the second time it actually exploded -- leaving a huge mess. Coffee and coffee grinds all over. I had to unplug it to stop it. To touch it was too dangerous because of the enourmous amount of hot steam that burnt my hand when I tried to turn it off. Amazon was great, told us to dispose of it and sent us another one for free. Again, a major disappointment. The top part was leaking all over (with the first attempts of use), so that in the end not much water would find its way into the carafe. This one, like the other one, had also a nasty smell -- like burning rubber. Again, Amazon, was great and refunded the money. Conclusion: machine is very cheap, and so is the manufacturing and the quality control.

Okay, I did get this item just a few months ago. Worked great, easy clean up, easy setup, great coffee. Then I went to turn it off, the switch literally just came off in my hand. I did not force it, I just went to turn the knob and it plopped off, could not stick it back in, nothing. I would not get this product. The switch broke internally and you really cannot get to it.
reviews.review_header: Power knob breaks off after a few months of use

reviews.review_text: We had same coffee machine for past 4 years and we replaced with same one. The new one received was defective or standards/quality might have been degraded. The coffee machine had two issues. 1. The plastic was cheap and coffee stinks like plastic. We ran just just water for couple of times but still no use. 2. the water drips out of the coffee machine, out of 4 cups 2 cups spills out and only 2 cups is collected in the pot. You need to run two times to collect 4 cups of coffee. I took video of the machine while running will upload later.
reviews.review_header: The quality is degraded or we received a defective one.

reviews.review_text: This machine does not brew the espresso to be hot. You have to heat it further in the microwave. Also the top keeps falling off the container when you try and pour coffee into your cup. If you touch the container so it won't fall, the steam from the center may hurt your finger.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: There is a bad metallic or chemical taste when using the frothing wand & it just shoots out water doubling the amount of liquid in my pitcher. I've tried de-liming w/ vinegar as the manual states & Ive tried running distilled water straight through to clean it out but it's still awful! Praise to Amazon's customer service - they are amazing & I was refunded but I would not recommend this product. I have emailed Mr. Coffee through their website to report the problem, hope they recall these machines.
reviews.review_header: Don't buy if you intend to use the frothing wand...

reviews.review_text: I am usually a very careful man, I take care of my stuff like cleaning them and keeping them in the best shape possible, so I bought this 4-cup mr coffee, and I swear it stopped working while I was brewing my forth cup of espresso in the first week of using only, I couldn't believe what just happened!, but I guess this is what happens when you buy such products at a low price and you think you had the perfect deal ever, I guess I was wrong.
reviews.review_header: It just stopped working for no reason

reviews.review_text: My husband loves this machine so much. We have been using bialetti moka. When we saw this machine, we were like.. "well, let's try this out." Although my hubby loves this so much, I prefer my old moka kettle for following reasons... 1. I don't know if I am using it in a wrong way (probably not), but it is not espresso. What you get is just regular dark coffee. It is not as dark as espresso is supposed to be. So if you make latte or americano, it will be very light. 2. Too much hassle to clean. Every time you brew and steam, you have to unplug the power to release the pressure, put more water to clean any left residue/debri. Well, other than these reasons it is fairly easy to use and super cheap for an "espresso" machine. And takes a short time to get your coffee. You get what you pay for. I will be using my moka until I get a real espresso machine for christmas.

**UPDATE** The handle to both, my carafe that the coffee drops into & the handle to the cup that the espresso is in have broken. I purchased this item in September. The first handle broke in December & the espresso cup handle broke in January. This is not a quality item. I am very upset that I now have to purchase replacements when I haven’t even used this machine for a year. For reference, I am a very petite girl. I weigh about 125-128lbs, so I don’t have superhuman strength here.

Terrible product, I was so disappointed that mr coffee espresso machine stopped working after only 30 days of using it!!! Of course return window passed right before it stopped working... What a waste of money, I took a gamble purchasing it even after reading all the reviews, however I wish amazon would stop selling this product after it so blatantly has proven defective for so many customers! Heating element just up and quit. It worked well for a short time so perhaps I will repurchase next time through target with a $5.00 addtl two year no questions asked warranty where I can just replace and replace and replace no questions asked, no TIME LIMITS OF 30 DAYS!!!! Thanks amazon, so glad I give you very little business.

I get a plastic taste in my coffee. I thought it would go away with some use but it hasn't.. I guess you get what you pay for, i discontinued using this thing. I don't understand how anyone can ignore that taste in their coffee. UPDATE: Mr Coffee Customer Service recommended i run Distilled Vinegar in the machine. I ran it through a few times then running water through it a few times and the plastic taste still remains. Folks don't waste your money on this thing.
