Everything about this product seemed great until it came down to actually tasting the espresso. There is an extremely distinguishable plastic/metallic taste that carries into the taste of the espresso. I don't know how nobody else has mentioned this because I actually had the product replaced via Mr.Coffee warranty and the replacement had the same issue When you open the Reservoir, the smell is immediately evident. I followed instructions to clean the machine with water. I did so twice. The drinks were still coming out with the plastic/metallic taste. So I used a vinegar/water combination to clean the machine and ran through at least 3 additional times. Still tasted metallic. Even the steamed milk had a very slight hint of this taste because it is obviously being picked up during the steaming process while the water is in the reservoir. I had difficulty using milk alternatives such as soy milk and could only froth about 1/4-1/3 cup of milk at a time because the steaming is too powerful and bubbles become too big. I also had to purchase a tamp and frothing mug seperately
reviews.review_header: Everything about this product seemed great until it came down to actually tasting the espresso

reviews.review_text: Good Espresso for the first week and then started to leak steam past a seal. Could not fix the seal. Was a cheap unit. In this case, you get what you pay for... it was bought on a lark and I assumed it wouldn't last. I was correct. Price of this unit should be a good indicator that it can't compete with products that work.
reviews.review_header: You Get What You Pay For!

reviews.review_text: Coffee tastes weird, like plastic. I run it with water and vinegar to get fid off the plastic smell, but nothing works. The taste of plastic is horrible. Im a very dissapointed. DO NOT BUY IT!!

This worked great the first couple of times but the steaming wand broke after that (as many others have stated in other reviews). We ended up throwing it out after 2 months of use. We purchased a higher quality coffee machine ans are much happier with it! If you are someone who will use sparingly or maybe do not need the frothing wand its a good machine for the price but if you are using daily i would recommend investing in something that is higher quality!
reviews.review_header: Worked well at first but then broke

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: This espresso machine is very small. This is for one person ONLY. It work ok for a month but then the start button start acting up: 75% of the time it would heat the water but no make any coffee. About few weeks ago the cap for the water compartment start leaking and the water is escapin when boiling. I would say this machine is not for you if you drink coffee every day! I just got a new coffee machine a more expensive brand.
reviews.review_header: Very small and not working well

reviews.review_text: In general, this is a good machine for the price. There's just one small problem with it that I have to live with. The first cup you make ends up being like warm because everything the water and coffee pass through loses heat. The heating element is at room temp, the lines to the filter basket are room temp, and the coffe pot are room temp. The only solution to this is first brewing a pot without the coffee, then brew a normal pot afterward. Only doing this, can I get a decent cup of espresso. Isn't it ridiculous though?

This was a terrible product. Bought it for my sister in law and she's been a barista in the past. It was splattering hot water everywhere and was pretty complicated to figure out. We returned it and opted to buy the more expensive Mr. Coffee item which she's had in the past. (I thought this item was it and accidentally bought the wrong one. We figured we'd give it a try but it was a waste of money).

I like not paying for lattes every morning. For the price it's decent. I used to work at THE chain coffee store, and had I not, I'm not sure this machine would be intuitive. It's definitely got a learning curve. I don't like that the steam wand is fixed, I can't move it at all. I wish I could move it a little more. I have not yet mastered exactly how much water I need. I always have way too much or not enough. But for $25 I really can't complain. The only thing I really would change is the control knob. It's too smooth. I know that sounds dumb but when you're quickly trying to shut off the steam it's hard to get a good grip on that knob.

The water has a terrible smell when I tried to clean it up before I actually use it, it smells like burning plastic. I believe no one wants their coffee has that strong smell. Also, I think it's not going to be good for your body since it is poor made. You get what you pay for, I learned my lesson here. DO NOT buy this terrible product unless you don't care about your health and the strong smell of burning plastic of your coffee.
reviews.review_header: Has a toxic smell and taste, smells really bad

reviews.review_text: Within 2 months, the handle for the coffee pot disintegrated and a month later the handle for the Portafilter disintegrated. This was purchased as a replacement for a Mr. Coffee that looked identical with the new one. The previous Mr. Coffee lasted about 15 years, and the electrical parts wore out before the handles did. It appears that the quality of this model of Mr. Coffee has declined to where it is not useful and not a good value.

Pros - Good price. It doesn't take up a whole lot of space. Brews quickly. Cons - Water reservoir and the On-Off-Steam knobs are difficult to use especially when the machine is still hot/warm. That makes them difficult to turn if your making multiple cups. Older people (like me) will have this problem. The seal between the cup holding the coffee grounds and the machine is very poor. Before the coffee is completely brewed steam is pouring out and I mean pouring, from this seal and also the reservoir seal. Be careful you don't get burned. Within two weeks the handle broke off from the carafe ring. I had this problem twice with a Krups machine. I finally repaired them both (like they should have been constructed n the first place) and I have no further problem.

At first item worked well, got to know the finesse of the steam, enjoyed the fruits of my labor and then it breaks one week outside of the return window. For some reason the steam wand sucked milk into the water tank and then proceeded to not work there after. I can't even get the espresso to come out right, as now the water pours through it lukewarm. Not cool, Mr. Coffee, as you of all should know how good a fresh latte to start the morning is.

Let me start by saying that I am not a coffee drinker, and much less an espresso drinker. As such, prior to ten days ago, I knew just about nothing regarding espresso machines. However, my daughter's birthday was coming up; and being as she is a former barista who obviously enjoys drinking her espressos, I wanted to give her something nice which I knew she would appreciate. After a fair amount of research on the web -- Wikipedia, Amazon, etc. -- and being as I am an elderly man who lives on a fixed income, I settled for this Mr. Coffee ECM160 4-Cup Steam Espresso Machine. Naturally, my daughter was quite happy to receive this gift from me, and we have both enjoyed a few espressos made with it. However, yesterday, while I was in her kitchen, I noticed that the top of this machine was off. Upon looking in, I was really taken back to discover that the boiler is actually made of aluminum, and not stainless steel. For those of you who are reading this who may be young, the reason for my concern and alarm is that for decades now, a debate has raged regarding the safety of using aluminum in cooking utensils, such as pots and pans. If you conduct your own personal research, you will quickly discover that there is a wide diversity of opinions on both sides of the fence. What is stated as truth and fact depends on who is making the statements: scientists, medical professionals, beverage industry reps, manufacturers of such items as this one, etc. Who you choose to believe is really up to you. Be that as it may, just the fact that high ingestion of aluminum has been potentially linked to maladies such as Alzheimer's Disease, stomach cancer, pancreatic cancer, etc., by certain parties, was enough to convince me to abandon aluminum cookware many years ago. Thus, my concern with this espresso machine. If just boiling hot water in an aluminum pot or tea pot results in a small amount of aluminum being dissolved into the liquid, I can only wonder how truly safe it is to boil water under high pressure in an espresso machine which has an aluminum boiler, such as this one. While others may disagree with me -- that is your right -- quite frankly, I feel that listing "stainless steel" as one of the selling points for this espresso machine is misleading, deceptive, and borders on false advertising. Yes, some of the outer parts are in fact stainless steel. However, the most important part -- the boiler -- most certainly is not. For those of you who may doubt my words, I got the truth straight out of the horse's mouth; that is, from the Mr. Coffee support team themselves. In the question and answer section of their website at http://www.mrcoffee.com/specialty/mr.-coffee-steam-espresso-and-cappuccino-maker--ecm160-np-/ECM160-NP.html, one person asks: Q: "Is there any aluminum used in this machine or is it stainless steel?" A: "The water boiler portion of the brewer is aluminum. All other metal parts of the brewer are stainless steel." Another concerned person asks: Q: "How much aluminum is leached into the water that I am consuming. Why did they not put stainless steel inside instead?" A: "At Jarden Consumer Solutions (JCS), we are committed to producing trusted household products that meet or exceed applicable product standards. All aluminum used in the Mr. Coffee Espresso Maker are recognized as safe for food contact applications by the United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA). JCS purchases aluminum from trusted suppliers, who monitor to ensure what they sell complies with all current federal, state and local health and safety regulations." Please notice that Mr. Coffee did not directly answer either of the person's two questions. The bottom line is that you get what you pay for. I bought cheap because that is all my finances allowed, and I am now left disappointed. I love my daughter, and her health is of great concern to me. Thus, I just purchased her another espresso machine which costs five times as much as this one; and yes, it has a stainless steel boiler. In conclusion, if you are ignorant regarding espresso machines as I was, or if you are on a limited budget, you may be happy with this espresso machine. However, if you are concerned for your health, you may want to consider spending more money, and at least getting something that has a stainless steel boiler. PS: Also worthy of note is the following information regarding the Mr. Coffee Espresso Machine which is also found on the Mr. Coffee website: "The ECM160 espresso maker has a maximum pressure of: 1.24 bar with 14g of coffee powder 3.62 bar with 24g of coffee powder." From what I have read online, and based on what my barista daughter told me as well, by any standard, that is TERRIBLE pressure, and will NOT deliver a very strong/concentrated shot of espresso. It is substandard. For a decent shot, your espresso machine should produce at least pressure of 15 bar. Such machines cost at least a few hundred dollars . . . such as the new one that I just purchased for my daughter to replace the Mr. Coffee machine; that is, this one: DeLonghi EC702 15-Bar-Pump Espresso Maker, Stainless
reviews.review_header: Beware! The Boiler is Aluminum, And Not Stainless Steel!

reviews.review_text: It reeks of chemicals. I cleaned it a few times but every time it steams, it smells sooo bad. Like burning plastic even though the inside isn't plastic. The steam wand magically SUCKS up the milk sometimes too. It was such a waste of my time I threw it in the garbage because no one deserves to drink chemicals.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: While on Vacation, I had access to a cappuccino machine similar to this. I really enjoyed making my own cappuccinos. When I returned home I searched for an inexpensive machine, and settled on this one since it apparently had decent reviews. Having used it now since it arrived, I can report it does make espresso ok. It does not however froth milk very well at all! Pretty much it just bubbles and makes the milk hot, no froth. All I can say is I'm very disappointed in this machines performance, but I guess I have learned my lesson. My next purchase will be the Delonghi machine. It may cost more but my experience with their products has been flawless.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for, if you want a good espresso/cappuccino machine. This ain't it!

reviews.review_text: When it arrived, it was fantastic! Made a great cup of espresso and frothed milk with ease. Now, 4 months later, it won't brew a full single serving even when I put in a full pot of water which should make 4 servings. It just sits and steams the water away. I followed the directions to a "T", I never allowed grounds to accumulate on the grounds holder or on the gasket that seals the holder to the machine. I m disappointed to say but it's true....you get what you pay for. Never again. I though Mr Coffee had it going on. Not so much.
reviews.review_header: It's the "#1 Best Seller" only because of price not quality.

reviews.review_text: This machine is not on par with our previous Mr. Coffee espresso/cappucino machine. It makes okay espresso, but doesn't get up enough steam to froth the milk. Disappointing, considering our last machine kept plugging away for 10 years.

So.. I followed the directions for making a latte. And i have been a barista before. I tried brewing the espresso as it said, and then switched to steam my milk. The milk started getting sucked into the machine through the frothing wand! I had the parts on properly and on the correct setting and then i tried to steam my milk and it got sucked into the water compartment and it finished brewing the coffee and milk! So stupid. Very unsatisfied. It also is EXTREMELY loud.
reviews.review_header: Loud and the steamer didn't work.

reviews.review_text: I bought this item along with the following: RSVP Terry's Tamper & New 20 oz Espresso Coffee Milk Frothing Pitcher, Stainless Steel . The cappuccino's I get out of it are on par w/ Starbucks. At $4+ per drink this item pays for itself in about a week. I don't think you need a tamper for it as I've not noticed difference in taste between the tamped vs. untamped other than espresso shot strength. The frother's arm is quite short and discovered the arm's length to equivalent to that of a Pyrex 1-cup container (if I'm making a single cappuccino); for more beverages the above mentioned frothing pitcher is perfect. I found the small size and appearance of the machine to not go well in a large, high-end kitchen. It looks out of place. The water chamber does get a bit difficult to open if you don't do so immediately after using due to the cap design and the vacuum effect once the water vapor cools down. The machine is light, easy to move and clean. I would recommend this item for anyone that is looking for an inexpensive alternative coffee shops for their morning fix. The machine has more than paid for itself in savings since I purchased it. 12/28/2011 - To release the vacuum in the water chamber and make opening it easier move the knob to the steam setting. This will suck air into the chamber through the frothing wand and make opening the cap easier.
reviews.review_header: A decent machine and excellent value.

reviews.review_text: I bought this in 2011. It was simple and excellent. Bought the same system in 2014. It didn't work good. Water was leaking. Thought may be I was unlucky and bought another one. Had exactly the same problem. NEVER BUY THIS MODEL. I checked the reviews and found lot of people are having the same problem.
reviews.review_header: It was simple and excellent. Bought the same system in 2014

reviews.review_text: Pretty dissapointed. Sad that I have to microwave my coffee after it brews to make it hot. My tap water is hotter than the coffee this thing spits out. My 6 year old original Keurig is by far a better coffee maker, It actually makes a hot cup of coffee. I would NOT recommend this to anyone wanting a hot cup of coffee. You want a cappuccino? Buy a Keurig and a battery powered milk frother.
reviews.review_header: Pretty dissapointed. Sad that I have to microwave my ...

reviews.review_text: So, it really isn't that great. Yes, you basically get what you pay for. I bought it for my wife as a Christmas present and from the get go, it's made of plastic all around and it just FEELS cheaply made. Secondly, the steam wand really doesn't froth well nor does the steam that comes out very hot. We tried multiple times to try and get the right microfoam using both skim and whole milk, with little luck. I used to work at Starbucks so it's not like I am an expert, but I do understand the basics of espresso-based drinks and this really isn't that great. It's fine if you just want warm milk and crappy espresso mixed together, but don't expect too much. Also, that "RSVP's Terry Tamper" that Amazon tries to pair with this machine when you buy it, DOES NOT FIT. It goes about halfway into the espresso basket and then gets stuck, don't buy it!
reviews.review_header: it really isn't that great. Yes

reviews.review_text: I owned one of these machines for many years and it was great, until it was lost in a home fire. The second machine leaked an excessive amount of hot water during the brewing process from day one. Not only is it dangerous and messy but the espresso comes out cold. I contacted amazon and they shipped a replacement overnight. Great, problem solved - except the replacement did the EXACT SAME THING. Something has gone downhill in the manufacturing of this product; I didn't have these issues with the original machine. Now I see that several reviews mention their machine exploding - scary! I believe it, since the defective machines sounded like they were on the verge of explosion. They should recall these items - they're useless and dangerous.
reviews.review_header: ... of these machines for many years and it was great, until it was lost in a home fire

reviews.review_text: I would have absolutely loved this if it were not so flimsy. The steamer arm has a cover that you need to take off and clean, it basically crumbled the first time it was touched. There is also a little black band there that was to hold up the cover, except it just falls off. We had to replace the carafe as well, we did bump it on another cup, but it seemed to break a little too easily.. Buy something sturdier, this is OK but won'd last anyone.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Unfortunately, we bought the machine prior to a out of town lengthy trip, thus when we returned and actually used the machine our return time had passed. Water just evaporates and not a single drop of coffee is made. Invest in something else, do not purchase this.

The frothing wand blows - literally and does not froth the milk. We are NOT novices to this and cannot get this thing to froth properly. In hindsight I should have purchased a more expensive unit with higher ratings but at the time could not afford it. The espresso comes out well but no froth.
reviews.review_header: Spring for a better unit - it will be worth the price over this!

reviews.review_text: I hate this device, so much. The water frequently bubbles over even when the top is screwed on tight, and you have to VERY CAREFULLY pour water in, since there's no meter that tells you the water capacity and the inside is DARKER THAN SIN. The inside, the top, and other parts get REALLY HOT, more than any machine I've used. Steam REGULARLY escapes from the top and scares me. More than once, I've brewed myself a drink and heard a loud pop from it. I use this as infrequently as possible -- which is unfortunately often, since it's my only coffee making device.
reviews.review_header: The bane of my existence. Satan hands this out on xmas.

reviews.review_text: It's dangerous you have to unplug it to release steam between use or you will end up burning yourself. Make sure the cap threads don't get crossed or you'll burn yourself and the cap will be stuck. If you can live with those hurdles then you try to enjoy a cup of rubbery metallic coffee because this is no espresso. You will not get crema and it's really hard to control your brew time too. The good news is that Amazon took care of me with a refund.

I cleaned the machine with hot water before I used it. The coffee tasted like metal I cleaned it again, using vinegar followed by clean water. Still I distinct metal taste. I tried the vinegar/water again. Then I tried to return it, but it was not eligible for return, so it sits unused. I have had 4 of these before with no problem. I have no idea why this one produces coffee that tastes more like metal than coffee. Will not buy another one. Also, it does not froth well, just seems to boil the milk Bummer
reviews.review_header: The coffee tasted like metal I cleaned it again

reviews.review_text: I've had this coffee maker for almost exactly two years and I am now looking for a replacement. All the plastic handles have fallen off, and steam has started coming out of the basket attachment quite forcefully. It doesn't seem to make very strong coffee, and I often brewed all 4 oz for one drink. I'm also fearful that someday it is going to explode, as some of the reviews said it does! I hide behind the fridge every time it starts hissing. Other than that it has worked for me for two years. It does make reliable coffee, I'm just afraid to use it much longer.
reviews.review_header: Things fall off, doesn't last, kinda scary!!!

reviews.review_text: This thing does not make espresso. There isn't near enough pressure to do so. At best, it is handy as a milk steamer and that's about it. Even then the milk gets watered down from the steam....but now I'm just being nit-picky. The handle on the coffee ground holder broke within the first 2 weeks. It is still usable. I actually meant to send this back but missed the return window. Oh well, what can you expect for $35.
reviews.review_header: At best, it is handy as a milk steamer and ...

reviews.review_text: Bad burnt plastic taste remedy: I used citric acid in water ( you can use 1 part white vinegar to 2 parts water )and ran the machine once, then filled tank to rinse with regular water. The cap has a bad odor as well. I poured white vinegar into the cap and let sit for about a half hour, then rinsed. This got rid of the terrible plastic taste in my coffee. I got this machine as a backup while my Breville is getting repaired. It's not too bad, but don't expect to get a real authentic espresso shot of of this machine.
reviews.review_header: Here's what to do for the terrible burnt plastic taste:

reviews.review_text: I read all of the directions first. The espresso maker worked GREAT. However, I tried to steam the milk afterwards and the steam never came. As a matter if fact, the steaming arm sucked the milk back up the arm and into the unit. I then went to the troubleshooting matrix and it says if it doesn't steam, there's not enoughwater in the reservoir. Well in the directions it shows by making the cappuccino first, which drains the reservoir. What am I doing wrong? I looked online for an answer, and cannot find one.
reviews.review_header: The espresso maker worked GREAT. However

reviews.review_text: Pros: -Cheap - Easy to use Cons: -Not actual espresso, more like high pressure drip -Steamer takes forever to warm milk + steam distributor broke while cleaning -Reservoir cannot be refilled with water without depressurizing the machine -The selector knob sheared of during normal use (Weak plastic internal mechanisms)

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: From the very first day it would take 10 minutes to brew 4oz of Espresso. It only got worse over time. Now I have to turn it off completely and turn it back on otherwise it only brews half. Ohh and by the way it takes upwards of 15 minutes to brew (4 months later). Buy something better.

This is my fourth mr. Coffee espresso machine like this. This machine I just received is like a toy compared to the last for that I used. Something in the machine makes it stink so bad that it's unusable. I have been using this machine for the last 10 years and I'm sorry to say it's over. I'm forced to give it at least one star which it does not deserve because it's unusable.

only used it once or twice a day for a month. now it blows a lot of steam but its not making espresso. yesterday it barely pumped out 4 cups. this morning it made 3 cups even though I poured 4 cups of water. try it again, barely 2 cups. try again, 1. its dying on me. ITs got a lot of steam seeping where it should seal. I bought this because of the mr coffee name, now i'll be sure to heed the advice of others and not buy something rated like this is

I'm so sad to have to rate this two stars. It's a lovely little machine at an amazing price. But ultimately, the smell of burnt plastic is a complete deal breaker. I tried running two reservoirs of filtered water through it and it still persisted. Then I tried vinegar. Still no luck. It has to go back. Otherwise it would be a perfect little milk frother. C'mon Mr. Coffee, you have to get the basics right or else even this terrific design is essentially worthless.
reviews.review_header: Such terrific potential ruined by smell of burnt plastic

reviews.review_text: I had this coffee maker two days when the top, front part came unglued. I glued it back on, but it comes unglued anyway...then when the coffee is perking the steam comes out the unglued top. It happened by the time I perked the 3rd time...I had already thrown the box away so I didn't try to return it, but obviously I'll be looking to buy a different type probably at a store. I was totally disappointed. 7/2/2014....So now I've had this piece of junk for a little over a month and it just gets worse every day. If I try to make 4 cups, at least a cup steams out of the top and bottom holes, ending up with 3 cups or less and a mess all around the coffee pot on the counter. Definitely have to buy a different brand. Would definitely NOT recommend this at all. I've changed the 2 stars to 1 and that's doing it a service since there is not a 0.
It taints the coffee with a plastic-like chemical/flavor. Seems very dangerous/poisonous.
reviews.review_header: Very poor quality material. When brewing the plastic leaves an oder cloud of plastic and a very strong plasticy flavor incoffee

reviews.review_text: The worst coffee machine I have ever bought in my life!! I can't believe this is even sold in Amazon! The product arrive on time but honestly it doesn't work right, coffee comes out cold, it is weird because it heats enough to drain.
reviews.review_header: The worst coffee machine I have ever bought in my life

reviews.review_text: Returned for full Refund, Thanks Amazon. Unit is a Piece of Crap. Turning Knob poor design broke so it rendered the unit useless. First few times, it worked well. Lately after, say 20 uses, it has become very very very slow, takes too much time to get 1 cup and then it is all water, irrespective of coffee grind quantity (coarse or fine). I am returning this unit back to amazon, for full refund. Was my unit defective or is it this bad (good for few times only?).

The last one lasted 1 year, this one lasted 1 month. Just past the time that Amazon would take it back. When you can get the manufacturer they send you to a repair facility who will charge basically the cost of a new unit. It does make a good cup and now I am debating ordering another one. Some of the other manufacturers units have the same basic reviews. My husband and I enjoy a cup in the afternoon and I need to make a decision. Probably will stay with this one.

The coffee maker stopped working after the initial cleaning. The thermal switch died. Made no sense to return to Amazon as I live overseas and the original cost to ship to me was nearly the price of the unit. To return and receive a replacement would have resulted in the unit costing me approx. 3 - 4 times the cost. I therefore "bit the bullet" and absorbed the loss. I cannot blame Amazon though as I know they would have replaced it without hassle. C'est la vie. June 25th 2011 - Update - Try as I may I could not source a replacement thermal switch. I decided to do something radical. I removed the thermal switch, heated it over my stove element and tested for continuity with my ohmmeter. I got a reading but it was not within expectations. I kept reheating and cooling until my reading reached zero. I reinstalled it and it is now working beautifully. Maybe it needed a little "heat" in it's butt to work.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I have only had this espresso maker since Last December, and it has exploded and gotten coffee all over my kitchen - twice! Not sure if it doesn't let out all of the water, and then builds up too much pressure in a future brew or what, but having the coffee ground basket explode and send coffee everywhere is no fun, and a bummer to clean up before even getting a cup of coffee! Now I'm giving up, and have ordered a replacement in a different type/brand.

This coffee maker just doesn't cut it. The toxic smell from the plastic inside the top pressure cap constantly makes you think you are drinking something you shouldn't be. My wife would get sick just walking into the house after brewing. I did give this a chance and ran brew cycles many times for about a week and the smell remained. Reminded me of swimming pool chemicals. I will be looking elsewhere for my coffee nirvana.
reviews.review_header: This coffee maker just doesn't cut it. The toxic ...

reviews.review_text: This is the second time I have purchased the Mr. Coffee ECM160. The first machine lasted about two years, which is a lot less than the 10 years a different make/brand (that cost twice as much money) with exactly the same functions lasted before it gradually died. One morning I went to make my usual cup and without any warning - it just didn't work, the water wouldn't heat, nothing. So I purchased this model again because it is easy to use and for my purpose which is making one cup of coffee without any steaming it is fast and no fuss. The cost is reasonable even if I only did get 2 years out of it. I did not use the steaming function or wand at all so I cannot review those functions. If this machine lasts substantially longer than 2 years, I might change my rating which is average at this point. It is what I would expect for the price but I thought I would get at least 5 years from the machine, hence only 3 stars.

Has a strong chemical odor which carries into the taste of the coffee even after running several cleaning cycles. The milk frother does not work well and is made of cheap plastic which broke after a week of use.
reviews.review_header: Has a strong chemical odor which carries into the taste ...

reviews.review_text: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY TOO. Broke on first use. Not able to use or repair and Amazon says NOT eligible for return. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
reviews.review_header: I should have listened. Handle broke on the very first use. Wasted my money.......and the beans i carried from Puerto Rico.

reviews.review_text: After 4 months the steamer stopped working. I stopped using the steamer and eventually gave it another try 3 months later. The steamer worked once and then stopped again. The espresso maker stopped working after 6 months of purchase. I have not tried to see if it works again. I still have it. Perhaps I overused it? I made espresso for my husband and I in the mornings and then again at dinner time, everyday.
reviews.review_header: After 4 months the steamer stopped working. I stopped ...

reviews.review_text: I owned the first generation of this product. It lasted about a year with moderate use and came out far ahead when compared to daily trips to Starbucks. Rather than tweak an already good machine, it's obvious they took the we need to make it cheaper approach to increase margins. Everything is now cheap and flimsy from the decanter handle to the milk frother. Overall, functionally it works the same as the first generation. The performance at least has not suffered. It works ok. The first generation I bought for <30 and was a far better deal. The only improvement to this model is the power indictor (which the previous model did not have). Update: After 9 months of once a day use, it exploded like everyone else's. Coffee grounds and a mess everywhere. Looking at the filter basket locking mechanism, it's pushed out. I imagine that the constant pressure of pushing hot water thru the filter basket stressed this area to failure. It's plastic..I don't see it as a if it is going to fail but when IMO. The previous generation did not have this issue.
reviews.review_header: Update: Exploded, - Didn't last as long as previous generation.....

reviews.review_text: I didn't like this product and returned it. The steam never lasted long enough to actually froth the milk. The button on the left hand side was stiff and hard to turn off then to steam with 1 hand. You needed to hold the machine down with 1 hand while you turned the knob with the other, then hurry up and put your milk up to the steam wand before all the steam was gone. I usually had to microwave the milk if I actually wanted it hot
reviews.review_header: Not a satisfied customer on this product

reviews.review_text: Always smelled like burning plastic, ran white vinegar and a few other suggested concoctions to get rid of the smell. Melted the top right of the plastic away from the metal panel, knob broke on third use. Three uses for $35, I'll buy a nice one from now on.

This expresso maker, if you use the frother, is A LOT of work. Every time you use it, you need to do 10 steps--some easy, others time consuming. I want to relax after I make a latte. Also the foam was just huge bubbles no matter what I did and what % milk I used. Very disappointing.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: We actually returned this item the day that we got it. I have the Mr. Coffee Grinder which I absolutely love it is great quality and sturdy. I had hoped that since the grinder was good the espresso machine would be too. It was not. If you are trying to recreate something that you buy from a café at home sadly this is not the machine to do it. I prefer my basic French Press, Which Mr. Coffee has a great one with replaceable parts.
reviews.review_header: If your trying to make coffee comparable to cafe qualtiy this is not the way

reviews.review_text: This machine is horrible. I have had many espresso machines, but this is by far the worst. After 30 minutes, you will be rewarded with a couple drops of coffee. Only too bad I missed the return window, as we were out of town. Hopefully I can prevent others from purchasing this machine.

Makes espresso and steams milk. Undesirable smell and taste from the water reservoir is hard to ignore. Perhaps it's going away, or perhaps I'm getting used to it. Smells like foreign made plastic or metal. Not a good thing when trying to enjoy coffee, espresso, or cappuccino.
reviews.review_header: New Machine Smell Won't Go Away

reviews.review_text: I only used a couple of times and frother stopped working. I had the older version for many years and it worked great but had to replace. The newer version appears to be changed and the steamer no longer works after only a couple of uses.
reviews.review_header: I had the older version for many years and it worked great but had to replace

reviews.review_text: I have purchased 3 of these, dum dum me. Handle of brew basket on first one broke within 6-8 mos. Couldn't replace brew basket as they weren't making them anymore. So bought a second entirely new one. Metal strap around carafe which anchors handle to the carafe itself came off b/c a plastic piece inside the handle to which strap is secured broke. Owned this one 7 months. Note: both of these were purchased for my vacation home, so they weren't used all that much. I bought a 3rd one for my regular home when my Braun finally went after 20+ years (but before the metal strap on 2nd one broke, so I didn't have the full picture yet). The carafe handle is very loose and wobbly and one knows that it's just a matter of days or weeks before that breaks. This one is less than 6 months old. The machines themselves seem to work fine but it's annoying to have the parts keep breaking. My next espresso maker will most certainly not be a Mr. Coffee.

This is my second purchase; first one lasted about 2 years, using about 3 - 4 times a week. Makes 2-3 cups of coffee. The filter basket unit cracked once, bought a replacement about 8 months ago The handle cracked and steam started escaping from the filter assembly; could not get a replacement part, hence bought the entire unit. Most other units for this size with steam are a lot more expensive, so I'd rate this as value for money but not necessarily great.

Cap is /could become hard to open. No real way to grip it... Overall not as well built or easy to use as the Kupp i am replacing afte 15 years (it finally gave out). The handle on the carafe has broke after a short time. Fortunately i have the one from my old one (the 15 year old one).
reviews.review_header: Overall not as well built or easy to use as the Kupp i am replacing afte ...

reviews.review_text: The old saying he true you get what you pay for. I have had this espresso maker for over 3 months and my coffee still tastes like melted plastic. I have wash it out, poured steaming hot water through it, let the water and soap soak over night nothing helps. I drink white coffee and whenever I have gotten it anywhere else it's clear espresso, with this machine it comes out a yellowish-green color. I would not buy this machine if you are picky about your coffee, spend a little extra and get something that is going to work and taste better.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for..

reviews.review_text: I've now purchased this thing 3 times. It's cheap and easy to use and works well... For about a year. Then it falls apart and stops working. I'm done and buying a slightly more expensive espresso maker that won't die after a year

We had a Krups coffeemaker/espresso machine combo for nearly 20 years. The espresso maker finally gave out. After reading reviews, I decided that for the money, this little unit sounded like a good deal. However, the frothing arm is short, making it difficult to get my milk pitcher in and out. The worst thing is that after less than two years of minor use (once or twice a month), the heating unit seems to have quit working. It's very disappointing ocnsidering that our previous unit lasted for so longer with higher usage. I guess you truly get what you pay for. If espresso at home is important to you, choose a different machine!

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Do NOT buy! This machine barely worked a week before it started leaking steam from every crack. Two months later and it leaks more water/steam out the top, bottom and sides than in condenses into the expresso. I have this on my kitchen counter and it is ruining my top cabinets because it leaks steam straight up, into them. I also have to place a towel underneath the machine, for the bottom leakage. Expresso is made but with a lot of mess, a lot of waste and at the expense of my cabinets.

Think first before buying this machine, Mr. Coffee is a name brand and I do like their product. This model is cheap and guess you get what you pay for. Bottom piece is plastic and moves around. I had to tape it so it would not move. It just sit there. It is not need but you do need it for the height so the coffee does not spill. That is why I put tape. It works fine but to use the cappuccino steam you need to add more water. Caution cause right after you do the brew part. It is very hot and the water will pop up so stand back. You could let it cool off a bit. You coffee will cook down too. I own a Maxim Espresso which is very solid maker......

We used it three times and found the coffee to be hot and strong. If you only want to make small batches of strong coffee, it is a good choice. The milk steamer is a different story. It will foam the milk for a short time and once the pressure drops, the foam immediately settles. What we found disappointing was that the milk remained cold or lukewarm. The small amount of pressurized steam is not enough to increase the milk temperature to 150 degrees, what the manual claims. We used only a small amount of milk (about 2-3 oz.) straight from the refrigerator and after frothing stopped (and the foam disappeared), the milk temperature was about 80 degrees F. or less. So we are returning the machine and will choose a standard drip coffee maker that brews coffee with very hot water.
reviews.review_header: Strong coffee, but the milk steamer is not what it should be

reviews.review_text: I never had an espresso maker before and this one is just fine for my purpose, which is just to make espresso; I'll probably never use the other features. The price was good for this sturdy little machine; it doesn't take up much room on the counter, and the flat top is ideal to store things. I experimented only twice with the amount of coffee required to make a (very) tasty cup; experimenting is necessary due to personal liking, and grind and type of coffee. The machine is quiet and fast. The more I use it, the more I like it. There are some cons, for me anyway. The screw-on cap for the water reservoir is nice to look at, but is totally non-ergonomically shaped. It's almost impossible to get a good grip on it because of its sloped sides and smooth texture. The handle on the side to turn for "Steam" or "Brew" is very similar and difficult to use. I don't like these at all. I also don't like the lag time between cups because you have to wait awhile for the pressure inside the machine to drop before unscrewing the awkward cap. And super-lefties beware: the carafe MUST be poured with the right hand because of the placement of the little "V" in the carafe where the coffee is diverted to flow into a cup. I'm an ambidextrous lefty so it's not a problem, but the first time I tried to pour using my left hand, I saw this could be an issue for lefties. All in all, I'm satisfied. I hope it lasts for awhile.

Okay. When it first comes it really stinks like a factory and you have to use it a few times to get the smell out the espresso part works OK but the milk froth or does not work at all the knob is too hard to turn and the cord to go on the wall is way too short there's no way for me to maneuver I give this a zero star
reviews.review_header: When it first comes it really stinks like a factory and you have to use it a ...

reviews.review_text: After using this machine maybe 5 dozen times the Carafe handle broke straight off. It was due to a cheap piece of plastic breaking off inside of the handle. I have never put the carafe in a dishwasher or been "hard" on it. I contacted Mr. Coffee's warranty department and asked for a new one on warranty. The told me that it was my fault the handle had broken off and sent me to a link to buy a new one (which was half the price of the machine). Too bad really, the machine is great, but the carafe is built very cheaply and the companies support is awful.
reviews.review_header: Great Espresso Machine, Terrible Product warranty and support.

reviews.review_text: poor design they give you a 8" plug that does not reach anything let alone a wall outlet. How cheap can you get ? Steamer stem is located in the rear on the right side making it difficult to operate while manipulating steam knob on the left. which is not easily turned . Machine is tiny and underweight, moves too easily.
reviews.review_header: poor design they give you a 8" plug that does ...

reviews.review_text: I've had this machine less then a month and it's already broken. I loved this machine at first, it was my first espressor machine, and there was nothing better than learning how to make yummy cappuccinos. However it is a cheap machine, and I got my money's worth for a few weeks of operating. I was very tender with it, and cleaned it every time thoroughly. Looks like I will have to invest in a machine that can make more then 20 coffees consecutively without crapping out.
reviews.review_header: I loved this machine at first

reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace one I owned for four years. The old one worked perfect until the heating element quit. I thought this was ok as I made coffee more than once a day for the four years and no problems. This new Coffee make looks like the old one but it is not the same. It is not as sturdy as the old one. Now for the really bad part. My wife was making a cup of coffee one morning and she left the room for a minute when all of a sudden the cup that holds the grounds explodes off the maker splashing HOT coffee and grounds all over the kitchen. We just assumed she did not get the grounds cup secured and we were careful from then on. Now just the other day I was making a cup of coffee being careful to get the grounds cup tight. I was in the kitchen when the coffee maker started spewing steam from around the grounds cup and I ran out of the kitchen just as the grounds cup exploded off the unit again dousing thew kitchen in hot coffee and grounds. I am afraid to use this coffee maker now and will most likely destroy it and put it in the trash. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS COFFEE MAKER!!

Please listen to the reviews on this one. I really needed to replace my espresso machine on a budget and took a chance on this despite the negative reviews. The first time I used this, it spit hot water and steam everywhere. Now I am having issues returning it. Do not buy this!!!!

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: i dont like that every single time i finish make coffe i must unplugg the espresso maker in order to release the preassure
reviews.review_header: i dont like that every single time i finish make coffe i ...

reviews.review_text: Maybe it's user error, but I don't think the manual tells you to add enough water for making a cappuccino, in the sense that after your shot comes out, not enough water is left to steam/froth the milk! I tried adding water after seeing the frothing unsuccessful and maybe because it didn't get "boiled" from the brewing step, the water doesn't produce any steam to froth the milk. The frothing aide is also a bit short. I bought two frothing pitchers for this machine (12 & 20 oz) and tried the 20 oz first and there is no way the wand would be even half way...I'll try again with the 12 oz, but I'm unsure that'll be successful too. As an espresso/cappuccino maker, it's fast and brews quite well...the newer generation may have a better wand if frothing milk is a must!
The metal is so poor quality is got black and I almost got poisoned. Very bad quality.
I hate this product-too late for return-it make everything taste like cheap warm metal

I had to replace the plastic cover over the steam nossile with one from an old machine to get it to work properly and the filler cap sure was not designed with anyone with any kind of problem with their hands. it is very hard to grip
reviews.review_header: I had to replace the plastic cover over the steam ...

reviews.review_text: So after opening this, I expected to have to clean it, but I didn't expect it to have as much trash and manufacturing byproduct in it as I did. The first time I steamed milk, it tasted like licking a circuit board (semi-expected) so I figured after running a bunch of steam through it it would go away. However, much to my dismay, I looked in the cup I used to catch the steam and water that was shooting out and there were metal and plastic particles in the water! I was absolutely shocked. So I ran more steam through it (filling it up to it's max with water and letting it all go through the steamer) probably at least 6 times, and each time metal and plastic came out. When I finally stopped getting particles out of the steamer, I tried to steam milk again, and it still tasted like circuit board. I thought it would've been well clean by now, but it wasn't. Then I switched over to the espresso side to see what would happen, and when the water came out I found a white flaky substance in the water. Again, horrified, I decided to clean it, only this time I stepped up my game and used part for part vinegar and water. I let it go through the steamer about 3 times, and the espresso part 3 times (both times using the entire tank for each cleaning). Then, and ONLY then, did I stop seeing mysterious particles in the water and the coffee/milk started tasting like it should. I was shocked it wasn't more clean than it was. Seriously, I probably could have sued them had I documented all of the contaminants I found in the water after cleaning it so much. That aside, as an espresso machine for a novice barista, it works well. Easy to use, easy to clean, steams milk well, brews espresso well. No bells and whistles, but it fits my needs and makes a good latte once you get the hang of it. Decently priced, so that always helps. But please, please clean it extremely thoroughly before you use it. Hopefully you won't have as much trash and residue in yours as I did mine, but if you get rid of it by cleaning it well it works fine.

If the device is not warmed up, you will notice the first cup of coffee will be a little cold. I would leave the water reservoir top loose until boiling then seal for a hot brew. I purchased my device in July of 2014. It lasted until July 2017. The plastic on/of knob on the left broke off. I will not purchase again. The on/off mechanism was tough to use with wet hands or while cooking anyway.
reviews.review_header: OK espresso maker, but I will not purchase again.

reviews.review_text: Decent machine for the price...does the job. Instructions could be clearer. If all you want is basic espresso, it's a no-brainer...but determining the right amount of water to make a cappuccino or latte is more complicated. It's easy to run out of steam too fast, and unless you carefully regulate the amount of pressure, you'll have milk flying all over the place.
The carafe broke within three months, there is also a leak from the sides of the machine. Have just passed the days limit, and would not recommend this product.
reviews.review_header: and would not recommend this product

reviews.review_text: It has a melted plastic smell every time it's used. We were hoping it'd go away with use. It hasn't. I can smell it a few rooms away. I have a really good sniffer though.
reviews.review_header: Given the opportunity to go back, I would not have bought this.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: A terrible metallic smell permeated throughout my entire house on first use...tried cleaning with recommended procedure and it didn’t go away. Makes undrinkable beverages and is such a waste. I’ve tried contacting manufacturer and seller to no response or avail. Avoid this product and seller at all costs!!

We're still in the trial stage of using the espresso machine. So far, the flavor is there. I haven't made any cappuccino yet; so, I can't rate that part. The only downside I've encountered thus far is that the espresso doesn't stay hot very long, and it doesn't come out that hot from the machine. Maybe there's a break-in period? Still, I finally have an espresso maker that makes espresso that tastes the way I remember it.

Do not buy! I have had several Mr. Coffee Espresso machines and not had trouble until this one. It comes with a warning to not put the Portafilter in the dishwasher and here's why...the screw that connects the handle on the Portafilter to the basket that actually holds the coffee is made from metal that rusts! It fell apart after a couple of months even without putting it in the dishwasher and the replacement Portafilter for it is 1/3 the price of a new machine. Ridiculous.
reviews.review_header: Do not buy! I have had several Mr. ...

reviews.review_text: I bought this machine on December, two months and a half later it has fallen apart! The black plastic part that covers the milk steamer got broken after using it twice! The coffee pot handle got broken as well after one month!! I have tried to use it again but the milk frothed makes a very very loud noise when I use it and the coffee pot is too hard to handle! It is not worth the money we payed!
I will try to return this.
reviews.review_header: Lasted 59 days before the handle broke off

reviews.review_text: cheap plastic.... made 5 cups of coffee, they all tasted like the inside of the coffee maker, NOT the coffee itself. Returned it.
reviews.review_header: Coffee taste like the plastic of the maker

reviews.review_text: TERRIBLE. This is our THIRD machine in 4 months. We have had to have them all replaced. They all blow up from the steam after a few uses. Now they will not replace them. So not purchase this item. Save yourself time and money and purchase the better machine.
reviews.review_header: TERRIBLE. This is our THIRD machine in 4 months

reviews.review_text: It does the job for making your expresso or cappuccino but I find the product does not heat well. To foam the milk for the cappuccino, I have to turn the expresso off. By the time I pour the foam into my expresso, it is lukewarm. If it would heat up more, I think it would be a better product.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for...

reviews.review_text: I'm a huge coffee drinker and was tired of spending $5 per drink so I decided to purchase this. The first machine I received was defective, the water pressure flipped and started sucking up milk from the frothing wand. Requested refund and they send me a replacement instead. The replacement leaked from the frothing wand and while frothing, the black frothing wand piece broke. It fell into my drink.. the production of this machine is horrible and I truly wouldn't waste my money. I'm requesting a refund.

This is a coffee maker,really this Mr.coffee ECM160 do not work like steam espresso. Do not waste your money in this coffee maker. The coffee comes warm and do not comes hot like steam espresso that I wish to be. I use to have others models of Mr. Coffee that work great but this one really do not work like suppose to work. Do not waste your money, this coffee maker work like a coffee maker but do not work as an steam espresso.
reviews.review_header: coffee ECM160 do not work like steam espresso

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Doesn't produce foam at all. This is my 4th Mr. Coffee espresso machine but this model is the worst.
reviews.review_header: Coffee espresso machine but this model is the worst.

reviews.review_text: This simple little machine makes a good espresso but... it does not come with a frothing cup, the sleeve on the frothing arm pops off into your steamed/frothed milk and the cap on the water chamber needs to be tightened further and further with each use. Simple engineering will tell you that this means that the water chamber and the threaded opening are expanding during the heating process and not retracting/contracting once cooled. Eventually there will be a complete loss of vacuum which will render the unit useless. I would not recommend this item.
reviews.review_header: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.review_text: I purchased Mr. Coffee system, needing a quick replacement to my Bella espresso machine. The Bella machine lasted over 5 years and only quit working after I forgot to turn it off for 24 hours. The Mr. Coffee unit was slightly more expensive, but I do not like the milk steamer at all. I make a mess every time and can not get a good froth to milk. I like the compact size of this type of machine and will be going back to the Bella brand.
reviews.review_header: I much prefer the Bella unit

reviews.review_text: UPDATE ON 14 MAR 10: Well I originally had nothing but praise for this machine in the first month of operation but after that I became sorely disappointed with it. The frothing arm is too easily blocked. I clean the chamber and frothing arm regularly but it seems that after a few weeks, it simply won't steam anymore. Additionally, before it stopped steaming altogether, the blockage would cause what I considered to be a significant safety hazard. The machine would not steam, but then eventually explode spewing steam and espresso all over the kitchen. I still use this machine when I want a Cafe Americano or just espresso shots but I definitely regret buying it as I can no longer steam milk or do anything else fancy. ORIGINAL REVIEW: First I'll preface my review by saying that while I like espresso drinks, I'm NOT a hardcore coffee snob. On a scale of 1-10, with 1 being "I only drink hot chocolate" and 10 being "I only drink the finest coffees straight from Columbia," I'm probably about a 7. So when I decided to give my coffee maker a break and mix things up a bit, I was pretty intimidated seeing espresso machines running upward of $300. Clearly I was not in the market for something that expensive but I also didn't want something so cheap and worthless that I would never use it. This thing is a home run. It's easy to use, reasonably stylish, works great, and is priced just right. Although the process of making espresso drinks is much more involved than making a pot of coffee, I find myself going the extra mile often because the flavor is just so much more pronounced. I really can make drinks on par with the local coffee shop for what seems like pennies (espresso uses fewer beans than a pot of coffee too)! You probably will need some practice to get the process down and find out how best to set up the machine for what you're trying to make (i.e., figuring out how much water you'll need to still have steam available after the espresso is brewed) but after that, it works great. I fully recommend this product and do yourself a favor and get a frothing pitcher, thermometer, and tamper to make it as smooth as possible.
reviews.review_header: UPDATE: Well I was thrilled at first BUT...

reviews.review_text: Pretty much what I expected. It broke after a few months of using it nearly every day. But it was cheap. I didn't like the plastic frothing nozzle - it made the milk bubble instead of froth. So I removed it when frothing which probably lead to the machine breaking. All in all it was a good starter espresso machine for a good price. Now I am switching to a delonghi ec155m. (Edit: when I purchased this item it was $35)

Gift for my son that lives a good distance away. The steamer doesn't work and in general nothing works. I can't return it until he brings it to me. I m so sorry this didn't work as I bought it early due to me having a total knee replacement on Nov 2, 2015 as a Christmas gift for him and his wife.

Updated Review 8/2017 so yes i was correct the left knob broke off after 3 years of use. I would say i got the most out of it. Probably will invest in a Ninja... Bought in 2014 - If you drink coffee at least once a week or more you should get another machine, not this one. Yes i definitely agree with the other reviews here. The knobs are smooth little difficult to turn. The frothing rod is NOT long enough. Construction is made poorly, kinda flimsy, i sometimes feel i might bend it too much or break it. will probably invest in another machine...

The machine worked genuinely as I expected. The black cover on the steamer handle started to pull off but was still usable. At one point after only a few months of usage, a piece broke off and caused the pot to explode and spray me with near boiling espresso. I have alerted the company and they seemed responsive, but I don't know if this is a product defect or an unfortunate freak accident. I was glad I wasn't looking at the pot when it exploded, I only got minor burns on my arm. Doesn't even look like it will scar much.
reviews.review_header: Cheap Machine for a cheap price. Possibly dangerous

reviews.review_text: Just terrible. I have to hold lid on when I pour the coffee or the lid falls off. Cap for the water is difficult to get on and off.. The stem that comes out of the coffee holder comes off constantly and has to be put back on. The coffee it makes is awful. It's so bad it's almost funny. I would not buy this or anything of this brand ever again. Please, please, don't waste your money.
reviews.review_header: Just terrible. I have to hold lid on when I ...

reviews.review_text: Everything works great, except for the fact that there's this TERRIBLE taste that the water reservoir leaves behind in the milk and I've tried so many ways to clean it, but it just doesn't work. Sucks I never got the protection plan. And I waited too damn long to test it out.
reviews.review_header: Everything works great, except for the fact that there's this TERRIBLE ...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I can't wait to replace this with something better. The coffee seems to always burn and the frother is terrible - spills out everywhere and makes a terrible mess. I liked the idea of it but I am going to get something more expensive next time.
reviews.review_header: I can't wait to replace this with something better. The coffee seems to always burn and the ...

reviews.review_text: This particular model has a warped bottom and the rubber feet don't touch the counter! The coffee it brews is substandard and coffee is weak no matter how much i filled the basket / tamping. I did not explore a finer grind yet. Previous models were much better in terms of design / coffee. Previous models were just as cheap (plus) and don't last for more than 1 1/2 year. That is to be expected. For instance the clip breaks off easy and the plastic handle crumbles over time. This model has an awful plastic smell to it when it heats up. Materials are now too cheap and crossed a line. Please don't buy this one. I give it two stars (should be one) to reward the low price and probably because previous models had some charm and actually made a decent coffee.

The milk wand on this sucks..... You're better off frothing your milk on the stove. If you do have to use the milk wand, preheat your milk, otherwise it takes FOREVER to heat it up. When I use it to make espresso, it does fine until about 1/2 way through and then it starts to splutter and spurt espresso everywhere. The cord is also ridiculously short (Like less than 1 foot long). I had to get an extension cord just to use it.
reviews.review_header: The milk wand on this sucks..

reviews.review_text: This espresso make works well just as it describes, but it is also missing key features that makes it easier to use. For one, it will brew the ENTIRE tank of water if you do not watch it. There is NO auto-shutoff feature. The filter and holder IMMEDIATELY rusted once I washed it. It also kept putting these white chips of something in the coffee as water passed through the filter. I had to brew about 30 cups to make this stop. MAKE SURE YOU DO THIS FIRST. Also, the frother has a plastic cover over the metal piece. Just cleaning the outside will not work. You have to make sure you take the plastic piece off to clean the milk from the metal pipe. This is a HUGE design flaw. And finally, the machine cannot brew and froth at the same time and there is not regulator for either. It either all ON or all OFF. I wish I would have spend more money on an espresso machine that included all the features lacking in this one.
reviews.review_header: Product is okay for the money you spend.

reviews.review_text: I take my coffee drinks with drink almond milk and stevia which is hard to find in the coffee shops. So I simply wanted something to make 2 shots of expresso that I could pour over ice, almond milk & stevia. Works great for that!! Is it the machine perfect, no? Its spits a little so I have to wipe the counter a bit but its not a huge problem. It has a foaming option and according to the instructions you can make more but I can't rate those things. But if you just want to make expresso shots, its a good, relatively cheap option. Update: the "Spitting" has not improved. I now use my stovetop espresso maker 90% of the time.
reviews.review_header: OK little machine for espresso shots

reviews.review_text: Sigh. Our Mr. Coffee ECM160 arrived April 23rd 2014. Used an average of 7 cups a week. The espresso maker actually worked fine (see one star reviews from those persons who were not as fortunate) as well as the frothing gizmo. Unfortunately the On-Off knob broke Sept. 22nd 2014. I was astounded to see that the rotator insert was a flimsy piece of plastic and could not be fixed. Sooo... If the ECM160 works as advertised for a sufficient length of time it is a good deal. But be forewarned, Cheap Parts Break With Normal Use. Your mileage may vary.
reviews.review_header: The espresso maker actually worked fine (see one star reviews from those persons who were ...

reviews.review_text: An unbelievably shoddy product. The cheap plastic handle literally FELL off after a a month-and-a-half rendering the product completely useless. Since this occurred outside the return/exchange date, we were stuck with it. A total waste of money!
reviews.review_header: The cheap plastic handle literally FELL off after a a month-and-a-half rendering the product completely useless. Since this occurred outside the return/exchange date

reviews.review_text: This product has a heavy metal smell in the water reservoir. Upon steaming, the frother leaves the metal smell and taste in the milk resulting in an unpleasant latte. I would not recommend purchasing this product it seems unsafe.
reviews.review_header: I would not recommend purchasing this product it seems unsfafe

reviews.review_text: This product is ok, kinda cheaply made and I would not recommend for daily use. Was what we needed for our cabin but do not expect it to be an everyday machine
reviews.review_header: Ok, kinda cheaply made, not for daily use

reviews.review_text: This machine smells strongly of burning plastic while it's brewing. I can't get the smell out of my nose to enjoy the coffee. What a shame...
reviews.review_header: I can't get the smell out of my nose to enjoy the coffee

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Not the biggest fan. Bought a Mr. Coffee espresso maker at Walmart for $40, loved it but it wouldn't brew after a few months. Decided to try this one out. The wand is hard plastic and I don't feel like it froths very well. The coffee has a very strong metallic taste. I have ran vinegar through it a couple times to try and clean it and still no luck. I passed the return date by 1 day:( will keep as a back up but probably purchase the one at Walmart again.
reviews.review_header: loved it but it wouldn't brew after a few months

reviews.review_text: taste horrible. coffee tasted like cheap plastic, when we tried the source of it, it was the lid for the water reservoir. it smell like those non food grade bowls from the dollar store!!!
Cheap fabrication - it broke on the first use. the knob switch broke on the first spin. we returned the item

I'm no coffee snob, not looking for a perfect cup of espresso but want to be able to make a mocha every morning and get a little fancy without having to pay $5 a day. This is the perfect little machine for that. It gets the job done! With that said, I had this for about a week working perfectly until one day I went to froth the milk and noticed, half my milk was missing out of the carafe. Early morning me thought I was going insane. Where could the milk have gone? I thought maybe I had just not put as much milk in as I thought, looked everywhere in case I had a small stroke and poured it out somewhere random. Checked the condensation line on the carafe and I had indeed had more milk in there. Open the water reservoir on the machine and there was my milk. It had inverted pressure and sucked it back up into the maker. I have read a good majority of the reviews on the product and never saw that mentioned, so I am hoping it was just a freak thing. Packed it back up, sent it back to amazon who sent me a new one and have it up and running fine. If this new one works out well I will come back and give more stars, but until it proves its worth, it only gets 3 stars. Update- I have had my replacement maker for a few weeks now. I have to say I kind of miss the old one. The frother on this machine isn't as consistent with heating as the last one, however, this one also hasn't inverted milk. I just opt to only use the espresso maker and nuke my milk in the microwave (I know, sacrilege). Cheap machine. If you want more, then pay more on something different.
reviews.review_header: Great for a week...then it broke

reviews.review_text: Very happy with this little machine, especially for the price! Could never get the milk steamed properly, but it heated up and that was enough. Unfortunately, 9 months later, steam started escaping through the machine, warping the plastic. Then the control knob came off and can no longer be used to switch the machine between Off and Brew or Steam. Up until then I was very happy with it! A few months in, the metal steamer was very loose - not sure how it's connected to the water tank, or if that played a part in the machine breaking. In short, don't expect it to last for very long, and repairing it (even in warranty) seems like more effort than getting a new one.

This thing is terrible. I have to add more water than I typically would because the milk steamer blows out considerable amount of steam even when it's not on. I have to have a jar underneath the vent to collect water vapor. Piece of crap.
reviews.review_header: This thing is terrible. I have to add more water than I ...

reviews.review_text: This was meant to replace my 20yr old Krupps. It brews well but the frothing leaves much to be desired. I enjoy a big, thick foam and this thing just doesn't deliver that. It CAN produce a creamy, marshmallowy foam if you take the time to build it. I'll say this IS very easy to operate so if a body is new to the experience this is a good starter machine.

This is OK, but I don't like the smooth features of the cap and power selector. Put some ridges on them. When you're dealing with steam you want a good grip on the controls and these smooth knobs don't provide that. Also, its not possible to bleed off residual steam pressure when it's turned off. And thirdly the little arm the is supposed to hold in the filter basket while dumping out the used grounds is too short and the basket tumbles out anyway, spilling hot grounds everywhere.
reviews.review_header: It works, but I won't buy another.

reviews.review_text: DO NOT BUY THIS. The first time I used this I gently turned the knob to make the espresso and the whole knob just broke off- the plastic literally broke in half. I tried to return it but seller doesn't allow returns. So upset I wasted money on something that doesn't work.
reviews.review_header: So upset I wasted money on something that doesn't work

reviews.review_text: There is a metallic taste that does not go away no matter how many times it is washed or used. It doesn't matter what type of coffee is used either. I would not recommend this to anyone. Everything functions fine but the taste it leaves is awful.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Ive only made a few lattes but the machine works fine, gets the job done. The handle on the coffee filter is fairly fragile plastic though and cracked after a couple uses.
reviews.review_header: ... only made a few lattes but the machine works fine, gets the job done

reviews.review_text: You really get what you pay for. Terrible plastic outgassing smell after brewing, strange flakes in coffee (plastic?). Called Amazon, got a refund and am sending this product back to them for their teams to look into. I don't want to drink toxic coffee! Will be purchasing a stainless steel simple stove top espresso maker.
reviews.review_header: Noxious smell, poor quality...you get what you pay for.

reviews.review_text: The only good thing on this contraption is a side steamer, nothing else. I tried brewing and at best only less than half of pitcher ever comes withing LIKE FEW FREEKING DAYS, OMG !!!. The side knob regulator is very hard to turn either way, God forbid you get it wet, then slip and slide and no turn. Whole Bunch of noise and steam and for what a $40 Steam Frother is all you get out of it. Although the finished product tastes awesome, where is the rest ??!!. Anyway folks, look for a better machine that does not take few days to make your espresso !.....
reviews.review_header: VERY SLOW, YOU ONLY GET HALF OR LESS OF FINISHED PRODUCT OUT !

reviews.review_text: This is a good machine. To get the most out of it you may have to change the brand of coffee to get the espresso of your choice. REVISED I had espresso machines before and never had the problem I had with this one. After four uses it literally exploded. Am returning and have reservations about buying another from this company. This is a piece of garbage that looks good but that it. Spend extra and get a good espresso maker.
reviews.review_header: This is a good machine. To get the most out of it ...

reviews.review_text: The first time I used this was great! The 2nd time I used the machine, water just drips out of the brew head (extremely slowly) I really thought I would enjoy this product when instead it has been the cause of my morning frustration lately. I'm not far away from just trashing it altogether and never buying an espresso machine again. That's how much I enjoyed this product.
Impossible to find Espresso Filter Holder, ours broke, not sold on Amazon, and the one sold on official website does not work. : FAIL
reviews.review_header: Impossible to find Espresso Filter Holder, ours broke, ...

reviews.review_text: Worked well. But...Black plastic frother cracked after two months. Part is discontinued and unavailable. Not good.

This cappuccino maker is ok and will do what it was designed to do, BUT at the lowest quality possible. And you can forget about making decent froth. The frothing arm will beryl steams the milk and also is oriented in different direction on the right side of the unit so it is more difficult to froth the milk. What you see on the images is photoshopped frothing arm placed there for the purpose of showing buyer that appliance has one, in reality you will not see the arm from that direction. Control knob can be shaped differently so that you can have a good grip on it. All in all it's ok but I would suggest spending at least $100.00 to get quality and performance to really enjoy coffee.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for.

reviews.review_text: The first time I used this it worked perfectly. The second time it just started shooting out steam from everywhere. The expresso comes out good but I no longer use the steamer. I just heat the milk and use a frother. I have no clue if it's just mine that was defective, but I saw similar reviews of this product prior to purchase, but as usual I decided to give it a try and judge for myself. I am revising this review and am changing it to 1 star. After just 30 uses or so it no longer works. Save your money on this one!
reviews.review_header: The expresso comes out good but I no longer use the steamer

reviews.review_text: The machine works but for $30 more you can buy the one that I have at home. This one wad for the office. It isn't horrible it is a little different though. The $70 Mr. Coffee expresso, latte, and cappucino machine is great for the price. It has a big water tank and works great for steam and expresso. Update 12/27/12. It isn't that bad. After using it for a couple of more days I am used to the weird kind of expresso that it makes. Overall it is a good started machine for making expresso but I would not recommend it for someone who wants real expresso.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I was so excited to receive this item in the mail. When it came I unpackaged it. I quickly plugged it in and went step by step on how to work it, even YouTubed it before I attempted. Espresso came out REALLY cold, over-all machine felt like it was too small to do the job because it shook a lot. Milk further was probably the equivalent of the pressure of me blowing a bubble, I was not satisfied 😢😢😢😢
reviews.review_header: Refunded ... 😢 which is sad bc I really wanted this ...

reviews.review_text: This is fairly easy to use and makes fine espresso. The problem is that steam builds up under the round angled bit on top, which you need to untwist to release pressure after use. The steam is obviously hot and pours in a large volume, which is really a dangerous proposition. Absolutely have on long sleeves and a towel to attempt this.
reviews.review_header: Makes fine espresso, but pressure release design is not good

reviews.review_text: Not nearly as much control over the steaming wand as I'd been hoping. I used to work as a barista and was looking forward to being able to create the foam consistency I prefer, but it didn't lend itself to doing so. I've returned it.

The silicone washer inside the knob on top of the unit (where you put the water) has a strong smell and it appears that the smell is still there after using the system for several months. The system does make OK espresso Coffee, however the smell from the silicone washer is not pleasant.
reviews.review_header: The silicone washer inside the knob on top of the ...

reviews.review_text: great coffee maker. im cuban so espresso is a must. ive never been dissatisfied with a mr. coffee product until now. i bought the espresso maker in april of 2012 and here we are in june of 2015, the on/off/steam knob does not work. i dont know if this is a one time defect but like i said, this is the first time for me being not haopy with a mr. coffee product. i have the same one in florida that is over 6 years old and it is still the bomb for making espresso with the head (foam). mr. coffee is a great company and i am awaiting response for an exchange. Hooah!
reviews.review_header: 1st time i am dissatisfied with mr. coffee.not a happy camper!

reviews.review_text: I bought this product during Thanksgiving with high hopes based on the 1000+ reviews it has, but since then I have returned it twice for new units (still with high hopes) and now I am going to refund it. This means I've had a total of 3 of these units sent to me and I'm not satisfied with all of them. Main issue: Water reservoir not clean, made out of material which is not stable.
