I've de-limed the unit , soaked the water reservoir in water overnight (twice) but every time I brew just hot water (no coffee), the water that comes out to the carafe contains silver-white particles (see picture attached, this is after the 12th time I passed water through the unit to rinse out the interior). Looking at the water reservoir, the inside of it looks crudely made and when I used my finger to touch the inner thread where you would screw the top on, silver particles fall off. This is where the water is stored and I have absolutely NO CONFIDENCE in how clean the coffee will be. See the pictures I have attached, the one with plastic around it was the 2nd unit I received which contains white-green gunk. I understand that we have to clean these units but this is too much. I've called both Amazon support and Mr. Coffee support lines and they've all been helpful but if it's a material defect there's nothing they can do.
reviews.review_header: This means I've had a total of 3 of these units sent to me and I'm not satisfied with all of them

reviews.review_text: There was a problem with this unit. The screw on top did not seal properly. The insulating ring inside the screw on top smelled terrible. I was about ready to see if I could return it, but since I have two old units in the garage waiting to be donated, I switched the screw on top from one of them onto the new unit. It works fine now. I gave this one star because of the defective part, but Mr. Coffee steam expresso is normally about a 3 star, maybe a 3.5.
reviews.review_header: Are these units reconditioned, not new?

reviews.review_text: Coffee is critical to me and my family. Would not recommend this product. The handle (that locks the coffee grounds into machine) ALWAYS break. Just purchased a replacement new machine and on FIRST USE handle started to come off. If they could solve the handle breaking problem i think its a good machine. However efectively useless if cant put coffee into it).
reviews.review_header: DONT BUY. Consistantly breaks (even on first use)

reviews.review_text: Worked well for about a month. It began to leak water out of the bottom, I'm suspecting a week tank. It finally cracked enough and it is absolutely useless. And of course Amazon wouldn't let me send it back for a refund.
reviews.review_header: It finally cracked enough and it is absolutely useless. And of course Amazon wouldn't let me send ...

reviews.review_text: Cheaply made, frother is difficult to use and very messy. Tossed it after the 5th use.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: This thing is a piece of garbage! It barely made it 4 months before it failed. Don't waste your money.
reviews.review_header: BURN YOUR MONEY INSTEAD! AT LEAST YOU'LL GET A LITTLE HEAT.

reviews.review_text: Pros: good steam for lattes, doesn't seem to burn coffee as much as last steam espresso maker we had. Con: has a nasty plastic smell, kind of like being in a tire store...makes me question what health considerations went into the manufacturing process. Tried running vinegar through it but didn't seem to help. Will give it a few more days and then return if the smell doesn't dissipate.

I never could get a good cup of coffee from this machine, it always has a metallic taste from the water. I have used this a handful of times in the past year and the handle for the coffee grounds has broken too. Very disappointed with this purchase. It will be going to Goodwill.
reviews.review_header: Spend the extra $$ to get a better espresso machine

reviews.review_text: This worked well for exactly 48 hours. Then it would no longer maintain the pressure to brew the espresso. The steam leaks over the top of the top of the grounds cup and out of the top of the water input.

Our first Mr Coffee Espresso machine was perfect. It didn't take very much counter space and made good coffee. Unfortunately the handles for the coffee holder came off rather quickly but we gorilla glued it back on. Then the handle for the carcade fell off after about a year. We really liked the size and convenience so we bought another one. They must gave gotten a new manufacturer because there is an awful smell that comes from water reservoir and a bad taste in the coffee. I wrote to the company and they graciously sent me a new one. But.. The new one has the same problem!! I'm looking for a new espresso maker that doesn't take much counter space and doesn't smell and taste like chemicals!!! Even after many uses!!
works ok but is a bit of a chore to operate. The steamer doesn't heat cold milk real well. I find I have to first warm milk in microwave and then froth to be hot enough
reviews.review_header: works ok but is a bit of a chore to ...

reviews.review_text: The basket that holds the coffee/espresso doesn't stay locked in place. Once pressure builds up it unlocks and shoots the hot water everywhere! Don't waste your money on this.

i agree with everyone who said there is a strong plastic smell and taste... they are nasty...i also wish the steaming want comes down a little bit more...and you need to put water in the reservoir to steam milk, okay, but the following day you need to make espresso, you cannot gauge how much water is left inside that your espresso becomes so watered down! i regret buying this machine!

This is a very disappointing purchase and I do NOT recommend at all. As other reviewers have noted, the coffee produced is a VERY STRONG DRIP COFFEE, NOT ESPRESSO. It is acceptable to drink as long as you don't try to think of it as true espresso. The picture is for marketing purposes and not an accurate representation. The "frother" is a disaster. It does steam but does not froth the milk no matter which method you use including the booklet's minimal instructions. I used a frothing pitcher, the recommended 2% milk, moved the pitcher in the right direction (both circular and vertical) but GOT ONLY STEAMED MILK, NO FROTH. The frothing wand of the machine also has a tendency to spit the milk upward making a mess. I don't need to start my day with these hassles and still not get espresso and frothed milk. Also mentioned by another reviewer is the design. It's definitely a case of design for eye appeal not utility -- form over function. Despite the appearance of metal, it is made of CHEAP PLASTIC. Look closely at the on/off knob and water compartment cap. That sloping contour is extremely smooth with no surface variation making it VERY DIFFICULT TO GRIP OR TURN. If you have any grip problems with your hands or weakness in your fingers, it's nearly impossible to turn either of these. I'm not a newbie to espresso machines or to frothing the milk. I've had positive experience with another brand machines (no longer made) that is in the same price range. Unfortunately, the company doesn't make the lower $$ machines anymore. I may have to reach deeper into my wallet to buy a better espresso unit but it won't be Mr. Coffee brand (I still like their drip machines though). The reviews here on the Mr Coffee ECM160 4 cup Steam Espresso Machine were mostly positive which is why I bought the machine. In the end, I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND it for anyone else and I regret my purchase. I'm returning it if permitted. UPDATE: Amazon rules do not permit the return of this unit because it is now used and not new. I wanted to clarify also that extreme caution should be used when using the "frothing" feature. When we were using it, part of the spitting I mentioned resulted in droplets of steamed milk landing on the hand holding the pitcher. Your immediate reaction is of course to let go of the pitcher which would only cause greater problems spilling out steaming hot milk. Frothing with Mr. Coffee is not for children.
reviews.review_header: Mr Coffee ECM160 4 cup Steam Espresso Machine

reviews.review_text: Lot of fun to use if you don't mind the taste and smell of plastic. Strongly suggest you not buy this item.
reviews.review_header: Lot of fun to use if you don't mind the taste and ...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I wanted to love this. It was fairly easy to use, but I just can't get past the plastic smell and taste it gives the coffee. I even let this sit with the reservoir lid off and air out for several months, but it still smells like plastic.
reviews.review_header: Makes my coffee smell/taste like plastic

reviews.review_text: Espresso maker - decent; frothing - not so much. It definitely steams/warms milk but WILL NOT produce a froth. And I know how to froth as I've had cappuccino makers previously. I looked at a youtube review and one being reviewed had a rubbery bulbous end frothing wand attachment. I don't know if they recently changed design but one on current model is slender hard plastic and does not do the job. Part of the joy of cappuccino is a nice froth so I will be returning this product.
reviews.review_header: don't buy if froth is important to you

reviews.review_text: I used it only once I and what a strong plastic smell in the espresso and the air in the room. I steamed plain water afew times in order to get rid of the smell, it simply would not go away. then I have cap left open ever since, the bad plastic (or metal coating?) smell just would not go away, 8 months now. I, in the past, had two from Walmart that did not have the smell, purchased this from amzon because Walmart does not carry it now. Could it be the manufacture has changed? Anyway, be aware, this here is definitely a no recommend. I would recommend anyone buying this check the smell and return it within returnable period if the smell is first noticed there, trust me, It just would not go away, it's been 8 months. This is the first and only item I purchased from amazon that's not usable. Thought this may help some people me spending time typing the above.
reviews.review_header: BE AWARE the Bad SMELL simple would not go away.

reviews.review_text: Don't buy stopped working after a week. Followed all the instructions carefully. It just won't make espresso. Its not worth getting burned by steam. Dangerous.
reviews.review_header: Bad buy throwing money away. Cheap plastic parts break after week

reviews.review_text: I was so excited to get this machine. I love making espresso with my stove top machine but I wanted a steam wand for frothing my milk so I decided to buy this. I was so disappointed. The cord is SO short. I have no idea why they would make the cord so short. It barely reaches the plug in when it's sitting on my counter. The frothing arm is too short, close to the machine and doesn't move. I used my cousins Mr Coffee espresso machine (different model) and the arm was flexible and that made it so much easier to get the right angle when frothing. And last, but the worst part about the machine was the plastic/metal smell and taste in my espresso. When I opened the lid to add more water the smeel was overwhelming. I'm sad to return this because I was really looking forward to have a machine, but it just isn't worth the price to me. I'll pay less and get the model my cousin has.

I purchased this Espresso System purely for making espresso. However, when brewing there is usually an overflow of water, so one ends up with half a cup, as well as a watery mess. On reading other reviews it seems that there is always water left in the reservoir. So be warned ! I returned the first Espresso maker for this very reason, but this one was only purchased four months ago.

This machine makes fine espresso and purchased it after having received one as a wedding gift years ago, however, this machine is not built well. Issue 1: I bought it in January and it came with a slight defect, where top box was warped. I decided to live with it b/c I needed a machine and did not have time to replace then. Issue 2: A week ago, April (3 months after I bought it) the plastic knob on the left, which is required to turn on the espresso maker and steamer, broke off when i was turning it on, so now it is completely unusable. this is really unacceptable. I went to Amazon site to return and it has only a 30 day return policy.
reviews.review_header: Good espresso but very poorly build with 30 day window for return.

reviews.review_text: This is the second time I'm purchasing this machine and my new one is having new but similar issues as the first. The machine I received spits hot water while brewing. I cleaned it by "brewing" hot water twice before using. After the first three real brews tasted like burnt plastic, I cleaned it two more times, but it still tastes like plastic. The return process (or lack there of) has been a nightmare. Sunbeam has given me three different processes and none of them are working. Poor seller and poor product. PLEASE REVIEW RETURN POLICY FOR THIS SELLER BEFORE PURCHASING.
reviews.review_header: Know the return policy, I've had poor luck with this seller.

reviews.review_text: It leaks water from the sides, I only used it for about 6months and start giving me problems

It only work properly for 3 days before it decided to stop working. The frothier still functions, but it won't produce the expresso part. What's happening is that it will over heat the water and produces to much steam with very little coffee release from the spout. It was cheap. So it make sense it would break this quickly. Do not purchase this product.
reviews.review_header: It only work properly for 3 days before it decided ...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Do not let the 3-, 4-, and 5-star reviews fool you: this machine really is a plastic piece of junk. It's a cheap piece of junk to be sure, yes, but it's junk nonetheless. To reiterate what other reviews have touched upon, the machine doesn't actually produce 'espresso', but rather a stronger cup of regular coffee--that is, the coffee's as thick and viscous as you'd expect instant coffee, tea, or water to be. The steamer works, but don't expect to get a lot out of it. The coffee machine also doesn't come with a tamper, so if you don't already have one, you can expect a good portion of your coffee grounds to be neglected / wasted every time you brew. During the first 4 weeks of having the machine, all of that was fine. The coffee wasn't spectacular by any measure, but it was passable. More importantly, the machine actually worked. 1 month + 1 day after delivery, however, the machine stopped working completely. The espresso dispenser no longer functions; the steamer no longer steams; the heating element no longer heats. The whole thing simply died. And all this happened exactly 1 day past the return / exchange date. In short, buyer beware. I'll be recommending that my own friends and family avoid the Mr. Coffee brand in the future.
reviews.review_header: Machine Died Exactly 1 Month + 1 Day After Delivery...

reviews.review_text: Very disappointing. I bought it about 6 months ago and only use it once a week, if that. The plastic handle on the frothed broke three months ago. The espresso shots get cold and don't taste right. For the last month the steam doesn't work at all, no matter what I do. Such a waste of time wait for it to work and then it never does. It worked nicely a couple of times but most of the time it's a hassle. And I only bought it for the frother.
reviews.review_header: Such a waste of time wait for it to work and then ...

reviews.review_text: Disappointed in the way in which it froths the milk. and there is constantly some metallic taste in the coffee.
Completely dysfunctional. Maybe I just got a defective one, but the steaming wand did not work at all and everything that came through it tasted strongly of plastic.
reviews.review_header: Just save for a real espresso machine

reviews.review_text: Cheap coffeemaker it takes too long for an espresso. It broke like 2 weeks after use
Make the coffee cold and no make foam ....i don't like it ....

The machine leaks the steam. Also, the video attached is misleading. It shows Mr. Coffee BVMC-ECM260-RB-1 Steam Espresso and Cappuccino Maker, Black but what you actually get is ECM 160. Wrong strategy seller.
Did last knob broke off, high smell of composite

I am a coffee barista, and this machine makes terrible espresso. The machine doesn't get the espresso hot enough and it doesn't brew the espresso quick enough (there is a standard time frame for how long a shot of espresso should be brewed). There is no way to calibrate the machine to fix either problem. I am dissatisfied with this product. I do not recommend purchasing it.
Lasted less than a year before it started clogging up, and slowing down, in spite of daily cleaning.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I've had this for a little over a year and used it less than 10 times. There is a constant toxic, burnt plastic type smell from the lid and the metal canister where you pour the water. This also makes the espresso taste the same way. I couldn't get rid of it no matter what I did. Today the steamer completely stopped steaming all together. You definitely get what you pay for. I wouldn't waste your money on this garbage.

Having lots of trouble with this machine. Made espresso flawlessly first couple of times now it does not seem to be ceiling and water is spewing over the top. Have tried several different things to correct it with no luck. Not sure if I'm going to return it or call the manufacturer and keep tinkering with it.
Terrible. It stopped making espresso on the third time I used the machine. I went through all the troubleshooting, and I had no luck in making the machine work again.
reviews.review_header: Stopped working on the third time I used the machine.

reviews.review_text: Coffee temperature is very low... Barely warm.
The water tank and coffee smells like burned plastic after brewing coffee. Tried clean it with fresh water- same result. Water tank made of very smelly plastic:(((( Returned.
reviews.review_header: The water tank and coffee smells like burned plastic after brewing coffee

reviews.review_text: It was great until it stopped working after the second use. It would boil the water but not actually brew. Troubleshooted it multiple times to no avail. I ended up getting a refund.
reviews.review_header: Stopped working after the second use

reviews.review_text: I don't particularly like the steamer spout on this one but I've gotten use to it. I removed the black plastic sleeve as it made it too hard to clean and works a little better that way. Also the screw to remove filter screen to clean was extremely hard to remove first time and I nearly destroyed it getting it to finally come out.
reviews.review_header: I don't particularly like the steamer spout on this one but I've gotten ...

reviews.review_text: What is with the incredibly short cord that comes with the machine? Could be that's why it's so cheap, they saved money on electrical cord? Otherwise, adequate, very basic machine I can load the night before and just turn on to make cafe latte (will never use the foaming feature) in the morning. Does the job and the price was certainly right. Could go through three of these machines at the price of some of the others. I anticipate the first thing to break will be the knob turning it on/off to brew/steam. Will keep you posted. I use it daily. 2015 Addendum: First one lasted about a year before the heating block died (once daily use on average) and onto second now - cheap enough to be replaced but really, should be built to last more than 350 uses. Getting close to 400 uses on this one so doing better.
To be honest I Was Expecting it to make better espresso but it's. Ok. The biggest problem I have is with the tube that makes the froth. It simply does not make any... Plus over all cheap material
reviews.review_header: To be honest I Was Expecting it to make better espresso but it's

reviews.review_text: I was hoping to use the froth part alone and can't be done.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: Had this for a year, used it only on weekends. The knob that turns the valve was always sort of hard to rotate, but not really that bad. Then last weekend...snap! The connector arm between the knob and the valve sheared off. Best part, it happened when I was done steaming the milk. So now the thing is stuck spewing hot steam out the nozzle all over the place. Had to unplug it and set it in the sink to cool down...lucky it didn't burn me. Took a look; the connector rod was crummy plastic, no way to repair it.

I've owned 3 of these over the period of 6 or 7 years. The first one was amazing. There was enough pressure generated to steam to a nice froth, two cups of milk as well as producing two ounces of espresso. Two or three years later I purchased another. It wasn't quite so nice, the parts were cheaper but it worked well enough. This latest purchase was disappointing and I almost returned it. It's poorly made and I had a hard time getting it to steam the milk after the espresso had been made. I've reversed the process and steam the milk first and toggle back and forth to keep the pressure up in the machine. I will not buy another one. The price has nearly doubled in the past two years and I'll be researching other brands in the future or switching to tea.

I thought I would get practice with this Espresso machine. I cleaned the machine as noted by the instructions and brewed my first cappuccino and the coffee tasted like metal and plastic. I cleaned it with Vinegar and water various times and it still has the same metal/plastic taste. I don't know what to do as my husband threw the box away and I can't even return it.

This machine works ok for the price... pro's. It works, easy to use, easy to clean, very inexpensive! con's. There is always a nasty ozone smell when it's "on" there is some sort of strange paper like substance that keeps plugging the steamer jet, the plastic grounds cup retainer thingy broke off of the handle almost immediately
This was great the first couple of times we used it. Then it exploded. Glass and coffe grounds everywhere, all over my kitchen. It's a miracle that nobody was hurt. Never again.
Not even a year and the handle broke
reviews.review_header: Not even a year and the handle broke

reviews.review_text: Good looking product that doesn't take up much space but the espresso tastes like plastic. I have cleaned it several times but still doesn't work. I followed the directions and decalcified it but still doesn't taste great.
reviews.review_header: Works but can't get that plastic taste out.

reviews.review_text: I bought this in April mainly for it's steamer feature. That's all I used it for, and not even everyday. I haven't had it 6 months and it's broken already. The steamer doesn't work anymore. It simply doesn't do anything when you switch it to steam. What a waste.
It only lasted two months and was not used on a daily basis, not good quality. The black knob on the left side broke from inside while trying to steam milk. Is worthless.
reviews.review_header: not good quality. The black knob on the left side ...

reviews.review_text: Gets the job done BUT will not lose that plastic taste! I've washed the machine multiple times, changed the espresso and the flavors and no matter what the taste will not go away! Very frustrating! Wish I could still return it!!!
reviews.review_header: Gets the job done BUT will not lose that plastic ...

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: I had to come on here and write this review.. as this is the THIRD time this machine has exploded all over my brand new kitchen!!! I continued to use it after the first time as I thought well maybe I didn't have everything on tight. The second time my son used it and it exploded on him and he got burned! It hadn't exploded in a week so I got lazy about watching it to see if the handle was beginning to turn on the coffee holder to the left (as that is what happens.. it blows that piece off) and was washing dishes. Low and behold.. massive steam eruption and coffee grinds all over the wall and counter. My husband heard it explode from the other room and came running wanting to know if I was okay! It is very much a safety hazard along with being a complete mess maker. Before I purchased this I saw the youtube videos of other customers that this happened to, but I thought they just must not have had the top and the coffee container on tight. I was wrong! I make sure everything is on super tight before I brew and yet again it has exploded!! Beyond upset that I wasted $40 on this machine just 3 weeks ago when I should have just bought a pump one. Mr. Coffee is going to be getting a not very nice letter from me. I have bought Mr. Coffee machines for 4 decades but if I don't get a refund .. this will be my last!!
reviews.review_header: DON'T BUY!!!! IT EXPLODES even when everything is on TIGHT!!! VERY Dangerous and should be RECALLED!!

reviews.review_text: Frother was not usable. Not hot enough and not enough pressure.

Carafe cracked within days of purchase while brewing espresso. There is a very strong chemical smell after brewing is complete even after using for a month. Taste of espresso is good for inexpensive unit. We are now past return date by 2 days. Wish the quality of the carafe was made to withstand the heat of espresso.
reviews.review_header: Taste of espresso is good for inexpensive unit

reviews.review_text: Just got mine last night. This morning in anticipation of a nice cup of espresso pour water and filled the holder with Lavazza pre-ground coffee. The result was very disappointing - a dirty coffee -ish looking liquid. No crema whatsoever. Tried twice, just a waste of coffee. Perhaps the reason is that I intended to make ONE demi-tasse (2 ounce) cup. That was exactly what I wanted, not two. I will try to brew two cups as suggested in the manual. If that doesn't work, I am returning it. ...Didn't work. Returning the item. :(

This machine produces a cup of coffee which has a bad foreign taste, a combination of plastic, weird metal and burnt oil. We thought it would go away but after approximately 1400 pots brewed,and multiple cleanings with CLR and also Vinegar, every pot still has the bad taste. Looking elsewhere- can't stand it any more.
reviews.review_header: ... machine produces a cup of coffee which has a bad foreign taste

reviews.review_text: The first Mr. Coffee lasted less than 3 months before it wouldn't steam/froth. After contacting the company and complaining, they sent us a replacement which lasted less than one month before the knob to turn from brewing to frothing/steaming simply broke off. I would not recommend this espresso maker to anyone.
reviews.review_header: Not worth the price - inferior product

reviews.review_text: this product broke and I still haven't returned it. i just bought another one at Macy's. I paid for Asurion kitchen protection on May 24, 2017. How do I go about getting my money back for this product or getting another one. The handles just disintegrated from handling or the heat in a very short time.
Worked okay at first.......2 weeks later, it takes 20 mn to brew 4 shots. Might have had a defective unit. Frothing wand works.

I received a gift card and with it bought this machine for my daughter for Christmas. It broke within 2 months and when I sent it back to Amazon I saw that they charged me a re-stocking fee (for a broken item that they can't resell?) I had spoken to someone and told them I wanted it replaced. Instead all I got was a credit on my acct, $$ deducted too. I called back to check status & they said, 'we can't remove the restocking fee, sorry; you should have sent it back to Mr. Coffee. They should have told me that from the beginning. When I tried to re-order the same thing, it was listed at a much higher price (+ $18.) So, to replace this gift for my daughter I need to spend more $$ for the same darn thing. Very disappointed in the Customer Service, when I'd explained what I needed/wanted. Not impressed.

I've ordered this twice. The first one broke within ten minutes. The second one broke after lasting nearly 2 days. The know on the left is prone to getting stuck or snapping off. The one espresso that I did get out of it was great though, so there's that.
reviews.review_header: you get what you pay for

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: This espresso maker overflows every time I use it, slightly at first and then increasingly with every shot I pull. I seldom use it in my new office, so I didn't notice at first that it was happening every time and making a bigger mess each time. 2 months past the return deadline, I've reached a point where it is unusable.

Go ahead and splurge for a spendy one, this isn't worth it. I read the reviews and I always take them with a grain of salt because sometimes people just don't know how to use the item and leave a bad review, or their expectations were too high, but this item is truly horrible. It makes terrible espresso and it leaks water from the espresso drain. The espresso is always murky, with a large amount of grounds that make their way into the serving cup. The steam wand wouldn't work to save my life, it just gets hot and whistles loudly, but doesn't actually steam any milk. I know how to use an espresso machine, I've worked at different coffee shops with different models, and this one is just terribly made.
reviews.review_header: I read the reviews and I always take them with a grain of salt because sometimes people just don't know how to use the item and leave a bad review, or their expectations were too high

reviews.review_text: Purchased it as a gift, it just sits there because the pieces come needing some kind of special cleaning to use and get a taste that isn't gross. We have not found that way to clean it. I have googled and used all kinds of vinegars to no avail. It is a nice paper weight though.
reviews.review_header: Icky new plastic/rubber taste thats hard to get ride of

reviews.review_text: Although the unit work properly, the control knob on the side of the unit broke after one month of use. The previous unit I had (Mr Coffee, almost identical to this one) lasted over nine years! Not sure why the design was changed on the control knob, but this one is very poor in both design and manufacturing quality.
reviews.review_header: but this one is very poor in both design and manufacturing quality

reviews.review_text: Did great for about 2 months, then the frother went out, and it stopped being able to use all the water in the reservoir, leaving remaining water to get all murky and gross.

It's just not very good as an expresso nor as milk frother. A classic case of being penny wise and pound foolish, as my father used to say, way back in the 1940's. Apparently, as one ages, one needs to refresh those old bromides--because they're good advice.
reviews.review_header: If you're into buyers regret, buy this very low priced item.

reviews.review_text: Quit working after 3 months, little use. Will not replace it.

I bought this machine and was very disappointed. The strong chemical smell coming from the machine was very alarming. I cleaned the machine numerous times and was still unable to get rid of the smell. I made a latte after cleaning it and the chemical smell was still so strong, my three year old asked me if someone was painting. Not good. Unless you want a cup of cancer with your breakfast, buy something else.

Not a good machine, frothing never worked properly, and coffee maker was good at first, then would not brew properly - sputtering and handled just fell off the pot without rough handle, screw just fell out and wouldn't fit any longer. So this machine was expensive for lasting a couple of months, I do not recommend it

I have used these for years now...I just bought a 3rd unit and to my dismay, the interior stinks....literally! I washed it, rinsed it, brewed it and can't get the stench out of the system. Looks like an inferior metal casting job compared to the last unit I retired and it contains some casting release agent or similar that ruins the smell and taste of the brew....time to move to a different maker!

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: If you are using this machine to make caps or lattes do not waste your money. The milk frother does not work properly. There is not enough pressure/steam left in the machine after brewing the espresso to froth or even warm the milk. I used a 12 ounce frothing pitcher with about 5 ounces of milk in it and it wouldn't even warm the milk let alone froth it. I had to pour more water in the reservoir in order to froth milk which takes extra time and effort. So after you brew your espresso it sits there getting cold while you fart around cleaning the grounds out of the filter and reassembling the whole thing again just to brew hot water in order to get enough pressure/steam to froth your milk. I owned this same machine several years ago and it worked great. If you read reviews like I do and judge the worthiness of purchasing a particular product by the reviews, pay attn to the year the review was written. Today is December 10, 2014 and I am on my way to UPS right now to return this crappy machine. You get what you pay for folks. Two reviewers also said this machine malfunctioned to the point where one person got burned and another had his machine blow up! Yikes! Sorry Mr Coffee :-(

bought this refurbished..Don't waste your money.. Makes coffee not espresso its doesn't get hot enough to make steam until last 10 seconds..So you get hot coffee.. The orange light comes on sometimes..

This is an espresso maker that isn't very costly. It made the espresso shots but the milk frother didn't work as well as I wished. I couldn't make cappuccinos like I wanted to but a cold espresso shot is all I need
reviews.review_header: Great espresso machine but not very good milk frother

reviews.review_text: The seal of the arm worked well for a few months; however, it now does not make a proper seal. This causes a huge mess and makes this espresso maker unusable.
reviews.review_header: Seal failure after a few months

reviews.review_text: It already stopped working. What I have had it two months terrible do not buy!
reviews.review_header: What I have had it two months terrible do not buy

reviews.review_text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband, and he was only able to use it a handful of times before the inside started to corrode and make the coffee taste like metal. It worked well while it lasted, but it didn't last long enough.
reviews.review_header: and he was only able to use it a handful of times before the inside started to corrode and make the coffee taste like metal. It

reviews.review_text: This is a decent coffee maker (I'd call it dark cofffee, not true espresso). However, the package did not arrive with all described contents in box. Package arrived missing coffee scooping spoon.
reviews.review_header: Decent coffee maker. Where's my spoon?

reviews.review_text: Product works fine; however, grabbing onto the twist off top and the turn dial on the side is inconvenient...they have been ergonomically designed to look streamlined, but the only place you can grip them is at the point where they touch the coffeemaker itself, and there are no grip insets on them either. This would be VERY challenging to someone who has arthritis. I much prefer the older design.
reviews.review_header: Faulty industrial design, but good cappuccino

reviews.review_text: Worked great the first time I used it. The second time it would not brew. I used distilled water as suggested and followed all directions. I have had a similar model in the past is why I purchased this. I returned it without a problem and plan on ordering same model. Hoping this was just a fluke.
that's why people pay for more than $100 for their coffee machine.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: It worked so well for two years (almost), it stopped working two weeks ago. The water gets heated but does not drip down but just stays inside making this awful sound as if it is going to burst. Did not know they make these products to last only a couple of years. It was good while it lasted, brewed only one cup every two days.
reviews.review_header: It was good while it lasted

reviews.review_text: the 2010 model of this was far more durable.I spluged on a new one when I moved. MISTAKE ! The first one broke in 6 weeks (steam/off/brew ) switch. The second one (foolish of me, but I DO like the size/design) broke in ONE DAY-same problem with the switch !
Never worked properly.Water poured out of frother all the time.
reviews.review_header: Never worked properly. Water poured out of frother all ...

reviews.review_text: Broke and not working in less than 8 months. Wasn't expecting much from a sub $100 espresso maker but I probably used it about 10 times. Surely it should last longer than this. Mr. Coffee used to mean quality, now it's just a level above garbage.
reviews.review_header: Do yourself a favor and buy something else.

reviews.review_text: I couldn't get the steamer to work properly; I was very disappointed with this model I had the previous version of this Mr. Coffee for over 2 years, and I loved it. This one didn't work as well, so I returned it.

The two things you require from a capuccino machine and Mr coffee.disappoints on both. 1. Frother is terrible, even after 2 mins of steaming the froth was not rich or dense. 2. The espresso from the machine was bitter why?..cause the water comes out way too fast and too soon for it to be even hot. Do yourselfa favor and pass on this machine and order the Capresso one available on Amazon like I am doing now.
Made lousy espresso and even worse cappucino. On the bright side, it broke fairly quickly.

I bought this as a replacement to a similar Bella espresso machine that still works, but brews really slow. This machine only worked the first time water was ran through it. Every other time its been used, water leaks out of the chamber/tank inside the unit. It appears the water tank inside the machine might not be sealed right or whatever sealant was used weakened and degraded after hot water passed through it. I was hoping the leak was from me not securing the attachment with the coffee grounds in it tight enough, but this isn't the case. I made sure it was snug and secure and watched the unit while it went through the brewing process and saw water seeping through the seams. Only about half of the water put into the unit process through to the espresso. The other half of the water leaked out and covered the counter top. It's a shame this is such poor quality. I expected more from the Mr. Coffee brand. As a result, I'll be sticking with the Bella brand in the future.
reviews.review_header: Started leaking water after first use.

reviews.review_text: Works just fine, but it takes forever to make just one cup. Steaming makes a long time to prepare, you have to refill the water to steam and make the espresso. Not a convenient machine.
reviews.review_header: Works just fine, but it takes forever to make just one ...

reviews.review_text: This is the third identical espresso machine I have bought in the past year from this brand. All three have quit working in a few months, the last one didnt even last 6 weeks! Five years ago, I bought one of these machine and that one lasted 4 years without an issue, that was why I stuck with this company. But apparently the quality has taken a nose dive. I use this machine everyday, very disappointed. I will never buy another one of their products and will recommend to others to steer clear of them.

name: Mr. Coffee 4-Cup Steam Espresso System with Milk Frother

reviews.review_text: It works well, although the steamer is a little messy if you are not carefull (coffee everywhere), and the cable is a bit too short, like a stove length short.

Machine worked ok but could never get rid of the plastic flavor that the machine had. Just opening up the water reservoir you could smell the plastic smell. Was so disappointed I ended up throwing machine in garbage.
bad, no good, no practical use, take to long to make few cups, very bad to fill water.

The resorvoir cap is fully made from nonefood grade plastic or recicled battery casing , it has a very bad smell, ruins any coffe, i made 20 espressos using the extra strong type espresso coffe, the smell and tast wont get away, this coffe is so bad i send it down the sewer. Previous machine i had for 3 years had inside the cap a metal , this one only plastic so the steam makes contact with the plastic direct, its real bad. Mr. Coffee for me is dead

Consequently, I've left it powered-on overnight a few times in the past few days since receiving it. Time will tell whether this is detrimental to the unit, but at the very least it's irksome to receive a flawed product.

reviews.review_text: Welp! I bought this a few mos ago and its already clogged and wont filter water. Tried running diluted vinegar through it and no such luck. I bought the extended warranty but they referred me to the manufacturer. Hopefully the manufacturer warranty replaces it.

This Is one of the most hideous machines I have ever purchased. At first I thought it had a 'new' smell to it. I washed all the removable parts in soap and water at least five times. I ran water through the machine at least ten times. (This is a lot of extra attention to be paying to something that is new) Every time I have cleaned it the kitchen, the water that ran through it and the cups smell TOXIC. I've had friends walk in and ask what the awful smell was. I heard from Mr. Coffee and they told me to de lime it, which means fill it with white vinegar, let it soak overnight. REALLY? I've invested way too much time with this piece of rubbish already. I have had 3 other steam espresso makers, NONE had these issues. I use the correct coffee grind. There is nothing wrong with the water I use. I know what I am doing, I've been making my own steam Expresso for over ten years. Do NOT purchase this product. Mine is now in the garage ready to be thrown out with the next trash collection. It's not worth the cost of sending it back.

Do not buy!

reviews.review_text: I have bought four Keurig coffee machines in that last 63 months, and used each to brew four cups of coffee per day - not a heavy burden for a machine costing this much. None has lasted more than two years and each lasted a shorter time than the previous one. This lastest, bought last Oct 16 according to Amazon's records, lasted just 121 days - almost exactly a third of a year. Having to replace them at a rate of three per year seems rather extreme, so I've given up on Keurig now and bought something else that brews K-cups. I'll see if it lasts longer - I hope.
reviews.review_header: I have bought four Keurig coffee machines in that last ...

reviews.review_text: I bought this in March and now the water no longer flows correctly from the tube. It fills with water as people don't know it's not working and floods the place. I've tried cleaning but it still clogs up. I'm guessing it's because the poker and the tube are to close and coffee grinds keep getting sucked up into the system. This is just a guess mind you. I don't know how this got the high rating it did. Of course it's past the return policy. I do love the design or look of it but now it's basically a paperweight. My clients also complained the water just did not get hot enough. Ste
reviews.review_header: I'm guessing it's because the poker and the tube are to close and coffee grinds keep getting sucked up into the system

reviews.review_text: Editing my review based on our experience. We have exchanged/returned several of these. Two went back to Amazon, and finally giving up there, we went directly to Keurig for a 3rd. Each failed utterly within a minuscule window of time. The longest we had one work was I think a week or 10 days? Shortest was DOA. I like to give a manufacturer or seller a chance to make it right. I'm convinced with this product, they do not have the ability. Fail city. ********************************************************** Original review below ********************************************************** We have a larger Keurig but it wasn't a great fit for us. It takes up a lot of counter space and is difficult to take with us when we travel. This K-15 unit seems to be a lot easier to live with in that regard. It is smaller and easier to pack away for traveling. I have a 1500 w inverter in my camping trailer to supply AC power off grid. This unit works with that inverter without tripping the overload, so that's a plus. The unit draws about 1.5 watts just resting whether on or "off". Start the brew cycle and the heater draws about 1350 watts for 2 minutes, then 4 watts for 30 seconds while pumping before returning to the 1.5 watt resting load. So if you use it off-grid, you want to unplug it while not in use. You have the option to vary the strength of your coffee by putting in less or more water, but the reservoir must be refilled each brew cycle. It's probably worth mentioning that the first two units we ordered were both defective. One worked perfectly for about 6 cups of coffee, then ceased being able to pump the water after heating. The other had something wrong with the electronics... it never responded correctly to the controls. Amazon customer service was great which emboldened us to try our luck a third time and shazam, we have a winner - the third unit just works as advertised. If it were not for the inconvenience caused by these two non-functional units I cannot think of any reason it would not be a 5 star review.

Don't waste your time and money!!! My 30 day return window closed 3 days ago and the unit just powered off and will not power on again. Checked all circuits and tried another outlet to no avail. Also purchased reusable My K-Cup filter, paper filters and my wife today purchased from Costco about 3 months supply of K-cup coffee pods. Back to the old Tossimo that's 5 years old and works perfectly. UPDATE! Contacted Keurig and they swapped out my K15 for a new K55 Coffee Maker in just a few days. Even though it's much bulkier it has by far so many more benefits (especially flavor). I would recommend you pay a little more and purchase the K55. Keurig K55 Single Serve Programmable K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

I had my last Single Serve for 5 years with no problems. I replaced it because the water well was showing some wear and tear. I have had this "new" one for less than 3 months and it broke. What the heck?! The water won't drain. We are looking up how to fix this, but we shouldn't have to. This is ridiculous. Did they just stop caring about their products? Are they cutting corners with their manufacturing? This one was cheaper than the last one I got. I would happily pay $30 more for a machine that works. Very frustrated.

If you know the correct order of steps, this is fine. However, after about 6 months of use the water dispensing started acting up, so that some cups would be smaller than the water put in, and the next cup would be overflowing (presumably with the extra water from the previous cup). Unless you are REALLY tight on space, you're better off getting a Keurig with a water reservoir.
reviews.review_header: Works okay, but Keurigs with water reservoirs work better.

reviews.review_text: Second Keurig, prior was larger model and I liked the concept of a small version. Just got in April, now just over 4 months later stopped working. Figured I was unlucky and got a lemon. Before ordering a replacement I read the reviews and saw the same issue over and over. Pump failed, only makes a teaspoon of coffee now. Should last much longer than 4-5 months of use. Won't reorder this model.

This product is only a month old and the water isn't getting as hot as it did in the beginning. Big mistake. Now I have to look for a better product. Of course all packaging has been thrown out so I can't return it. Don't suggest anyone buy this if you want hot coffee.

This coffee maker is awful. We have gone thru 4 or more of them and each one craps out after minimal use. This last one only made it for less than a month. Will try another brand this time. Not sure what the problem here is. We live at 7500 feet so don't know if the altitude has something to do with it, but I get tired of sending them back to Keurig.

I don't really understand the appeal of the Keurig system. I bought this for my kid to use in her dorm room, and she eventually went back to buying coffee on campus. We brought it home and I wanted to try it out. It has three options: 6 oz. (weak), 8 oz. (weaker), and 10 oz. (weakest), because the only thing you can adjust is the amount of water. I don't use the "pods" because of their cost and their effect on the environment, and the reusable filters only take 2 Tb. of coffee, so there seems to be no way to have a "robust" cup. Some people suggest putting the same pod through twice - but then you've got 12 oz. of coffee when you only wanted a cup, so you have to spill off the rest, plus the extra time it takes to brew two cups ... might as well just stick to the pour-over method, where you can control the amount of coffee and water, the temperature of the water, and the speed at which you pour it over. In my opinion.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: This was the first Keurig I've purchased and while I was excited when I initially unboxed it, my excitement soon turned to disappointment. The first cup of coffee I brewed with it using ground coffee and one of those k-cup filters was an unmitigated disaster. It was a watery awful tasting mess. I have tried several times since to brew with my own ground coffee at varying levels of fineness and I have been unable to brew a decent cup that way. My second attempt at brewing a cup of coffee was with one of Keurig's own K-Cups. Again the coffee was watery. I tried again, with less water, filling only half my mug, and this time it was better, but still not fantastic. Also the coffee wasn't very hot, which was part of the reason I ditched my crappy Black and Decker single cup coffee maker. I was tired of having to microwave the coffee every time I made it. I was considering returning the thing at this point but I still had a couple boxes of K-Cups to go through, so I kept trying. Then one time when I was halfway through my K-Cups all of a sudden not only was the coffee strong, but I got out twice as much water as I put in before I hit brew! I assume that there is a hidden reservoir inside this thing and for some reason it was not pumping it properly. From this point, I got decent coffee for a while. Or maybe it was just my imagination and I had gotten used to the weaker Keurig coffee. Whatever the case, I was somewhat happy with the machine for the rest of the month. But then it stopped making coffee entirely. It would just brew and steam and I could not figure out where the water was going because every few attempts it would allow more water in... I eventually figured out the water was somehow draining into the base from inside the thing when I opened it up to try cleaning it. And I didn't think it could possibly work, but rather than pull the whole thing apart trying to figure out why the pumps weren't priming, I stuck a safety pin up inside the top needle (I knew the bottom one was clear because I was still getting no water even without a k-cup in there) and lo and behold suddenly I was getting coffee again! I don't know how such a tiny amount of grounds which appeared in my cup after could have blocked that needle so well that the pumps could not clear it, but apparently that was the case, because I tried ten times to brew coffee before clearing that needle and I was making no progress at all. Anyway, I give the thing three stars because it's more convenient than spooning out grounds and cleaning out a filter constantly for a lukewarm cup of coffee, but I take away two stars because it's unreliable, the coffee is somewhat weak, and there's no temperature control and so my coffee is still lukewarm.
reviews.review_header: Convenient, but unreliable, and makes weak, expensive, lukewarm coffee!

reviews.review_text: This is a good product, my second one of same sort. The problem, and the reason I only gave it 3 stars, is it will clog up where the unit goes through the coffee pod after a while. It really needs to be slightly redesigned so you can clean the little tube and dispenser unit much easier. When I see it is starting to clog, I run plain water through it a few times now and dislodge the small coffee particles that have begun to clog it. (They say to run vinegar through it periodically to remove water problems--and I do that also). There is a youtube video showing you how to unclog it with a paper clip, but this is only a temp fix. Real fix involves removing tiny screws and cleaning tube, and then putting on a new tube tighter to keep it not leaking. If you are mechanical, no problem, if not, unit may become unusable if it really gets clogged up. I threw my first one away because I thought the unit had gone bad. No, it was just clogged
reviews.review_header: Good product with one major shortcoming

reviews.review_text: Don't know what the deal is. I received this on Tuesday. It was a replacement for one that I had used for the past 4 years that finally went kaput. I have only used it for 2 days and suddenly the water is not coming out and filling my cup. This was happening with my first one, but only after using it for years. The holes should not be plugged yet. It will brew one cup just fine, and the next, the water barely drips into the cup before it shuts off. I do not want to have to deal with returning such a largish item, but I guess I will have to.

After only ten days the machine quit working. I mean dead. I used it maybe five times. I guess I'm late to the party, but I have finally decided Kureig are completely undependable and unreliable. The longest one I owned lasted two years and then the motor burned out. At some point your machine is going to quit working. Have had several but this one was the worse. If you simply lift the lid to pour in water, it leaks out around the base. Somehow, tilting open the cup holder seals off the reservoir but you get to learn this through trial and error. This last time, the reservoir leaked anyway and the machine just quit working. Kureig customer service is horrible. They are impossible to make actual contact with a live person. If you get lucky you are routed to a worthless technician who is no help and who then re-routes you to a voicemail that gives you detailed instructions on how to return the Kureig to the factory (at your expense). Two - six week turnaround time. Maybe longer. I've really had it with Kureig products. I don't recommend them at all.

I had one of these for our office for four years and it worked great, and finally tapped out. So I figured four years was a great run for a little kuerig like this one and ordered another one. The second machine I bought lasted no more than 4–6 months... probably used it about 40 times. The same problem that occurred with the four-year-old machine when it quit happened to the new one. When you put the water in and hit the button, nothing comes out and it makes a real loud noise. I cleaned the original one religiously, and I tried cleaning the new according to the instructions, but the mechanism that allows for water to come out through the pod just didn't work anymore I believe. I wish I could return this, but I purchased in July and it broke in November and I'm just getting around now to pursuing a return. Never again unfortunately, cus I was very satisfied the first time around!
reviews.review_header: first one lasted 4 years, second lasted 4 months.

reviews.review_text: Felt very cheap and plastic from the beginning, and it stopped working after a few weeks with barely any use, and Amazon will not take it back or replace it, hiding behind the fact that it was really sold to us by some other vendor, called "Bargain Ben," and "Bargain Ben" won't even respond to any queries. Big mistake to trust Amazon or "Bargain Ben" -- any normal reputable merchant would at least look at the thing to evaluate it.
reviews.review_header: Plastic junk that failed, and Amazon too cheap to stand by it.

reviews.review_text: This is the 3rd Keurig single serve coffee maker we have purchased in less than one year and each has crapped out. We have cleared the clogged needle that punctures the pod, but that only causes the coffee maker to work for a few more cups, then it stops working. The first two we bought, we thought maybe we just got a lemon. But now the third has stopped working.
reviews.review_header: Keurig Single Serve coffee maker -- big waste of money as they don't last.

reviews.review_text: UPDATE: BROKEN and INOPERABLE!!!!! On 11/23/2017 After 4 Month’s of Weekday Use IT IS NO LONGER WORKING!! A Huge Waste of Money!! Skip This Purchase!! FIRST Review: Quickly brews and remains hot. Excellent for a quick morning cup of coffee, expresso, or tea. Brews my illy perfect every time. Very nice for an afternoon chai latte or iced chai latte.
reviews.review_header: UPDATE: BROKEN and INOPERABLE!!!!! After 4 Months!

reviews.review_text: I initially gave this a 5-star review, but have had to update it. I am a huge fan of the full-size Keurig, and wanted to use my K cups when visiting my non-coffee-drinking Dad. So I bought this single-serve unit to keep at his home. And it worked great—until after using it about 10 times, it stopped working. This was the second time I purchased one of these poorly made products. The first time, I bought it for my office and it leaked water right off the bat. But you know, there’s always a unit here or there that will be defective. But after this fail, I will not give it a third chance.

I bought this keurig for our motorhome. This is the morning of our third day of camping and our third morning of using this coffee maker. NO COFFEE. It is brewing, but nothing is coming out. I have bought three of the large keurig coffee makers before for our home. They don't last. It's a waste of money. I use bottled water only and the breakfast blend from Costco. I will never buy a Keurig again!!!!!! Not working after 3 days is a very poor product. I gave it the one star only because you have to give it a rating
reviews.review_header: Will never buy a Keurig again!!!!

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I am super unhappy with this Keurig. I have been a long-time user of Keurig coffee makers, but this one just does not cut the mustard. Unfortunately, because we bought it for our RV, we did not test it in time to meet the NARROW window of return opportunity. What is that about???? The plastic was cheap, the coffee was cold, and the functionality was awkward. We feel duped. This is an update to the above review following an actual call to Keurig: Buyers, many companies have teams now-a-days where there job is to watch reviews for negative comments and then respond. The notion is to show others reading them "oh, hey...look, this buyer had a bad experience, but the company was very responsive and is offering to rectify the situation". The reason is multi-pronged. For instance, the company wants to show they "care" as well as that they are doing something about the issue...that they stand behind their product. I decided to actually call due to the real frustration regarding this K15 model Keurig. Well, this is where things crumble regarding Keurig's concern or desire to do something for the buyer of their machines. I was basically told I must be an idiot, a liar, or a thief. The representative was surely trained to respond to customer calls as her answers were very "canned", meaning taught responses and tactfully defensive regarding Keurig's machine quality and how so many other buyers are raving about this machine (why do I care-just a further attempt to belittle me?). Despite my desire to move into a better built model (hopefully), I was told they weren't capable (or is it willing) to allow me to simply return and or exchange this unit and either buy or exchange and pay the difference for another. So, reluctantly, I was made to succumb to the same model replacement. Further, I now have to send back some internal part on my own dime??? Really???? I suppose this is a tactic to keep warranty hounds at bay. Due to the machine issues, I would think that Keurig would want the whole machine back to check what happened on the quality front when engineering it. Instead, they are more interested in ensuring I don' t have the ability to use both machines. HA! I'd be lucky if one works. Thanks, Keurig.
reviews.review_header: Keurig.....So You Think You Can Trust A Brand Name?!

reviews.review_text: I was looking forward to receiving this machine, but I'm now very disappointed with it. I just received it, and I have tried turning the machine on multiple times. The "add water" button doesn't flash after pressing the "on" button, but a faint hum can be heard coming from the machine while it's plugged in. I have tried changing the outlet that it's plugged into, opening/closing the pod holder, pressing the "on" button, and pressing the "brew" button many many times. Will probably be returning this machine in the next few days if I can't figure out the problem.

Lukewarm coffee. I have to reheat it right as soon as it is brewed. I have tried every option I can think of to get hot coffee, but nothing works. I have a full-size Keurig that I am very happy with. I bought this one for travel. The size is ideal, but I like truly hot, black coffee. I'll go back to the big one.

Nothing earth shattering here, it brews a cup of coffee, but there are some things that could be better. If you are looking for something that is portable, and something you are only going to use on occasion, then this is probably for you. Whatever you do, don't bring your travel mug, it won't fit under the dispenser. Even if you take the drip tray out, a travel mug will not fit under the dispenser. You can still brew a 10 ounce cup of coffee as long as it's not a taller cup. So if you want to use your travel mug, you have to brew into a shorter 10 ounce cup, and then pour it into your travel mug and you're on your way. I only use this one rarely, so that's not a deal breaker for me, but if you are in a hurry, it's a little bit of a pain. Also, after you put water in, you have to wait a little bit before the water warms up to dispense. It's not as quick as your regular Keurig. The last downside is that it doesn't heat the water as hot as a regular Keurig.

It was kind of nice while it lasted, but it only lasted about a week. I've used nothing but spring water and Gevalia K-cups. It has stopped brewing, after just a few days. I tried the remedies suggested in the owner's manual (e.g., a paper clip inserted into the piercing pin), but it still does not work. The water trickles in and winds up with maybe 1/5th of the cup. Not so great.

AS OF THIS WRITING 28% OF PEOPLE HAVE LEFT A REVIEW OF 3 STARS OR LESS. I purchased this Keurig in Dec, '16 for my Fiance. It's now mid Feb. '17 and it stopped working. It turns on, registers water level, begins to heat but does not release water into the K-Cup. The worst part is it was only used < 30 times.
reviews.review_header: The worst part is it was only used < 30 times

reviews.review_text: I hate it. The power button doesn't illuminate - can't tell if it is on or off. I've had it only 6 weeks and have used it only a handful of times and it appears to be dead. I know it has power because it is plugged into a power strip but there is no indication of power at the brewer. The way it fills and measures water added is also annoying, but I'd be happy if it just worked. At all.
reviews.review_header: I hate it. The power button doesn't illuminate - can't ...

reviews.review_text: Water does not get hot enough to brew properly. Only 160 degrees coming out of machine. My older B31 is 190 degrees. Plastic casing is cheaply made. One of the plastic nubs on the bottom that keeps the machine level was broken off in shipping. Casing scratches very easily. Color is only on surface so white shows thru and makes scratches look worse. Not worth the price. Returning this one and keeping my old B31 with the safety kit. On top of all that I found out this coffee maker has a Proposition 65 warning on it. Maybe I got a lemon??
I had previously had good experiences with Keurigs. I liked the color so I purchased it. It takes a long time to heat the water and leaks every single time I use it. It is a fail!

I was really excited about getting this product because it was small and would take up less counter space in my small home. Once I recieved it I set it up right away. I followed the directions and when I came to the part on how to fill the reservoir I was a bit confused because it referred to "the Water Level Guide". I thought the level guide was something that was marked on the inside of the reservoir. So I just wound up using a measuring cup to measure out the amount of water I needed. After having it for almost 2 weeks I felt this was a little inconvenient and I wasn't getting a full cup of coffee so i watched a Youtube video on how to fill the reservoir. That's when I found out that there was a piece missing from my coffee maker. I still had the original box and packing material which I went through to make sure I just overlooked it. It was not included which makes me believe that this was a refurbished coffee maker and not NEW as described. I have no other way to contact the seller to find out if they can send me the piece I need.
reviews.review_header: Check to make sure everything is encluded

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: How can I do it? Can I return it? When I add a cup of water to the machine, the machine only makes half cup of water to me. It doesn't work as usual.
reviews.review_header: How can I do it? Can I return it ...

reviews.review_text: I owned a keurig previously for about 8 years. I guess I assumed ones on the market now are an improvement but this is certainly not. It reminds me of a hotel coffee maker that’s confusing, a huge mess, slow, and poorly designed. I can’t believe this is still on the market. It doesn’t fit any coffee cup and brews all the water you put in it, so it will overflow with boiling hot coffee if you put the tiniest bit too much in there (which is easy to do when you can’t see if there’s any water already in the machine). The drip tray never catches all the water it “conveniently” ejects with no warning, so don’t have any water in there already. And don’t remove it to fit your normal, human sized coffee mug or you’ll have water rapidly shooting across your counter. This is a steaming pile of garbage! I’m certainly not trusting reviews for coffee makers anymore after this. For $20 more you can get a keurig that isn’t a total piece of junk.
reviews.review_header: Cheap, poorly designed hotel coffee maker

reviews.review_text: Purchased the K15 August 30, 2017, and it has totally stopped working less than 2 months later. The machine takes the water and then only drips of coffee come out, a fraction of the amount of water that went in. I've had to turn the machine upside down to get the water out. I purchased the same machine in December of 2016 for a different apartment and that one still works fine. I use distilled water for both, as is recommended. I'm going to try to send this back and get something else.
reviews.review_header: I purchased the same machine in December of 2016 for a different apartment and that one still works fine. I use distilled water for both

reviews.review_text: I am not impressed with this brewer. We had the first Kurig single cup brewer in our RV for 10-12 years and it was much better made and brewed better coffee. Unfortunately, it quit working. We are very disappointed in this new one as it is mostly plastic and it doesn't make good coffee due to the water not being hot enough and coming out too fast.
reviews.review_header: We had the first Kurig single cup brewer in our RV for 10-12 years and it was much better made and brewed better coffee

reviews.review_text: I love my full-size Keurig, but needed a smaller single-serve pot to leave at my dad's house. This is it. On the down side, you can't leave it on to have the water hot and ready for a second cup. And It takes a lot longer for the co-op to brew than the full-size Kuerig. It's very short. Only a standard size coffee mug will fit with the drip pan in place. It removes easily, though for a taller mug. My 10 or 12 ounce tall cups barely fit, but the capacity is only 10 ounces anyway. Super tall travel mugs will not fit. You will have to use something else and then pour into the taller mug. It does have a nice long cord with built in cord storage for when the outlet is near the coffee maker. There is no filter on this pot, so I plan to only use bottled water in it.

This Keurig K15 Single serve machine looks great, but is at the low end of a cheaply made product. I was replacing my Keurig 15 year old single serve that finally was worn out. What a surprise when this very disappointing Keurig product arrived. The biggest disappointment, that ultimately led me to return it, was, the coffee just did not come out very hot. I tried it a few times, asked other people's opinion, and they all agreed that the coffee came out warm, not hot. Sure enough, other printed reviews reported the identical problems. I do not recommend this product.
reviews.review_header: Keurig K15 coffee maker, does NOT make a hot cup of coffee.

reviews.review_text: I typically never write negative reviews unless the product is defective. I used this Keurig about 7 times and it stopped working. It would not power on. I watched all the problem-solving videos to no avail. It was dead. I have a modern kitchen with GFT outlets. I had the product too long to return to Amazon. I contacted Keurig as it was still under warranty and they shipped me a newer model. Don't waste your time with the K15 model. I have two other Keurig products (home and office for over 5 years and they are still working perfectly.
reviews.review_header: Keurigs are good---but not this model. Don't buy it.

reviews.review_text: It mostly makes only a half a cup, and it's not very hot when it brews. Often it overflows and leaks all over the counter. I've tried to deal with it, and I realize I'm past the return date, but it has been a most unsatisfactory product. I carefully make sure I put in the correct amount of water and still it doesn't make enough coffee. It certainly isn't cost efficient as it wastes a pod of the expensive coffee making only half a cup, and barely hot at that. Amazon has always made good my purchases, but this one has got to be a lemon and an exception to the quality that Keurig stands for. It isn't the first Keurig that I have had either, but the first single serve. I am very unhappy with this product.

Complete garbage. I bought this on May 7, 2017. A little over 3 months. I make sure I cleaned it regularly with a Keurig descaler. It is now leaking all over the place. All I ask for is a cup of coffee. What a total waste of money. UPDATE. The day I wrote this review a representative from Keurig replied to my review. They gave me a number to call. I called that same day and spoke to a very helpful representative named Sandra. After a few questions on the situation and giving her the serial number she offered to replace my coffee maker free of charge. They will send me a new one. She also requested I send back the old one can will send me a shipping label to this will also not cost me anything. I am a still a little upset with the coffee maker by I cannot say enough nice things about Keurig's customers service and their willingness to make things right.
reviews.review_header: Failed at 3 months - I have updated this review because of Keurig's excellent customer service

reviews.review_text: I don't know why, but this Keurig did not heat up the water enough to brew the coffee. I tried three times with no luck. My in-laws have a bigger version and I am wondering if those are just better at heating the water up. I had to return this coffee maker. I guess I will just stick my old drip coffee pot.
reviews.review_header: Does not get water hot enough

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Loved the concept. Compact design fits perfect in our RV. The big problem is everything we brew has a plastic taste and odor. We have tried every trick in the book to try and get rid of the taste/odor. Half vinegar, half water, full strength vinegar, backing soda and water, rubber alcohol and water. Even tried lemon juice. All attempts were followed by at least a couple of gallons of plain water to flush the system. Nothing has worked. The plastic taste and odor remain. Total waste of money. We have 2 other larger Keurig machine that work great and never had the plastic taste and odor.

Purchased this two months ago and it has already stopped working (no power). I was not happy with it since the day I got it. I do not like how you pour water in and then have to lift the handle for the water to actually fill the reservoir. Plus my usual coffee mug wouldn't even fit under it much less a travel mug. The good news is that I called Keurig and they are sending me a replacement (K55 not K15). I didn't want the one where the water sits in the reservoir but think I will like that it brews it so fast.
reviews.review_header: I was not happy with it since the day I got it

reviews.review_text: Too much effort to return, but within 1st month of low use started having the same problems other reported. Half of the time the cup just fails, water oozes over the kcup and doesn't go through. I've had 2 keurigs before and never had problems like this. It's garbage. ***Update - the problem rarely happens anymore - maybe its a problem it has at first.

Keurig K15 Single Serve Compact K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black I purchased this after my full size Keurig broke. Only one person in the house drinks coffee so I thought the smaller one would be great. This machine does not work well at all. I continuously leaks water out and takes longer to heat up and brew the coffee. For the money difference I wish that I had gotten another full size machine.

Purchased as a Christmas gift for my son. He said it worked for about 6 weeks before it started leaking, then quit altogether. He didn't tell me so I wouldn't feel bad. As soon as I knew, I tried to get it replaced. I didn't realize the return policy was so restrictive. The return window had closed on 1/31/18 and the product support window closed on 2/21/18. Can't say that's really backing your product. I'd always heard good things about Keurig but doubt I'll buy another. Turns out I'm not the only one who had problems with this model. Always read the reviews. And also, as always, Amazon is my go to place to shop.

The product itself is average - 3 stars: positives: nice looking, easy to use, and compact.] negatives: coffee is sometimes lukewarm, bigger mugs don't fit under the dispenser (it is a compact model), guilty feeling every day I throw away a disposable k-cup. I'm taking off another star because of my experience with Keurig's support - This product lasted less than 6 months before it stopped brewing - it fails to pump the water from the reservoir to the dispenser. It's still under warranty, so I called Keurig and they asked me leading questions that made me feel like they were trying to find a loophole to not honor the warranty (e.g., what kind of water do you use? what kind of coffee brands do you use?). Then, they tried to walk me through the same troubleshooting steps I had already taken before I contacted them. I finally got someone on the line who said the product is definitely broken and they will ship me a new one and will email me instructions on how to send back the old one. A few days go by and I don't get any emails so I call them again. The representative asked me to try the same troubleshooting videos on their site again. I told her I have already been over this and a previous representative said a replacement was being mailed. She said she now sees that information on the account. She said a replacement will be on the way. More than a week goes by and I still don't get any emails or the coffee maker. So I call again. This time, a representative says they are experiencing an IT problem that prevents her from checking the status on my replacement order. :o( I don't even want a replacement anymore. I just want my money back so I can buy a regular coffee maker.

This pot is very, very loud. The cup portions are not consistent with the setting. And, I purchased this June 16, 2016 and it is totally broken as of Aug. 6, 2017 and the warrenty just expired little over a month ago.

I found this single cup machine difficult to use. Since it has no water reservoir, you have to fill the machine each time you use it. In the top, there is a plastic do-dad that is supposed to tell you how much water to pour in for the size cup you want. I could never get it straight and would always add more water than necessary meaning that the cup overflowed. Would not buy again. PS- In reading the number of reviews on the product, I've decided that the fault must be with myself, dear Brutus. No one else seems to mention the measuring device in the reservoir. I gave it another star.

I purchased one of these a few years ago then stopped drinking coffee for a while gave it away. Well that old one is still go strong. The new one I bought from Amazon ended up just like all of the other people who left negative reviews after prolonged use. Mine preformed okay for about three weeks. It never brewed a very strong cup though. After a month or two it was putting out such eeak coffee that my dark roast was common out of the machine so light that it didn't even look like coffee. It was more like the color watered down over tea. I was so drawn in by the price as my original one was over $100, I didn't pay much attention to reading individual reviews because it had a decent average. Anyways I ed ended up throwing this piece of junk away ave replaced it with a $21 machine that out performs this one by far. Don't waste your money!
reviews.review_header: Not made like they used to be!

reviews.review_text: I am very disappointed. I purchased this for my daughter for her college dorm and it only worked correctly for 2 months. She would pour the appropriate amount of water into the system and only half would return into the cup. The rest would leak. She only informed me when she came home for Christmas break. I am very surprised. I have a larger one at home that works great. I wish keurig would stand behind their products and get rid of this model and reimburse us. Since I purchased this model I've seen many of the same complaints.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: We own a larger Keurig and love it. We thought this one would be perfect for our vacation home. We were so very wrong.
