It is constructed of very cheap plastic and the handle felt like it was going to break every time it was lifted and pulled down. Worse, it took longer to heat the water for a single cup of coffee than anyone should expect, much longer than it takes for our larger Keurig. If I didn't know it, I'd think this was a knockoff sold at a discount chain rather than a licensed Keurig product. After using it for 3 days we returned it to Amazon and purchased the larger Keurig version we found on sale at a different retailer. The difference in price is worth it for a product we use every day.
reviews.review_header: We own a larger Keurig and love it. We thought this one would be perfect ...

reviews.review_text: Complex sequence to brew, which results in short cups followed by overflows. Is this the best that they can do in a compact k-cup brewer? Keurig should be ashamed--oh, that's right, they don't care.

I really loved this, but I've had it for a little over 6 months now and it just stopped working. I am the only coffee drinker in my house, and this machine was probably used max 4 times a week. So, now it's broken and can't be returned. Maybe the larger models are more reliable, but if you're a heavy coffee drinker, I wouldn't get this little model that couldn't handle my modest coffee habit.

It is a beautiful color, but that is about all that it is. It never seems to want to work properly. The coffee it makes (no matter what pod) is weak and watery. When I use a reusable pod, it also ends up weak and watery, then I have to clean the entire machine because coffee grinds clog up the system. The water I pour in is never the amount of water I get out, if I pour in a full cup, I get about a half a cup of water back. I miss my old Keurig, this unit is a sad disaster that makes coffee every morning a bummer.

I bought this to replace my K10 which I LOVED, but that stopped working after close to 10 years. (Seriously, that thing was great!) I've had the K15 for going on a month and a half, and in spite of trying everything I can find online, every cup still smells and tastes like plastic!!! I've wasted so much money throwing away cups of coffee that are completely undrinkable. Very disappointed.
reviews.review_header: Makes coffee that tastes and smells like plastic!

reviews.review_text: Great coffee maker until it breaks. We have had really bad luck with Keurig coffee makers this being our third in two years that has died essentially within less than 6 months of purchasing it. We love the coffee maker and how small and simple it is, but at the cost for it to only last 3 months on this one I would not purchase another. We even followed all cleaning instructions. We purchased this end of May 2017 and as I write this on September 7th, it is broken and will not work. Bad news for a parent of two kids under two!!!!
reviews.review_header: Great little coffee maker too bad it only lasted 3 months.

reviews.review_text: Bought this as a travel coffee maker. Might have been OK for just one person, but for a group, it takes waay to long (when it works) - for more than one person, get a unit with a water tank. This system has a top tank, when ya our water, then a heating tank the water drains into when you load a cup, and an excess tray under the cup, where half the water goes for one reason or another.. Why they designed it this way, instead of a simple turn it on and it boils what's in the tank" system is unknown... Now you can't see how much water is ready.. Also, as the thing doesn't work75% of the time, you have water everywhere, 1st tank, second tank, overflow, countertop.... Not sure how many times I tried ton brew a cup and got like 5 drops of coffee for my efforts. Seemed to only work after a power cycle. Very very poorly engineered device, could have been a very very simple and robust system, but they tried to get tricky and, well, they pooched it. Does anyone else other than Keurig make kcup nakechines? This is the 3rd Keurig mchine I've owned that has come as crap from factory, or quickly turned to crap....
reviews.review_header: Takes forever, doesn't work well, over engineered for what it needs to do

reviews.review_text: Delivered December 15th, 2017. Bought for my Wife for the holidays. Quit working April 10th, 2018. The pump runs as normal, and all of the light indicators work as normal, but no coffee comes out of the unite. My Wife used this for less than four months, Needless to say, this is unacceptable service from what I consider to be an expensive piece of plastic. The Amazon return period is over. Now we must go to Keurig to see whether they will back their product. The prospect of getting another one of these short-lived devices leaves me underwhelmed. Judging by the number of one star reviews, many others have have had the same experience as we have. Pass this one by, save your money, and buy something that works.
reviews.review_header: Died after 3 1/2 months of use -- how dismal!

reviews.review_text: I bought this machine after both of my more deluxe Keurig coffeemakers broke in the same week. Since the 2.0 model had given me so much grief, I decided that it was time to go back to simplicity ... their most basic machine. It works well enough, but it is really, really slow. I used to have an original Keurig like this one, and I just didn't remember it being this slow. That said, it brews coffee, and that's what I need it to do.
reviews.review_header: I used to have an original Keurig like this one

reviews.review_text: I purchased this Keurig in January, it's August and I just threw it in the trash! It just died...no reason, just won't turn on. I'm furious that something so simple and basic cost so much. I expected more. I had a full sized Keurig for a couple years before this purchasing this one, it started to malfunction. I'm done with Keurig, they cost too much and definitely do way too little! Back to my tried and true Cuisinart, thank God I kept it.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I loved my first Keurig that I bought several years ago (& still use daily) enough to buy a second one for my office. The one for work lasted about a year and a half, which was disappointing. I thought that I might have gotten a “lemon,” so I ordered this one again. Big mistake. It did not work properly straight out of the box. About a tablespoon of coffee came out in the first cup. I took the k-cup out and rotated it a quarter turn (puncturing a second hole in the bottom, and, voila...I got the rest of my coffee. On the second cup, I repeated. Same results, same fix. On the third cup, no luck. At that point I boxed it up & sent it back & purchased a more expensive model. I did notice that the one I received yesterday had been “cheapend” in quality: the cord had been shortened, the k-cup holder was changed, and the reservoir no longer had indicators for beverage volume (i.e. 6 oz, 8oz, 10oz). Do yourself a favor and don’t buy this particular model.
reviews.review_header: Was a great product - not anymore.

reviews.review_text: Delivered without the water level indicator disks shown online. Also delivered without the manual. It appears to be a used machine. The original seal of the box was broken. There was no protective cover on the unit and it was collecting dust and has scratches. There was no protective tape or anything. All clear signs this is NOT a new machine. Being returned ASAP.

Meh! It's o.k., I don't know if Keurig changed their machine or pods or both. But the coffee is not as good as it once was. I was so annoyed that I opened up a new pod to discover what looks like a new filter media. The older ones used a paper or paper-like filter and this new one looks like it may be plastic and would explain the flavor change. Back in my pre-Keurig days I could tell a definite difference between paper filters and metallic filters, I preferred the paper hands-down.
reviews.review_header: No What It Used To Be

reviews.review_text: Leaks and too small
It does what it is supposed to do...one cup at a time. The downside is that the machine makes an audible hummmmmm at all times even when turned off. Kind of irritating.
reviews.review_header: It does what it is supposed to do.. ...

reviews.review_text: Received this Item around June 9 and I used approximately four times a week . On July 23 it did not work as it was burned out life expectancy on this item is approximately six weeks . I never moved the item it only sat on my kitchen counter . It was a cheap product and you get what you pay for. They then replaced it on July 27th for no charge which was great, however I was out of town for the month of August and only used September about 25 times and 2 days ago October 5th itdid not work. The life expectancy is extremely short.

I gave it 2 stars because I love the color. If it wasn't for that it would be 1 star. What has happened to keurigs quality? I hav had 3 machines over the years. The first was large and sturdily built. After a couple years of using it at home I took it to work and bought one with a carafe that was a disappointment and cheaply made. Now I bought this one which is made out of cheap plastic. The coffee tastes like plastic too
reviews.review_header: Coffee out of it tastes like plastic

reviews.review_text: I wish I had of never ordered this machine. I have had Keurig in the past. They never lasted very long but when they worked they made excellent coffee. I bought this because it is small and takes up less counter space and it's just me. I did not need a big machine. No matter how hard I try this Keurig never makes the same cup of coffee twice. It's either not enough water or too much water and it trickles slow. Save your money!!! I hate this machine!!!!!

I had an inexpensive Mr Coffee brand K cup coffee maker that worked beautifully for about 10 years. It finally stopped brewing on a consistent basis so I bought this model to replace my old one. Right out of the box, after I brewed 2-3 cups of coffee, this maker stopped working. It would brew maybe 1" of disgusting, gritty coffee concentrate if it brewed at all. It seemed as if there was a problem with how the water would drop down into the chamber after pouring it in and pulling the lever. I promptly returned that machine and Amazon kindly sent me a replacement machine of the same model. That one worked for about 3 weeks and then it did the exact same thing! I started looking at more of the reviews here and I cannot believe how many consumers had the same problem I've had with this terrible piece of junk machine! I wish I had realized this before I bought this thing. If you're considering this machine please heed my warning and that of others here. I'm glad this replacement machine pooped out when it did so I can send it back - and I'm glad I saved the packaging, twice! But do I love having to go without coffee while I deal w/ replacing this machine twice? No. Do I love repackaging this piece of garbage - twice? No. Do I love hauling this heavy box back to the UPS store twice? Not at all. I'm a busy mom and each time I do this I've got a fussy toddler in tow needing to be strapped in and out of her car seat repeatedly. And doing this and dealing with her without coffee is just cruel! I don't know how Keurig gets away w/ selling something so shoddily made that a full 1/4 to 1/3 of people are having it break, not work, or not brew properly. It's junk! My old $50 Mr Coffee K Cup maker lasted nearly 10 years with no problems and I've also had a Nespresso machine just as long and it's so sturdy I swear it's perfect despite the fact I've only descaled it once in a decade! It could be thrown out of a high rise window and survive while this machine doesn't work after 2-3 brews. I'm done w/ this model and Keurig as a brand. Shame on them!

After using this for a couple of weeks, it began to brew just two ounces at a time. I contacted Keurig and was told to clean the needle. I also had to switch to purchased bottled water - my filtered water didn't work. Machine brewed two cups and then the same issue started. I cleaned the needle, but the performance is still impaired. I am returning this item. Cleaning the needle is challenging. Keurig has a video on their website but I couldn't get it to load after three attempts. I believe they should include instructions for cleaning the needle with the product and clearly state upfront about the special water required.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: This model is made of cheaper plastic than the original one that I had before this. It also clogs up more easily. I will use it, but next purchase will be a different brand.

I bought mine in September 2016, and it worked great for 11 months. But about a month ago, it started leaving grounds in my coffee. I cleaned it out, but it kept happening. This morning, I filled the water, put my pod in, and hit "brew." It is running and making the brewing noise, but nothing comes out. I changed out the pods, but nothing is brewing. Very disappointed that it crapped out less than a year after purchase.
reviews.review_header: Quit working less than a year after purchase

reviews.review_text: I ordered this for my vacation house and have had nothing but trouble with it. (I have tried to use it a total of 4 months) The spout gets clogged and it will not make coffee. I have used official Keurig K cups, filtered water for purity, have cleaned it several times with the suggested cleaner, have use white vinegar to clean it ,as found online used a straightened paperclip to clear the small holes that dispense water and have communicated with Keurig. NOTHING has made this a permanent fix. I have a black one at home that I have had never had any problems with--after many years...I am going to try to get a refund

I loved the color, size and convenience of this item. However, after about three weeks of service it stopped working. Water was not moving thru the pot. Remedies on the Keurig website did not help, and a call to their customer service was extremely frustrating. (They offered coupons for more coffee--how that would help a machine that didn't work I don't know.). I finally hung up and contacted you to arrange to exchange it for a better one. I had a Keurig for several years with no problems, and am happy with the replacement.

After searching all over and not finding the internal 6, 8, and 10oz. water measuring indicator, clearly marked on the diagram in the booklet that the machine came with, I finally called Keurig. The person who took my call diagnosed the problem right away. They changed the machine, but didn't change the instruction booklet! The machine no longer has ANY measuring gauge, as illustrated and described in the book. Instead, you're supposed to fill your coffee mug with water, dump it in, and then brew your coffee. You would think that for a $65 piece of plastic that brews coffee, Keurig could afford to print an updated instruction guide to go with it.
reviews.review_header: After searching all over and not finding the internal 6 ...

reviews.review_text: Makes terrible coffee and not even hot at all.Very disappointed will return it.

Not a very good buy... First of, the entre machine is a bit wobbly (but, as it\s plastic, nothing better is to be expected). Then it throws temper tantrums at times for no apparent reasons - brews only half of the water, does't brew at all, or - the latest - doesn't even turn on! Needless to say, this one goes into bin. BUT, if you are happy with a machine with a 6 week life-span, you should be good.

Not my first Keurig; have one at home Purchased a smaller unit for RV camping, returned the first one the same day I received. Took a chance and reordered. After a few weekends of using the second one it is also malfunctioning. Would not recommend this unit to anyone.
reviews.review_header: If I purchased at a local store I'd return it!

reviews.review_text: returned as the machine would not heat. tried several times as per the directions and got nothing, no hot water, no coffee, nothing..Returned for refund and purchased a different maker.
reviews.review_header: returned as the machine would not heat. tried several ...

reviews.review_text: This has been the absolute worst k-cup single cup brewer I’ve owned. The hot water fails to dispense. I’ve called Keurig Support, they instructed me how to clean out the dispenser pipe. Worked for awhile. I can’t tell you how many k-cups I’ve wasted, time also, trying to brew a cup of coffee. Do yourself a favor. Buy one of the highly rated single brewers on Amazon for about +/-$30. I’ve purchased two. They’re FAR better that this $76 piece of junk.
reviews.review_header: This has been the absolute worst k-cup single cup brewer I’ve owned

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: We purchased this because my 92 mother-in-law can use it easily. After reading other reviews we decided that having to replace it after a year would be acceptable. At 4 months (to the day) from receiving it the machine has quit working. When a product is good quality at a low price it is called inexpensive. When a product is low cost AND poor quality it is called cheap.

It works maybe 40% of the time, usually spits out clear liquid with no coffee. It has no size buttons like the other Keurigs, so the amount of coffee is contingent upon the amount of water you put it. Despite this, the amount of actual coffee is always either overflowing or less than half a cup. I've had this for 4-5 months and have had maybe 3 good cups from it. A disaster - skip this one.

I gave this Keurig single cup coffee maker to my granddaughter as a gift this past Christmas, 2017. Just found out it stopped working the 2nd week of January, 2018--unfortunately, she didn't say anything at the time, afraid of hurting my feelings. Spent a lot of money on this gift. Think it should have stood up to 1 cup of coffee a day for longer than 2 weeks!!!!! Changing review to a 1 star from the 3 stars originally given after hearing that a couple of people who work with my granddaughter have had the same experience with their single-serve Keurigs. Would appear that Keurig opted to mass produce while sacrificing quality. Will NOT purchase another Keurig item.
reviews.review_header: I gave this Keurig single cup coffee maker to my ...

reviews.review_text: Very disappointed with this product. The water is warm, not hot. The coffee is very weak. A majority of the coffee grounds are still dry after brewing a cup. I try packing and not packing the ground coffee, changing the coarseness, etc. Didn't make a difference. The coffee was still weak and grounds mostly dry.

this little compact is ok...just. don't think it'll have all the bells and whistles your bigger kurigs have. this is great for a quick fix. the color is cool but because i have the bigger, more hi tech kurig, this one just didn't stand a chance. i keep this in my office so i don't have to run to the lunchrooms to get my coffee fixes. its a kurig but more manual operating than i would have liked.
reviews.review_header: this is great for a quick fix

reviews.review_text: Pros: 1. It's a pretty good deal for what you are getting. 2. Unit works fine. Cons: 1. There's not a lot of room for the mugs, making it difficult to use many travel mugs. I myself had to purchase Keurig's official travel mug in order to have a travel mug that would fit under the coffee maker. 2. I really wish that this maker had a 12 oz option

This was ordered for my husband’s birthday. My thought was it was better to make individual servings as opposed to pot. The first one we received was bad from the start, although I did not realize it. It would often make only 1/2 cup or be luke warm. There were coffe grinds in the finished coffee. We contacted Kurig and the customer service was great. First we tried all the troubleshooting procedures, but they ended up sending us a new one. Unfortunately it started doing the same thing in less than a month. They offered to send us another one, but would not refund our money because it was not purchased directly through Kurig. There is definitely a defect in this product and I would advise folks to stay clear of the smaller sized Kurigs.👎🏻😭😤
reviews.review_header: My thought was it was better to make individual servings as opposed to pot

reviews.review_text: I'm not sure what Keurig was thinking with the dimensions of this unit. This isn't some bizarrre criticism of someone trying to stuff a 20oz mug into a Keurig that can only dispense up to 10oz. My normal 8-10oz coffee cups will not fit the K15 without removing the drip tray, which basically means there will be no circumstance where I could use this unit WITH the drip tray, which would almost certainly mean a constant mess. My 16oz Thermos won't fit this unit at all, even with the drip tray removed. I was planning to dispense two 6oz servings into my 16oz Thermos for taking on the go.

It was fun while it lasted, but the machine broke less than a year after purchase and I can’t get assistance from Keurig with a replacement. I cleaned it frequently, as the instruction manual described, but the machine no longer detects that it has a coffee pod and won’t start the brew sequence. Given the price of the unit, and cost of the pods, I will not repurchase. I’ve already moved on to a tradition coffee marker; it was half the cost, more feature rich, and far cheaper to operate. Frankly, with paper coffee liners, I find it’s easier and faster to make one small pot of coffee than two cups of coffee with the k cups.
reviews.review_header: Lasted less than a year with frequent maintenance

reviews.review_text: I bought this because of all the bad things you hear about the Kuerig with the water tank... which is what I had prior to this. I seriously regret getting this. Takes awhile to make a cup of coffee and the taste is not as good as my other unit. Also, does seem a bit proxy for the price one pays for this. I'm not really thrilled with this at the moment. Got to get used to it I guess.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Not the easiest to use. Coffee is not always hot. Water level is not accurate at all.

Junk. This is not rocket science. I used this to make one or two cups a day since I bought it and religiously cleaned and it kept it in perfect condition. Last week, I made a cup and no water came out, just a humming noise. So now it's useless and even if it is under some kind of warranty, I will be expected to pay to ship a defective product that's six months old back in for repair.
reviews.review_header: Updated review: six months later after light use, it doesn't work now.

reviews.review_text: I love the color and the size! I have never been able to brew a cup. Someone advised me there Must be a part missing. The part that pokes a hole in the bottom of of the k-pod.
reviews.review_header: I love the color and the size

reviews.review_text: We bought this and immediately were disappointed. It's very cheaply made. Thin cheap plastic, clunky, it's like a cheap plastic toy. The water is warm.not hot. It takes forever to brew. Ours worked for a month. Then had to return.
reviews.review_header: Dont do it, spend a little more.

reviews.review_text: Done with keurig. This is the second one I have purchased that stopped working with very little use. Bought this small one for a vacation home that was barely used. The coffee stop coming out. Just made a humming noise and nothing came out. Very disappointed. It’s now in the garbage can. Last Keurig for me

Maybe it's just me but I constantly end up with too much water in the reservoir which ends up flow out of the machine all over my counter every time I make coffee, which isn't helpful. I fill it to the 10 oz level and it leaks before it hits the top of the 10oz indicator.
reviews.review_header: Not super happy with it. Im hoping it breaks soon.

reviews.review_text: I really didn't like this Keurig. It's largest size didn't even fill a coffee cup. It clogged so easily and so fast, even with us using filtered water. Spend the extra $10 or so and get the next one up. The color was nice, but that's the only good thing about it.
reviews.review_header: I really didn't like this Keurig

reviews.review_text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! I had a K-Mini that lasted about a year and had to replace it because the pump had gone bad. I ordered a new one on January 17, 2018, and the pump went bad within 2 weeks. Keurig sent me a replacement unit, and the exact same thing happened within 2 weeks -- heats up, no coffee comes out. I wanted to return the unit for refund, as I have no interest in receiving another piece of junk. Keurig will not do refund. Not a happy customer.
reviews.review_header: Very Poor Quality - 2 Fails in 1 Month

reviews.review_text: I have bought 2 of this k-mini both broke in less than 4 months. The first one broke the first month. Now i am having trouble returning after buying the warranty. A co-work said this happen to him as well. He got his at bed bath and beyond the same problem. Keurig has been producing really bad products lately and amazon is slow on the warranty. I will never buy a Warranty from amazon again and NEVER BUY A KEURIG AGAIN.

I have tried two of these. Each one lasted about 6 weeks. Very disappointed in this model. I have used the larger Keurig coffeemakers for a long time with no problem. I am trying the new model, K200 Plus, which is more streamlined and not as wide as the large Keurigs, and holds 2 cups of water. Time will tell.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: It just stopped working within 5 weeks! I ordered one and returned it because apparently was missing the water guide that should be there according to the instruction manual. When I received the replacement (excellent experience returning item to Amazon), it was missing the water guide too, so I called Keurig and they said they no longer come with that part and that they haven't updated the manuals yet... So I started using the new one, one morning it works fine, when I want to make coffee that same day in the afternoon, nothing! It won't even turn on. Returned again to Amazon for a refund this time. Very disappointed with the product!
I received this today and the box was broken and poorly taped together. When I opened it, the machine was wet with coffee! It was dirty, scratched and used. I'm really disappointed.

I would send this back - but I've thrown away all the packaging - the water does not get hot enough and it is hard to fit a tall cup underneath. but it's ok I guess I don't drink a lot of coffee.. I purchased it for my cappuccino.
The unit sent to me does not heat the water to a temperature suitable for making drinkable coffee.
reviews.review_header: Dispensed coffee temp varies greatly, not uniformly drinkable coffee

reviews.review_text: We had one of these last through thousands of cups of coffee. When it had some challenges, we bought a new one here -- but it didn't even work! So we sent this back, and while waiting, did another de-scaling of our existing one -- and now it works fine again. So it's a solid starter K-Cup machine -- but only 1 out of 2 of them worked! Hard to wholeheartedly recommend a 50% fail rate.
reviews.review_header: did another de-scaling of our existing one -- and now it works fine again. So it's a solid starter K-Cup machine ...

reviews.review_text: I was hesitant with so many mixed reviews but thought mine would be different. Mistake! Worked for a few days then the water wouldn't drop down into the tank. Returned for a refund (sad face)! I really wanted it to work. Mine was brand new and the packaging was amazing so I didn't have those issues which many others seem to have had.

I started having issues with this machine not heating. I called Keurig. I was informed my purchase I made through Amazon was for a K10. Someone apparently switched the unit. I feel ripped off as I purchased a K15. I had only used it about 8 times. Check your model numbers!
reviews.review_header: Are you getting what you paid for?

reviews.review_text: I have used it 6 times in the last 3 months and now the water not longer comes out hot! Loved it while it worked, but now I regret this purchase, and due to my lack of use i can't return it :'-(
Perfect size. Works great. I'm addicted! Update: died, gets no power :(

After using four of these over a three year period, I've given up. They just don't last. The unreliability of the product offsets the convenience of it. Kuerig surely could have bettered this by now. Expensive to buy and use, it is just not worth it.
reviews.review_header: After using four of these over a three year period ...

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: What kind of water must you use? Don't use tap water nor reverse osmosis only bottled provided it's not RO . Google it and you will be told by several correspondents that keurig is only interested in selling filters. The unanswered question is, does RO contain minerals or not. Anyway it's OK if you only want a quick single cup of mediocre coffee.

Sometimes it works, other times it doesn't. I purchased this single-serve machine for family vacations in the mountains. Some of us drink leaded coffee and some of us drink unleaded. Good thing there was a back-up coffee maker at the cabin, because this particular Keurig model isn't 100% reliable.
reviews.review_header: Works when it feels like it.

reviews.review_text: I bought this Keurig because it was small enough to fit in my dorm and had used it many times with no problem. 2 weeks after using it, I start my cup and walk away. My keurig started making very loud abnormal noises so I rush over to find coffee splattered everywhere and smoke pouring from my now glowing Keurig. I poured water on it until the smoke and red glow were gone. This was the first time anything has happened like this to any of my Keurig products. Just be careful before you buy this product.

I have only had the coffee pot for a couple of days. Makes coffee ok, but the quality of the coffee make is sad, sad, sad for the price!!! DO NOT pay extra for a color other than black!!!! Very disappointed in the quality. I have no expectation it will hold up long.

Owned for less than a month and it will not turn on. I've honestly only used this thing 4-5 times. Do, not buy this piece of garbage. My parents have an older Keurig model at their home and have never had any problems with it. I've seen some reviews that say the newer models are crap and will burn out on you if left plugged in too long... I guess that's what happened but I feel like I just threw away $60. Now I'm stuck with boxes of K-cups. I probably will just give them to my parents.
reviews.review_header: not buy this piece of garbage. My parents have an older Keurig model at ...

reviews.review_text: Update 10/24 it stopped brewing correctly after two months of use not recommended. works fine no issues up to now and bought it used. Coffee could be hotter cause if you use a cold flaverd creamer it makes coffee warm quick that didnt happen with my drip mr ☕️ coffee maker. Otherwise it is cheaper made than the other keurig models but does the job for one cup at a time consistently. Get a reusable kcup the purple fill n save cups worked well . Have Java Day !

Works correctly less than half of the time... I knew that a lot of the reviews were bad, but really wanted the small size and the platinum color. Used a Nespresso for years and got turned off by the exorbitant pod prices. Guess i’ll go back. This machine is worthless!

Two stars, only because it was fabulous for the 3 1/2 months that it actually worked. I had the same brewer for three years before I had to replace it with this one. This one just stopped running water through. I took the needles out and cleaned them and got two more cups of coffee before it completely stopped working again. I am done with Keurig Machines. Going back to the good ole' ground beans and 12 cups of coffee!
reviews.review_header: Going back to the good ole' ground beans and 12 cups of coffee

reviews.review_text: My brand new coffee maker worked for one week before it wouldn't make a cup of coffee any longer. I put it with last year's keurig one cup coffee maker. I now have 3 of them, as my husband bought me one to keep at my card givers job. Not one of them work now, so I am of the opinion that they are worthless unless you can throw away (rounded up, not exact price) 70.00 every year.
reviews.review_header: When they do work right they make a great cup of coffee, for a short time.

reviews.review_text: This is a very poor machine. We have ran maybe 10 cups of coffee through this and now it won't make a cup of coffee. Heats up and then will not extract the water/coffee. We have done the trouble shooting and to no avail. A total waste of money. Very disappointed!!!
reviews.review_header: Don't waste your money. Very poor design.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I have used this 3 or 4 times and now it will not make coffee. Just the tiniest bit of hot water comes out, even though the water chamber is full. I am so angry for wasting my money. Hopefully they will give me a refund for this horrible product Edit: after two mornings without coffee, and brewing strictly hot water through the keurig, I was finally able to get more than 2 oz to come through. I spent about 40 minutes brewing hot water through the keurig over 2 mornings. This morning, the stream was powerful enough again and I was able to brew a 10oz coffee. I think somehow the grounds from my k cup got stuck in the brewer and needed to be flushed out. I'll keep the product, but if it happens again, I will ship it back. Honestly, I had a Mr.Coffee k cup brewer for about 9 years that was more reliable than the name brand keurig

Not worth the price, and the coffee was not especially hot. I tried using the My K-Cup Reusable Coffee filters with this, because I don't want to use pre-packaged K-cups, but I wound up with grit and coffee grains and distinctly tepid, weak coffee. I returned this product and do not recommend it at all.
reviews.review_header: Don't Waste Your Money Unless You Use Pre-Packaged K-Cups

reviews.review_text: Absolute junk. First one crapped out in less than 6 months. We figured to give it another try because of the price. The second one crapped out after the 2nd use.
reviews.review_header: Absolute junk. First one crapped out in less than ...

reviews.review_text: We have 2 regular size Keurig and love them, however this model falls short of producing a satisfying beverage. The unit does not produce water hot enough to qualify as hot coffee, more like warm. It wasn't warm enough to melt powdered creamer. Very disappointed. We returned it immediatelh.
reviews.review_header: We have 2 regular size Keurig and love them, however this model falls short of producing ...

reviews.review_text: This is my 3rd keurig single cup and it has gone downhill. The plastic is thinner, the color is cheap looking,the functions are touchy and it is very loud. It is much flimsier made. Keurig, did you think your fans wouldn't notice. Shame on you.

I had to return my first one after 1 week when it stopped working. I had another sent to me to and it lasted a couple of weeks longer. This is after reviewing the instructions carefully, cleaning, and only using filtered water. I decided Keurig is no longer worth the hassle. I rather buy a cheaper brand. Pretty style, but it's garbage.
reviews.review_header: Experienced the same issue with 2 separate ones. Not worth it.

reviews.review_text: Not Recommended.... My first machine is still going strong after about 5 years..... I recently purchased another one as a gift and it last one day ( 4 cups of coffee) before it broke. It seems like this machine has been redesigned and now is defective.... check out the 1 star reviews on Amazon..... this machine seems to have a lot of problems in 2017.... the defective machine purchased is being returned for a refund. I would be waery ordering the current model that is being sold.

Bought it for the camper. Used it for about a week in May with no problems. Used it for road trip with camper to Colorado. Two days it work flawlessly. Used it again before hitting the road to go to Colorado worked. Got to camp ground, went to make a cup of coffee and it won't work now. Very disappointed!!!

So I purchased this for my house in FL was delivered May 4ish. Went down in July set it up. (Of course put box in recycling.) Next day unit did not work right leaked. Brought it to NY foweekend house. Tried to use it today would turn on. Sounded like it was heating .......NO COFFEwas dispensed. UNIT GOT SO HOT I THOUGH IT WSD GOING TO MELT ON THE COUNTER..
reviews.review_header: BEWARE. MAY MELT ON YOU. you will not get coffee!

reviews.review_text: Lasted 1 month and 3 days before it stopped working!!! On top of that, it's a very finicky model in that it will correctly make coffee if you incorrectly follow the exact steps to make a cup... too much water and it overflows, too little and it will ask for more... and don't even attempt to pour the water after you've put the pod in, you have to pour it prior! My ex- wife was less complicated!!!
reviews.review_header: Spend a little more for a better model...

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Purchased this for my elderly parents who like a warm beverage but downsized and didn’t want a big coffee maker. Worked for less than 6 weeks - water would not exit the reservoir and made maybe 3 tablespoons of coffee. My parents would waste pods thinking they did something wrong, not that Keurig is selling an inferior defective product. Guess the reason for 4 weeks to return is because keurig knows it won’t last much longer.....
reviews.review_header: Not worth even One star....But Amazon won’t allow you to go lower....

reviews.review_text: I wanted this coffee maker because I do not make coffee often and wanted one that didn't store water. So, I bought this just over a year ago and have used less than 15 times, and it no longer works. Looks like the pump failed, as the water will not come out after heating. I can't return this to Amazon as it's past the return date, so I'm really disappointed in the quality and would hope Keurig would stand behind a product that has had minimal use, even if purchased only a year ago. Do not buy this!

Used this once when it first arrived just to make sure it worked. Learned today when a guest went to use it that it doesn't work at all. It continually insists that it needs water and won't operate no matter how much is added.

I like it but they did not tell you it is 80%plus plastic even the handle.. I will be shocked if it last 6 months. The tray is hard to push back in and the plate the cup sits on is plastic. So far so good. I had the large Keurig for over 10 years no problem but it took up too much counter space since wife doesn't drink coffee. We shall wait & see..
reviews.review_header: I like it but they did not tell you it is ...

reviews.review_text: Nothing as frustrating as waking up to a new coffee maker that has only lasted a few weeks. I own two K 15's one only lasted for a couple weeks! The other is temperamental. It works most of the time. I use water from a reverse osmosis system and low mineral content. I clean according to instructions. My original reservoir unit has lasted better than 3 years. Coffee does not taste as good a single coffee maker. I had a K 10 and that one lasted a little less than 18 months.

When I found this product I was excited as it was smaller and less expensive than your normal keurig. That excitement lasted only a few short weeks. As it heats ours now leaks water into the cup. The coffee it puts out is barely coffee. It’s more water than anything else. The only plus of the product was soze and I liked that it did not hold water allowing it to become stale. But due to it short lived life of actually doing what it should I would not suggest this product.
reviews.review_header: The only plus of the product was soze and I liked that it did not hold water allowing it to ...

reviews.review_text: The machine operates as expected but the coffee is not hot enough for me. It's more than warm but I'm disappointed in the temperature. I put my cup in the microwave for 10-20 seconds to get it to a nice, hot temperature. So far, this is not an improvement over the K10 model (the previous mini Keurig machine).
reviews.review_header: But the coffee is NOT HOT :-(

reviews.review_text: I received this product on October 19, 2017. Today is February 21, 2018, and the machine won't even turn on. I teach high school, and I prefer to keep a machine in my room. I'll order another coffee maker; it will not; however, be a Keurig.
reviews.review_header: I received this product on October 19, 2017. ...

reviews.review_text: This is not a good product. At all. I am a previous full size keurig owner and it worked perfectly. I bought this keurig because I am now the only coffee drinker in the house and I wouldn’t need a full size keurig and I wanted to save space on the countertop. Firstly, let me start off by saying you can only fill up to 10oz of water in the chamber and if you go over by even a drop, it leaks out. Secondly, the water does not get heated hot enough to brew a decent cup of joe. What I end up with in my cup is like warm coffee-bean-flavored water. Lastly, even if I drink a cup of this terrible coffee I still get a caffeine headache, which tells me I’m basically just drinking water. This was such a waste of time and money and I’m annoyed that I can’t even return it.
reviews.review_header: This is not a good product. At all.

reviews.review_text: Well I bought this last July 2017 and it is already broken! I saw a few unhappy people with this situation when I purchased it but thought it must have been a fluke with them. LOL anyway can anyone tell me how to go about doing something about this with an Amazon purchase? I'm sick and I just don't have time to research everything! To tell the truth... Aggravated! No power at all to the machine won't even come on or light up or anyting it's just dead like a doornail! Anyone have any advice? Please no you have to give it at least one star to even get the post posted.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Worst coffee maker ever , the “use n care guide “ supplied w/ the K15 has Keurig Hot as a heading after several calls to customer service dept. it was explained to me the heating element is smaller n 100-120 degs is normal ( which equals warm coffee NOT HOT!!)when it is deposited in a ceramic cup. Also I ordered a 30 cup assortment of what I thought would be an assortment of coffees,TURNS OUT IT IS MOSTLY TEAS N HOT CHOCLOT , it uses more coffee grounds n delivers a weeker Cup of only warm coffee then my old 10 cup coffee maker VARY DISOPOINTED WITH THE KEURIG K15!!!!!

This machine died less than 2 months after I purchased it. My first Keurig lasted over 5 years. As this is the least expensive model I think they make them poorly so you will "move up" to a more expensive model. I have gone back to using a peculator. Way less expensive, better for the environment and I get hot, not tepid coffee.

I have previously owned Keurig. It lasted about 21/2 years and stopped working. I recently purchased a new one from Amazon. I returned it because the heating element only heated my coffee to very warm instead of hot. So I returned it. I went to Target and bought another one and it works fine. I guess I just got a lemon. I bought another one because I like making only one cup of coffee at a time. That way the coffee is very fresh never over heated and strong.
reviews.review_header: Keurig K15 single serve compact K-cup Pod

reviews.review_text: I am very disappointed in this coffee maker. I use a large one at home and bought this for our RV. The coffee was too weak no matter how much water I put in the reservoir. Definitely not the same quality as the larger model. Sending this back!w
reviews.review_header: I am very disappointed in this coffee maker

reviews.review_text: i dont't like. not hot enough.
too much time spent cleaning the coffe maker, stops working every 3-4 cups, then out comes the paper clip, every one or two days, in the trash!!! I will go back to the Benn coffee maker.
reviews.review_header: too much time spent cleaning the coffe maker, stops ...

reviews.review_text: In less than 30 days, machine seemed to just stop brewing (button would turn red and then just cut off). Then it just started working again. However, I always have to hit it twice to make it turn red and start to brew. It doesn't automatically turn on after the water is heated as the instructions indicate. I just use it that way, because returning it was too much of a hassle.

This item was a terrible find. The first time I used this Keurig it BLEW UP! It all but caught on fire. I went exactly by the instructions. When it was time to brew the k cup the cup blew apart and melted as the heating unit began smoking. I do not recommend this Keurig. I bought it for my daughter going to college. Glad we tried it out before this happened in her room! I had to rate with a star or I couldn't post but I would not give this item any stars!

Worked for 2 months and then quit making coffee.... Tried to make coffee one morning, following same light prompts on the machine as usual, no coffee came out. Well, maybe three drops of coffee, came out, but only three drops. We drained the water and repeated the procedure of following the light prompts and again, no coffee. We tried this process five times that morning, then proceeded to the department store and bought another BRAND of coffee maker. I will never choose this particular coffee maker again.
reviews.review_header: Worked for 2 months and then quit making coffee. ...

reviews.review_text: Although made out of plastic, it is pretty. However, does not work for even a standard size mug. You have to remove drip tray and put your mug on counter. I don't know how well it works as I didn't try it, just the fact that it didn't take a standard size mug was enough for me to return it.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Don't know what it is but can't get more than 8 months out of these things . Like them but looking now into something else . Don't like buying a new one every year .

Don't buy it!!!!! I read and followed the user guide, but I never got a cup of coffee. i re-read their user guide and tried several more times; the POS would make noises like it was boiling the water, then a pumping noise, then all quiet, but no coffee. i finally added more water, pushed all the buttons, raised and lowered all the lids and handles. after a "pop" noise it sent out all 18 oz, what a mess. SO, bottom line, buy one of the cheaper Keurig copies,not a genuine Keurig POS.
reviews.review_header: the POS would make noises like it was boiling the water

reviews.review_text: Worst Keurig. Has to heat water every time it is used, even brewing 2 cups back to back. Cannot brew anything other than mild coffee.
reviews.review_header: Annoying, a ZERO for everything. Embarrassment for Keurig.

reviews.review_text: I’ve owned a full size Keurig for years, and it’s never given me a single problem. When we recently purchased a camper/trailer I decided to buy the single-serve version to keep in the camper. Before we left on our trip I did the “initial cleansing”, running a brew cycle with just water – perfect. Unfortunately, that was the one and only time that the Keurig worked. Once you press the “Brew” button it just blinks for a few minutes then shuts off – the water never heats. If you ever want to see someone in a panic, just take a coffee addict and leave her stranded miles from civilization, then have her wake-up to find that her new Keurig is dead. It wasn’t pretty (there may even have been a little crying, but you didn’t hear that from me). So little Keurig is making a return trip to Amazon, and I’m in a quandary – do I risk buying one of these single serve units again? Are they all just junk or did I get fluke? First World problems, right?
reviews.review_header: Died before it ever made a single cup of coffee - RIP

reviews.review_text: It didn't work for even 2 weeks! I've been away on business and now discover the return window was only a month. We flooded out here in Houston and I bought this since we lost our bigger Keurig. Now I'm stuck without anything.

I have been a Keurig customer for about 7 years and I am done. Never again will I buy one of these machines. When it works, it's awesome but it doesn't always work. This latest one that I bought only lasted about 3 months and then just stopped working. I can hear the machine going but coffee won't come out. Thankfully I've always kept a reliable drip coffee maker around for when my Keurig decides not to work.

This is the biggest piece of crap. Do not buy this piece of garbage. It either leaks water everywhere or does not make a coffee. When you put water in either nothing comes out or you never know how much coffee it makes. If you put too much it leaks water everywhere. There is no room to put an 8 oz coffee cup underneath so you have to remove the drip tray. I was informed by product support that you can not put more than 10 OZ of water or it will leak out everywhere. If you attempt to put in less than 10OZ you will not get a cup of coffee it does nothing. Product support is garbage.

The coffee maker is very bad because you cannot adjust the strength of it at all! I ordered this brand because I remember the first model that a friend had was amazing and gave really great coffee. However, this one is not the same. Every coffee I make comes out really watery and it's just a total waste.
I have had this at my desk since I purchased and have used it may 30 times and it no longer will disperse water. Talk about disappointed :(

It is really great and easy to use. I bought this as my first coffe machine. I am giving it 3 stars because it broke after 2 uses but I called customer service right away and they will be sending me a new one free of charge! Hopefully this one doesn't break!
reviews.review_header: It broke and I still like it

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I have two of these units in less than a month and both of them just stopped pumping the water into the cup. One made 3 cups of coffee the other maybe 10. I am most disappointed in the customer service that was never extended. When I asked if I was doing something wrong or if they would recommend a different unit NO ONE responded!! Oh I got a shipping label to send the unit back but now I have no coffee machine, No thanks to Keurig.
reviews.review_header: I am most disappointed in the customer service that was never extended

reviews.review_text: Works pretty well but seems to be made with cheap plastic. I've had it for a few months and although it's working, it's making a strange noise now.
reviews.review_header: Works pretty well but seems to be made with cheap plastic

reviews.review_text: JUNK! WEAK coffee. Brewed with different grounds, with filter and without filter, even passed thru brewed coffee twice. WEAK! Water keeps spewing on the back wall and on to tray and to the counter. Attractive color though.
reviews.review_header: JUNK! WEAK coffee. Brewed with different grounds, ...

reviews.review_text: I received my Keurig on January 16th of this year. My last date for return was February 15th. I loved my Keurig and used it frequently with no problems. On Friday, March 9th, it quit working. The lights go on and it sounds like it's brewing, but nothing comes out. This was my second Keurig (the first bought from Sam's Club) and neither one has been satisfactory. Now I have all these k-cups and no use for them.

Lasted about 6 weeks before it quit drawing in water from the reservoir. When I contacted Keurig the response was a link to their troubleshooting pages. Nothing specific to my problem. Nothing but an automated response.
reviews.review_header: Lasted about 6 weeks before it quit drawing in water ...

reviews.review_text: I bought two units replace two of the same I had for several years. I was worried about what is growing in the water reservoir/chamber after all these years. There is no way to see inside the water reservoir. These new units are the same as the old ones, just new packaging. I mean cardboard packaging, Both of the new units have a electrical HUM when plugged in. So I unplug after each use.

I bought this for my camper and unfortunately didn't test it out. Took it out 2 months later on a camping trip and it didn't work! I have a full size Keurig at home that works fine but this small K15 is a real disappointment and waste of money.

reviews.review_text: Within 8 weeks, the heating element began to go out. I called the company and they are sending me an upgrade free.

Although the K15 is small and doesn't take up a lot of counter space, it didn't meet my expectation as far as convenience, temperature or volume. Having to fill the reservoir and waiting for the water to heat up for each cup of coffee is not exactly convenient. The temperature of the coffee was also an issue...it was not hot. I love my bigger Keurig and bought this one for my girlfriend...she now has mine, do the math!
reviews.review_header: Spend a little more for the bigger one!

reviews.review_text: 1 month later and the Keurig quit working. As it goes, I am 3 days past the return deadline. Very upset I would give 0 stars if i could. $62 down the drain.

I thought that this single serve coffee maker would be the perfect fit for my needs - a single serving at a time, using fresh water pre-measured with the coffee cup being used, and the flexibility to use K-cups or my own coffee and filter. Unfortunately it doesn't perform. I get a yield of 1 oz. of coffee per brew and the water often leaks when it transfers from the reservoir to the heating chamber. Very disappointing.

Very unhappy I bought this. Inconsistent in the brewing.. sometimes it will work fine, next time will only dispense 1/2 of the water you pour in. You have to brew it twice to get the full amount. I use distilled water and am careful to put in the amount requested, follow instructions exactly. Just doesn’t work well. And I don’t like the taste of the coffee, which is also inconsistent in taste. Money wasted, time wasted.
Well, everything worked well, if you like warm coffee. I had to put the brewed coffee in the microwave to get it hot. If you like your coffee hot, don't buy this machine.

The machine works well and brews a nice cup of coffee. The unit seems a bit larger than it needs to be to hold 8-12 oz of water for brewing, but no big deal. There is no water reservoir, which works well for us, but getting the water into the machine is seriously annoying. You cannot just pour water in . . . You have to follow a specific sequence: 1. Turn it on. Why is it important for the power to be on? 2. You add water to the upper reservoir. If there is too much water, it drains through a siphon into the drip tray. Is that a feature somebody wants? 3. You have to open the K-Cup holder, even if you just want hot water. The water slowly gurgles down into the water tank. Slowly. Wait for it. 4. You can now start your brew. If you went through the sequence without turning it on first, you have to lift the lid and the K-Cup cover just to convince the machine that you went through all the steps. 5. If the person before you didn't wait for all of the water to gurgle from the top to the bottom then there is a chance that you will overfill your coffee. However, there is no way to stop it mid-brew. The machine thinks that it is the boss of me, but it is actually quite stupid. I guess that makes sense.

When I received this product in late October 2017 I was very pleased. Seemed to be perfect for me. Until yesterday, Feb 28, 2018, when it simply refused to power on. I did go through all the steps for Troubleshooting and I have followed instructions impeccably. 4 mos use from any appliance is very annoying. From an appliance with a supposedly good reputation is unacceptable. From what I have read, this is not an uncommon problem. Wish I had known that before I was in position to have to deal with Warranty.
reviews.review_header: 4 mos after purchase it refuses to turn on.

The size is perfect for our RV, but the operation is not intuitive. When you add the water to the reservoir, you need to lift the handle to put in the k-cup and keep it open for the water to drain into the heating chamber. Otherwise, you will get less than a full cup and the reservoir on the top will still have the water when the brew is complete. Once we figured that part out, it was fine.

Stay with your drip coffee maker. This coffee maker breaks easily and does not allow for a decent amount of coffee per serving. I have to run it twice to fill my coffee mug and it's impossible to fill my To Go mug. The drip tray is made with CHEAP materials and is not very functional.

I donated that machine and bought a Hamilton Beach 49981A Single Serve Scoop Coffee Maker which has worked beautifully for almost 5 years. The only thing is that you have to clean it after every use. I bought it in May but didn't actually start using it until July. All I can say is that Keurig disappoints again. For the past week, the machine now will only brew half a cup of coffee. And then when it feels like it, it will use up all of the water that it hasn't used for the previous cups into one so you better be ready with another cup so you don't have a hot mess in your hands. Needless to say I'm not even going to donate that machine. I'm going to throw it in the trash. You could not pay me enough money to buy a Keurig machine. Lesson learned.
