name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: My wife and I were looking for something that took up less space on our counter while we were living in an apartment waiting for our house to be built... the Keurig K15. It's compact and doesn't take up nearly as much space as my K55. There are three minor setbacks that you should be aware of. 1) There is no reservoir.. Water must be added every time you wish to brew a cup. We thought it'd be smart for us to just keep one cup of water always "loaded' in the heating tank and another cup in the measuring reservoir... that was a mistake. We quickly found out that once you open to put a k-cup in, it dumps the water from the measuring reservoir into the heating tank. The heating tank was already full and water went all over the counter. 2) Because there is no tank, the machine heats the water on demand. This takes additional 2-3 mins to brew. 3) It's definitely shorter than I expected. It's actually too short to fit any of our regular 10 oz mugs without removing the drip tray. Kind of a bummer because it's definitely not tall enough, even with the drip tray removed, to fit any of our travel mugs. This isn't to say that your regular/travel mugs won't work, but ours didn't. We just leave the drip tray removed all the time. When we want to use our travel mugs, we have to use two cups to get the job done. I've included some photos so you can see what I'm referring to. I have to take a 1 star away for the fact that, without removing the drip tray, it doesn't really fit anything other than standard 6-8 oz cups (like you might find a Denny's or IHOP). I would take a 2nd star away because, although it can brew a 10 oz cup, it doesn't fit ANY of our insulated travel mugs. Obviously that's not Keurig's fault but it still annoys me that I have to brew into one cup and pour it into my travel mug..

One difference I notice in this version of this model Keurig, is that it needs to have vinegar run through it much more often than an earlier version of this model does. So if your coffee begins to taste "off" you will need to clean it, even though it may not have been that long since it was last cleaned. Otherwise, as convenient as the earlier version.

Got this to replace my broken Keurig. I like that it is pretty, has a small footprint for my small kitchen, easy to use and makes coffee. I usually make coffee in the morning and a cup of hot chocolate or Gevalia Cappuccino in the evenings so this is used daily and I am enjoying the experience.
reviews.review_header: Its a coffee maker and it looks great

reviews.review_text: I've never owned a coffee pot and I'm in my mid 30's. quickly became the daily use in my home. Kcups are great for easy coffee and hot beverage making. I also purchased the reusable filter to use my own products as well as several different flavor cups. Great price on the product. Water isn't stored it is single use. Directions for use are simple and effective. Easy cleaning. 6, 8, and 10 oz from one machine.
reviews.review_header: Great value for a fantastic product.

reviews.review_text: My husband and I have been on the fence for years about getting one of these single serve products. My mother-in-law has this in her home and we really liked the fact that it was compact, simple & easy to use. Makes up to a 10 oz drink. You can remove the tray to put a slightly taller mug, but nothing tall like a travel mug (plus, you would need to make 2 separate servings to fill a travel mug). Just pour what you make in a regular mug into a travel or taller mug. There's no water storage container; you pour water before you make you coffee/tea. Not a big deal for us and we like knowing we have fresh water with each serving. BTW we have a regular full size coffee maker, but sometimes we only want one cup &/or something special (flavored coffee). This Keurig is perfect just for that. We've been using this for almost a month. No problems at all.

I purchased this mini Keurig to take with me when I visit my son, who doesn't drink coffee. I must have my morning coffee! (Keurig needs to make a travel case!) It also saved the day when the carafe broke on our regular coffee pot -- I used it until the replacement carafe arrived. It is easy to use and brews quickly. The drain tray is removable to accommodate taller mugs (see photo), but I wish it would accept more than 10 oz. of water so that you can better adjust the strength of the coffee. I haven't had any quality problems so far, using it intermittently.

I had a larger Keurig before buying this one. I like this one much better. It takes up much less space on the counter and I actually like that water doesn't sit in it all the time. There are measuring indicators inside that tell you where the 6, 8, and 10oz level is, but I find it easier to just fill up my cup and pour it in. It is quiet, fast, and shuts off automatically after 90 seconds of non use.

So far so good. We are really happy with our purchase. I would like to update my review of this product because I noticed that some people were not happy with it. That's not our case. My husband and I are really happy to have bought this Keurig K-cup Coffee Maker. I strongly recommend to people with small space in the kitchen (like us) to do not buy anything bigger than this. It has the perfect size to be placed in a corner. It doesn't have the extra space to store water but to be honest in our case is not necessary because my husband and I eat breakfast on different times so with this model you make sure that your coffee is always fresh. Still really happy with our purchase.

Updated 2/21/18 My initial review was rather harsh but after using for over a month, have bumped this up to 4 stars. The machine makes a consistent cup of coffee and has proved to be a good value. The beverage could be hotter but this remedied by an $8 cup warmer-coaster-thingie. You must follow these steps: 1. Fill mug/cup with water and pour it in the reservoir while pod holder is closed. 2. Place cup under pod dispenser. (More about this later.) 3. Open pod dispenser; water drains to warming tank. 4. Place pod in holder. 5. Do not close pod holder and press the button on the lower right front of the machine. 6. A light illuminates telling you to close the pod holder. (God forbid you close it before this step . . .) 7. The brew button on the upper right front of the machine illuminates. Push it. You'll have coffee in about 2 minutes. Back to step #2. Since I picked on the engineers in my first review, I now have to give them some love. I was distracted the other day and had to leave my desk right after starting a brew cycle. When I returned, I could smell coffee but there was no cup on the machine. Alas, I did not place the cup on the machine. I was looking around for a mess but found none. The machines is designed for the cup to sit on a drip tray. This tray holds an entire cup of coffee! That made my day!! In summary, I would give this machine 5 stars if produced a hotter brew. Someone reviewed this machine as "coffee with compromise" which is an excellent summary. But with a little help, I have good coffee each day and save at least $50 monthly on Starbucks while at work. Nice! Original Review You must read the instructions and not deviate one iota or you will have a hot mess on your hands! I got it downs after a few mishaps and it makes a fair cup of coffee. The coffee temp is not as hot as my Zojirushi full size maker at home so I would never use one these at the house. I bought this to save money because my yearly coffee bill at work was close to $1K. I placed the machine on my desk. The overall size is okay. Once I purchased condiments, etc. my cost now weighs in around $250 yearly, if I can keep finding Starbuck K cups on sale. The 75% reduction is worth a fair cup of coffee, I use a ceramic cup so I bought a $7 cup warmer to remedy the temperature issue.
reviews.review_header: Definitely Designed By An Engineer and Not A User

reviews.review_text: This coffeemaker works as expected and produces a great cup of coffee everytime. I thougth the reservoir was going to hold more than one cup of water, but it is not something that I would complain about. I just would have wanted to know that before purchasing the product. So, for those interested in this product, know that this unit does not come with a reserve tank for water. You pour in the amount of water you want to brew. I use the cup I plan on drinking out of to measure out the amount of water, fill the machine with it, turn the machine on, insert my k-cup and hit the start button. It's a simple process that doesn't take long at all.
reviews.review_header: This machine brews a great single cup of coffee.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I got this for my desk at work and it is small enough to not make that big of an impact on my desktop real-estate. To use it you have to pour water into the reservoir every time and make sure you are putting in the exact amount you want. It doesn’t measure for you like other keurigs do, and won’t store water in a reservoir like the larger ones. It uses the same K-Cups as all the other keurigs and it produces the same quality hot beverages as the larger keurigs.
reviews.review_header: It doesn’t measure for you like other keurigs do

reviews.review_text: This thing has a bit of a learning curve - with its simplicity (no reservoir) you'd think it'd be easy, but please note: the "brew" button turns RED when it's BREWING. Does that sound idiotic, because red lights normally indicate an error? Yeah, that's what I (and at least 3 guests at my house) thought too. But once you figure out that your coffee is actually brewing, and you did not, in fact, break the coffee machine before you even properly used it, you will love it :)
reviews.review_header: I recommend but watch out for the red light :)

reviews.review_text: I love this coffee maker & i love how easy it is to use. I bought one to keep in my bedroom and i love how it's not too big and can fit anywhere.

I love it - I had a regular classic that took up a lot of space and this one better suits my studio apartment that has very little counter space. Some other reviewers complained about how long it takes to brew and not being able to use mugs. I don't think it takes that long to brew - if you have a different model with a reservoir and you start from it being off, it's about the same amount of time to heat up. Yes - you cannot fit traveling mugs. Large size mugs will fit OK if you remove the drip tray. I also heard stories about dirt/mold that builds up in the reservoir of the classic version of the Keurig's, so I kind of like that this one doesn't have that. So far - I'm loving it. The coffee itself - doesn't seem as strong as a regular version but not bad overall.
reviews.review_header: I love it. Compact but fits my small studio apartment.

reviews.review_text: Love it! So perfect for on the go mornings. Only downside is that most of my mugs don't fit the space. Just make sure you have short mugs!

Pretty great little coffee brewer, I’m not one to drink a lot of coffee at once so this is perfect. Mine did not come with the plastic cup measurement guide that goes in the water reservoir but there’s really no need for it. The pot brews exactly the amount of water poured into it. I haven’t had any issues that others have mentioned.

This is a good coffee maker. It hasn't leaked; it gets the water very hot; it's attractive. Keep in mind - 12 oz (the most this machine can do) is not a lot. Your big to go cup holds more. Also, measure the height of your cups! This will not handle a cup that's more than about 4.5", and that is with the bottom section removed. I found a very nice to go cup at Target that fits perfectly- brand is called Bueno.

Works perfectly for our RV. We "tried" a press pot in RV but it's a mess.. That is no big deal in a home but on the road a press pot is a pain. This little guy is not heavy, uses very little counter space and stores easily. Getting the cups measured perfectly to prevent overflow took some getting used to. It's not like the big Kurig that measures for you. We 100% recommend this guy for RV travelers. Small and gets the job done fast with zero cleanup.

I got my Keurig K-Mini K15 in August 2017. It was everything that I had hoped for after buying several substitutes and having to return them within 7-14 days! It has been great for the entire time I had it until about 2 weeks ago and it just stopped dispensing coffee. I had to turn it upside down to dump out the water. I ran vinegar and water through it several times and then straight water another few times. Bang, it was back in tip top shape (I thought.) Today it started acting up again. At first try it just dripped 4-5 drops and stopped. I opened it up and set it to brew again and it did a little more. It took me another SIX ATTEMPTS before my mug was full. I really want to give it my full support but I'm wary. I'll re-do the cleaning and see how it goes, but if it continues to act up, the stars will go down!
reviews.review_header: After 8 months it's starting to play up.

reviews.review_text: I love this little kureig. I thought it would be cumbersome to fill each time and it would heat up slow, but it doesn't. It's super fast. The coffee is hot but not too hot to drink. It shuts off itself. I purchased the pewter one it looks so sleek. I ordered reusable pods to better honor the environment. I am pleased with my purchase.
reviews.review_header: Great little kuruig for fresh cup anytime

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I am so pleased to receive this lovely Keurig compact K-cup pod coffee. It is great for a cup of coffee when I feel like it there is no mess with using the lids and that is such a change from my normal percolator. It looks so nice in my kitchen and the packaging was excellent so no breakages occurred.

This is absolutely amazing. I've wanted a Keurig for years and I just stumbled upon this while on my free trial of Amazon Prime. I was able to find one "used" but not even touched by anyone (like someone had returned it without opening it). It was in the original packaging and just absolutely gorgeous when I unboxed it! I'm not sure why, but I also received a HUGE supply (40 ct.) of a "customized variety pack" of K-Cups (and other brands) that I was NOT expecting, and it was such a great surprise! They used UPS to send it out to me, which was great because Amazon deliverers don't usually knock, but UPS always does so I knew my valuable Jade Keurig was out there on my doorstep. Best shipping experience ever. I would recommend buying this Keurig off Amazon for any Keurig beginners!
reviews.review_header: Hands down, the BEST shipping experience.

reviews.review_text: I am very pleased with the size since I have a small kitchen with very little counter space to spare. I was however ready to return it because it was missing THE WATER LEVEL GUIDE that was drawn and mentioned in several places in the User Guide. I called Keurig (very nice and helpful customer service) and found out that this new model no longer has this part. Instead it had dots on the lid attachment to indicate water level for size cup you choose to make. So, my only complaint is that they should make new user guides. The missing part, that really wasn't missing, made me feel like I'd received a machine that had been returned. So 4 stars.

My Gen 1 B60 started malfunctioning a few months ago and I've been looking for a replacement. I his was the second B60 I've had fail in less th 5 years (this was the original unit's warranty replacement). I didn't want to spend more than $100 dollars on a Keurig when they fail outside of warranty. I like the flexibility of being able to use K-Cups as well as my own coffee. This unit had fewer features but was in the price range I was after.. Cons: Doesn't auto fill / preheat between cups (no fill reservoir) so longer time brewing Loud Doesn't fit a standard travel mug (max cup height with drip tray removed a little over 5") Without drip tray, overflow spills onto counter Max fill 10 Oz (unless you use trick below) Pros: Small footprint on counter Can brew more than 10 Oz at one time using trick below Simple, one-button operation It will fit an oversize mug with drip tray removed Uses old style My K-Cup with your ground coffee Normal procedure has you fill the reservoir first then load the coffee. More than 10 Oz water will overflow down to the drip tray. When you open the coffee chamber the water drains from the reservoir and flows down to the heating unit. If you open both at the same time, you can fill more than 10 Oz - the pump runs until the heating unit is empty. Over all, I gave this unit a 4 because it may be too loud for an office-cube environment, and because it doesn't fit a normal travel mug.

I waited a long time to buy a Keurig because I don't drink coffee so didn't want to pay over $100 for it. A search of all the K-Cup varieties on amazon (herbal tea, hot chocolate, etc.) convinced me I should get one at this great price. Although the instructions say you can put a maximum of 10 oz. of water in it, I've put 12 oz. and it comes out fine. And if you like a really hot drink, this machine will make it so, and the strength will be great.
reviews.review_header: Great even for people who don't drink coffee

reviews.review_text: My big Keurig broke. They do. I had purchased this model in jade (prettyj for my sister when she came home from rehab after breaking her leg. She likes things simple, and this looked easy to operate. It is. She loves it. Later that month when my Keurig broke, I decided to go for this one because I love its small footprint and splashy red color. It works fine, makes excellent coffee, is easy to operate. I have it on my counter next to the sink because it has no reservoir and must be filled for each cup. I kept the large one on the other end of the counter but always kept a pitcher of fresh water next to it to refill. I suppose you could do that if you have no space next to sink. If you use a taller mug, you will have to slide out the well under the spout, but that is no problem. I like this machine a lot.
reviews.review_header: and this looked easy to operate

reviews.review_text: I'm glad I got this compact Keurig. I'm using it on a boat, so I don't have a lot of counter space. This smaller unit fits nicely. I'm liking everyting about the coffee maker, but for some reason, our unit was delivered without the water level indicator disks shown on line and in the manual. You don't have to have the water level indicator to use the machine of course, but it would have been a nice convenience. I checked the Keurig website, and I didn't find the water level insert sold separately.
reviews.review_header: Water Level Indicator Not Included with Shipment

reviews.review_text: What a neat gadget. I was a bit skeptical at first, because of several negative reviews, but since the positive reviews were in the majority I went ahead and took a chance. So far, it works perfectly, exactly as described. Amazingly simple and easy to use. Very fast. Coffee comes out nice and hot. We have a large Bunn drip coffee maker which we use first thing in the morning when we both have a couple of cups, but for later in the day when I only want one cup, this is perfect.

We bought this April 2017 and have used it everyday. It makes the best coffee and easy to use. Doesnt take a lot of room on the counter and is perfect. Yesterday morning, Feb 10, 2017 it decided to not work. No warning at all. Put in water and coffee pressed button - nothing. No light nothing at all. So we moved to a different plug - still wont work. I purchased a 3 year extra warranty thru Asurion and emailed them. Within minutes I got a return call and they told me to call Keurigs 800 number. So I did. The guy was wonderful, apologized and said they would send me a new coffee maker within 3 days. I was shocked expecting a run around and got none. Nothing but help.
reviews.review_header: Great coffee maker - even when it has an issue

reviews.review_text: Works great and I got it for a good deal. This is definitely a good size for a dorm with only 2 people that will be using it. Make sure you read the manual on the proper care for it, like always make sure to use bottled or filtered water in your Keurig. Edit- 4/15/17: After using this for a while, it started having a few issues. Once in a while it would stop brewing and the water would be stuck inside it, which will drain into the bottom and make a mess. I think I fixed the issue by doing a few cycles of just water. Also, the print on the "brew" button has completely rubbed off.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: We replaced a big Keurig that had a water tank on the outside with this single cup brewer. We love it! HOT coffee or tea in less than two minutes. Quiet operation. Always a clean cup of fresh water going in...no water sitting in the tank. Great purchase! UPDATE: After using this pot maybe three times, it totally quit working!! Imagine how disappointed I was...AND I had already thrown out the box that it had come in. A quick call to Amazon and I had another pot ON THE WAY with one-day shipping ! No cost to return it with Prime Membership. New pot arrived today, and defective one is on the way back to Amazon. Easiest return ever! So far, so good with this coffeemaker! It is quick, hot, and very efficient! Thanks Amazon.
reviews.review_header: We love it! HOT coffee or tea in less than ...

reviews.review_text: Works great and easy to use. Convenient for a desk top or a quick cup of coffee. Keep in mind that since this is a smaller unit if you plan to use this for on the go coffee with a travel mug, most travel mugs are too tall for it, you may need to brew in a cup a transfer. A bit of a pain if you are using this in a dorm with that purpose in mind, thus removing 1 star.
reviews.review_header: Works great and small, but not great for use with travel mugs unless you have a short one.

reviews.review_text: this is the second Keurig I have ever had-the first lasted several years and gave great service as well. I wanted the smallest size because I am the only coffee drinker in my house and usually only have one cup a day. I had heard that machines with water reservoirs were prone to getting mold if the water was left in so this is just perfect. I make my single cup-there is no excess water. The coffee comes out hotter than in my previous model which I appreciate. It works very quickly-I put it on as soon as I get into the kitchen and the coffee is ready by the time I pour my cereal and juice. this is a great model and the price is right
reviews.review_header: Great if you don't have a lot of coffee drinkers in your household

reviews.review_text: I like it, BUT, one month after receiving, part of the print on the two silver buttons was half gone, and by two months, there was no printing on the buttons at all. Just seems very odd to me.

I really wanted a Keurig for afternoon cappucino and to have more variety for guests. I still use a traditional coffee maker for my daily cup of Gevalia espresso roast, so I didn't want to pay a lot for something that would be used maybe once a week. The mini fits this bill! I also like that you can fill your cup with the desired amount of water instead of trying to figure out what the buttons mean on the traditional Keurig models.
reviews.review_header: Great value for occasional Keurig user (or guests!)

reviews.review_text: This is the 5th Keurig K 15 I have purchased . I gave them as gifts , and bought one for home and one for the cottage . If this kind of repeat purchase doesn't scream "I LOVE THIS MACHINE " then I just don't what to tell you . I like the idea of fresh water for each cup . No left over flat water ever . Also the machine heats the water and servers your coffee in 90 sec. and it is hotter than any brewer that has been keeping the water hot all day .

We've owned several Keurigs but this is my first single cup coffee maker. It was a little tricky to figure out how to make it brew but I finally got it. The measuring is a little hit and miss and you have to do everything in just the right order: 1) Turn on the machine, 2) Pour in the water, 3) Lift the lever and hold it until all the water is dispensed into the heat area, 4) Insert your K cup, 5) Place your regular coffee cup on the holder (it won't hold tall or large cups), 6) Press the brew button. Once I got it, it works fine. I'm just grateful I have my K cup coffee at work!!

Easy to use. Makes coffee fast. We like this size coffee maker than the larger Keurig ... It takes up less counter space, add fresh water each time and 3 sizes to choose for your coffee. I got tired of the larger Keurig having to unplug the needles weekly. We cleaned per Keurig instructions but the larger Keurig would continually get plugged up either dribbling a few drops of coffee and stopping the process or not working at all. This smaller single serve Keurig is awesome ... So far ... and we hope to enjoy for a longer time than our larger one that we are now getting rid of. We most likely will purchase another one to use in our RV when we go camping.
reviews.review_header: AWESOME K15 Classic Single Serve Coffee Maker

reviews.review_text: I've owned several Keurig coffee makers and really enjoyed them. After some time, my first one lasted 5 years, it's time for a new one. I wanted to downsize just to save some money and counter space so the compact was perfect. It worked like a charm for about 3 months till one morning I made a cup and went back for another and NOTHING!!! Did all the trouble shooting I could think of and then called Keurig. They also tried some simple fixes and nothing. Because it was less than a year old I was able to get an exchange. Not only an exchange but they recommended an upgraded one. Sure enough, today three days later my new one arrived. Now all I have to do is set it up, put the broken one in the new box and ship it off. So easy!!!

Perfect single size. I like the fact that I don't have to clean out the water reservoir as often as I would on a larger unit as there is no standing water. I did learn I could pour in a larger cup of water when I lifted the front piece to allow to the water to continue to flow into the unit. Since I use my cup to pour in the water, there is no overflow. Also, very quick heating process

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I bought this because it's healthier: can use fresh coffee; water always fresh. Seems to be working out fine. Doesn't take up so much room either.

Works great! You do have to fill the water resevoir for each cup, each time you make it. Not a big deal, but an extra step compared to ones that allow you to fill the tank for several cups at a time. Fits standard mug and removing the tray at the bottom gives you a little extra room for a larger cup if needed. I'm a coffee snob and this makes a decent cup!

I had a large Keurig coffee maker and loved it, but it finally gave out. I purchased this one for travel and to use at home (it takes up less space) It works just like my larger one except that it won't accommodate my larger coffee mug, but the truth be told even the larger coffee maker doesn't make more than a 10oz cup anyway, a very small compromise. I was hoping it would be smaller, but will still be taking this on vacation so I can have my coffee in my hotel! I am very happy with this item.
reviews.review_header: I had a large Keurig coffee maker and loved it, but it finally gave out

reviews.review_text: Earlier malfunction - Amazon with usual quality customer satisfaction, replaced. Received last night - enjoyed HOT! cuppa coffee this morning made with my Keurig/K-cup/red pepper colored appliance...better than before! Would highly recommend Amazon sensitivity to customer - Amazon.com friend to buyer objective to provide fulfillment of my wishes, need, expectations - especially as disabled, without transportation, senior! Thank you Amazon.com team!

I kind of do not understand how this works. I thought that I needed filters or something so I went on to purchase some just to find out that they do not fit. They kpod holder is really hard to take a part. I haven't used the machine yet but I wanted to test it for cleaning purposes for my mom. Once I knew it all, I was going to teach her. Guess I'll go to YouTube to find out more details eventually.

Love our Keurig @ home & ordered this unit to use in our RV. After almost 2 wks. of use, we are happy with it. Another reviewer mentioned a chemical taste & returned the unit. Before use, I ran water through it @ least 3-4 times & I didn't think the coffee tasted real good the 1st few days I brewed coffee. Even thought about returning it but the next day, the coffee turned out good. As others reviewers have said, I'm hoping it doesn't break as there are a lot of poor reviews.
reviews.review_header: Happy with K15 so far - hope it doesn't break!

reviews.review_text: I love the compact size and cheerful red color for my kitchen and believe the only down side is having to use purified water rather than my hard tap water along with no reservoir...but pleased overall with my purchase as I'm enjoying the Keurig experience!
reviews.review_header: Overall I'm enjoying the Keurig experience

reviews.review_text: I got this for a small-space application, and it's perfect. It does not store any water. You pour from a bottle on-demand. After a lot of consideration I decided this would be perfect instead of allowing a small tank of water to get old. The steps to brew take a little bit to grow accustomed to, as it must be more closely followed than with the larger brewers. But the space-savings was the driving force, and it's a winner in that category.
reviews.review_header: and it's perfect. It does not store any water

reviews.review_text: We bought this coffeemaker for my memory-impaired mother-in-law, who now lives with us. I finally got tired of her making a full pot of coffee every morning and forgetting to ever drink it. Much less waste this way, and NO clean-up. This machine has no bells or whistles and no timers to program, so it is very straightforward and simple enough even for someone with mild-to-moderate memory loss to operate safely. There is no reservoir to fill, so the water must be added each time the machine is used. Some people complained about the machine being too small for a larger mug to be put under the spout. It will accommodate a slightly taller mug if you remove the drip tray, but we only have shorter ones, so personally, this is a non-issue for us. This little beauty has been a nice addition to my kitchen because now my mother-in-law can have fresh coffee every time, and if she forgets to drink it, there is only one cup to toss. The minimal waste makes me feel a little better. Lastly, we love the cheeky blue color! All in all, this was a good idea.

If you camp with a trailer set up with a rear galley, this little coffee machine may come in handy. I have to turn it sideways when shutting the galley door, but it fits that way fine. I use a refillable K-Cup device to avoid putting more waste in the campground trash. One thing I should mention is that you should only put one serving of water in at a time. The machine does not work well with more. I love that it shuts itself off.
reviews.review_header: Great Little Coffeemaker For Camper Trailers

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: My husband bought a single cup Keurig used at a local Goodwill, and it worked great for nearly two years. When it finally died, I purchased this one. It has a tendency to clog when I use some K-cups (not pods) - and even the Keurig brand cups have caused it to clog. Takes a long time to poke all the holes clear with a paper clip. I know that's a problem with the single use Keurigs, but the old one rarely clogged, and this one clogs much more frequently. Sigh.

Ok, I waited a bit before leaving this review. I had read reviews and was worried about a few things but it turns out (IMHO) some of the "problems" are from people NOT following directions. First I ordered the Keurig that I thought would work best for ME. I did not want a reservoir as I only usually drink one cup a day so I got the smallest one. I'm LOVING it! Used to just drink my instant. Now its like I get a Coffee House experience daily but even better I can just heat the water in the Keurig for my instant too if I've run out of K-cups. I've had a blast trying different coffees and a few teas and am saving the hot chocolates for winter:) So - no problems here but I do have some suggestions. If you don't want the needle to get gummed up DON'T leave the used Kcup in it for grounds to dry out in it. Dispose immediately after making. I'd suggest just using it to heat water on a regular basis too. Next - there is a certain order to how this unit MUST be operated. First pick out your coffee, then measure water for cup (must be LESS than the gauges in top or water WILL run over into bottom) pour into top. Turn unit ON. Lift section where pod goes - this allows water to run into heating chamber- be sure to wait til all has run down. Put in pod, close and press the flashing blue button. My coffee has always been more than hot enough. Remove used pod (careful - hot!) and toss) If you follow this you should be trouble free and enjoy your coffee. So far my best Coffee has been from the "Real Good Coffee" company. Love my Keurig, feel so special each morning now - and I don't pay Starbucks for it! I also got the Keurig rolling tray to keep my pods in and the maker goes on top with my sugar containers. Rolls back each morning!
reviews.review_header: First I ordered the Keurig that I thought would work best for ME

reviews.review_text: I like the coffee maker - it works fine and I can buy the Folgers K-cups at my local grocer. The biggest problem is after I registered the product, I am on their e-mail list and cannot find a way to get off. The say to visit their unsubscribe page but when you get there it lacks a place to opt out. I drink 5-6 cups a day but I'm the only coffee drinker so being able to make one cup at a time is a real boon. I recommend the K15 to anyone.
Bought this for the camper and it works great, takes up less space than the other unit and everyone gets their coffee, tea, hot chocolate etc

I am so happy with my Keurig coffee maker. I recently moved from a large 2 bedroom home to a small 1 bedroom apartment and the counter space on the kitchen is nearly 1/2 of what I used to have available. This is the perfect replacement for my 12 cup coffeemaker, which I sold via Facebook Marketing. So this is the perfect size, makes one heck of a great cup of excellently brewed hot coffee. So important for my morning commute to work or just to laze around with on the weekends!

I'm a full time grad student, work full time, and mom full time to a 5 month old. This works great. Takes up less space, heats fairly quickly, has carrying cup sizes, just what I need. I've had it for two days and between tea and coffee I've used it probably a dozen times already. It takes a couple tries to get the water measurement right but once you get it you'll love it.
reviews.review_header: This works great. Takes up less space

reviews.review_text: I discovered that after pouring the water in the top and then lifting the section where the k-cup sits, be sure and wait 15 seconds or so until you hear the water fall into the next chamber before hitting the brew button. Otherwise, the cup doesn't fill up completely and it can be messy. Once I learned this trick, I found out I really love this brewer!
reviews.review_header: Nice compact size - especially if traveling. See tip to prevent problems with brewing size

reviews.review_text: I bought this smaller keurig for a vacation home. I like the idea that the water you pour in is immediately used to make coffee... none stored in machine reservoir or tank. Works great for what I needed

This is the third Keurig I have bought- this one was for my father who lives alone. He does not always have coffee but wanted to able to make a cup for himself without wasting the rest of the pot. It is perfect for him. He turns it on, adds the water, makes his coffee and he is done. I have a Keurig with a reservoir as several people will make different beverages within 10 minutes at my house.

A terrific buy for travel....a bit higher priced than the competing models but it is rock solid and worked fine. I love this in my hotel room as the coffee makers supplied by most hotels are only so-so and the in-room coffee is usually blah but with this Keurig I can bring my own coffee and brew as much of it as I want, and just like it’s big brothers in the Keurig line the coffee it makes is delicious. Also you can brew 8 or 10 ounce sizes. A great buy!
reviews.review_header: This is the one to buy!

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Thought I'd have to wait a while in order to get this Keurig in this blue color I fell in love with. My very 1st one and after being scared off by so many negative reviews of keurigs in general I decided to go ahead. It came 2 weeks earlier than promised and so far, after3-4 months it has worked perfectly evry time. I bought my own "K-CUPS" from Keurig, a 2 pack, and fill my own with Starbucks coffee. I have even begun to drink my coffee black because its so good and so hot every time. Plus the blue color looks outstanding in my yellow kitchen!!
reviews.review_header: ... this Keurig in this blue color I fell in love with. My very 1st one and after being ...

reviews.review_text: I ordered a K15 but got a K10??? I read up on the two and don't see much difference so I guess it doesn't matter a great deal, but when I order an item (K15) I expect to get what I ordered. It makes a very good cupa however and is easy to use. I like the fact that there is no reservoir so each cup is made with fresh water. There is a water level guide in the top which is not really necessary because you just have to fill the size cup you want to use with water and pour it in the top and that makes just the right amount of coffee for your cup. No need to measure ounces.
reviews.review_header: Why did I get a K10 when I ordered a K15?

reviews.review_text: I am really enjoying my Keurig K- 15 . Brews great coffee and herbal tea. I have purchased the little K cups that you fill with your own coffee and have enjoyed my favorite blends at a reasonable price this way also. The red looks outstanding on my black granite countertops - just another bonus for me ! Some of the reviews I read were negative because you can only pour 10 ounces of water in the reservoir at a time. For me this was a positive. I bought this appliance because of the convenience of being able to brew one piping hot coffee or tea at a time . So I guess you have to consider your lifestyle and what you're looking for when you purchase .

I think that this Keurig is a very good solution for people that only want a quick morning coffee and quick cups during the afternoon. It is low cost compared to other Keurigs. The feature I like but others may not sit the fact that I pour fresh water into coffee maker and I get what I put into the machine. Other Keurigs have reservoirs usually plastic where you leave water sitting all day or all night. I prefer the ease and freshness of single cup.
reviews.review_header: I think that this Keurig is a very good solution for people that only want a quick morning ...

reviews.review_text: This is my second small Keurig love this color just had to have it, one cup at a time is perfect for me no waste plenty of choices to choose from. The main thing to prolong your Keurig is at least once a month run vinegar through it, W hen I get tired of my cobalt blue by the way I have had it for 3+ yrs no problems, I bring out my Chilli pepper, great price great buy.

I'm enjoying the coffee maker, and happy to have it. The "flaw" that was reported as the reason for the low price doesn't seem to be there; at least I can't find one. However, I have noticed that water seems to magically disappear; far more than should be from evaporation. I put in 10 oz of water and get only 8 oz of coffee. Something you have to adjust for. Where does it go? In the K-cup, plus evaporation? That much? That's about 20%! Is anyone else having this happen?

This keurig arrived on time without damage. It was a great gift for my mother-in-law because it doesn't have the extra water tank. She puts it away in the cabinet after each use so the extra tank would have been inconvenient for her. She has used it for a month without issues so it is a hit!

difficult to see water line. supposed to add the water needed for each cup as you make each cup, but if you do the events out of sequence, the water goes into the reservoir. . .and I cannot see the water line to see how much more to add. So, then its a guessing game when I hit the brew button. Other than that, good cheap quality product for the office use.
reviews.review_header: good cheap quality product for the office use

reviews.review_text: This is the perfect little compact machine. We bought this one to take with us when we travel. We take it right into our room and plug it in and have our favorite cup of coffee right there perfect. If we have found a special coffee we can use our own reusable K cup and enjoy that coffee on our trip. What more could you want. Great coffee anytime anyplace.

I love a single serve coffee maker. And I love how this is simple and small and quick and efficient. But if you like your coffee strong, you will need to make your own coffee pods with one of the plastic k cups out there. That is easy enough. So I use all the regular kcups to keep in the drawer I bought for underneath, but I often make my own with the plastic reusable kcup. Like this machine VERY much. Four stars because I wish it made just a little bit larger cup of coffee.
reviews.review_header: I love a single serve coffee maker

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: Simple to set up and use. Instructions provided were clear and helpful. Takes less than 5 min to use. Be warned that the coffee output part is low on the machin. I cant fit a thermos under there, but a mug works. I just use a bowl and transfer from there. You cant make a lot of coffee with this - would not recommend as an office machine.

I only drink coffee in the morning and usually only one cup, two at the most. I needed a single maker instead of the large one I had. The Keurig has worked great. I also bought an adapter to use regular coffee but it is easier to use the K cups. Only downside is the price of K cups but ease of use is worth it. I highly recommend this machine.

So far it works great. It is the compact unit so it certainly has some limitations. The reservoir has room for 1 cup only and tall cups won't fit . I knew all of this when I got it but for me it is occasional use and I didn't want it to take up a bunch of counter space. I am happy with the purchase.

I love my mini Keurig. It's so convenient to make your own coffee at home and taste as good or even better when I make my coffee with my Keurig. I have it for a month now and no issues at all. The only thing is I drink 16 oz coffee every morning filling up my travel mug, I have to use 2 k-cup. The coffee taste so much lighter if I only use 1 k-cup even on 10 oz water. Transferring the coffee to my travel mug and brewing 2 times is the only hassle for me. But I can live with that. Over all I love the size and the ease of use. I also bought a a reusable k-cup and filter and use it once in a while. I recommend to have the reusable k -cup too if you wanna save more money on k-cups
I just love this little coffee maker. This is my second one. Yeah, they do wear out, but I used my last one 2 or 3 times a day for at least 4 years.

I am Super Happy with my Keurig K-Mini Single Serve machine. My past machines were taking up too much room in my new home that I am downsizing into but hated giving up the convience of my quick tea coffee & these days Hot Chocolate!! There is no mess, it fits perfect in the corner and looks neat and clean. I can still have my full variety of K-cups. You fill the fill the desired amount of water you want pour it in the top and hit BREW. No longer hitting several buttons trying to figure out what size and what brew to use. It’s geeat to take with you if you go on road trips which I do quite often on the boat or up North too. I still have my larger machines packed away for Holidays or larger crows but for every day, this has been Great!
reviews.review_header: Super easy and tastes delicious just like the larger machines!

reviews.review_text: Bought this small Keurig for our boat. We have a full size one at home which I like much much better. I feel like the K15 does not brew as hot a cup of coffee as the bigger units. Its not as convenient to pour the water in the back of the unit, but we needed this compact design to fit the space. However, its fine for a weekend here or there, but I wouldnt want it for everyday use. If you are someone who doesnt drink coffee very often, its probably fine.

Great small coffee maker. Makes coffee quickly and easily. Best advice from a reviewer was to use the cup/mug you are using to pour waiter into tank. Know how much water your cup holds first and then you will never overfill.

Love this Keurig k-mini. I bought this one because I don't like the thought of drinking water that's been sitting in a tank for any period of time. Works wonderfully, I make coffee for my boyfriend every morning and send it with him to work. Would buy again! Love the size also.
reviews.review_header: Works wonderfully and the size is great!

reviews.review_text: We had a smaller Keurig that outlived its usefulness, so we ordered this one. This is a one-cup-atta-time coffee maker and uses the familiar K-cups (if you were not sure, because the description is a bit unclear). You can fill the brewer with 6-to-10 ozs. of water, using the somewhat primitive levels found inside the fill area on the left side. This brewer takes a little longer to make a cup than our previous unit. Mug/cup size: if you use a mug of any height other than the run-of-the mill cup size, you will need to remove the drip plate, which easily slides out. Expect to have to remove it. Be sure to follow the ORDER of events in which you set up the pot-kcup-water, because the water needs to flow from the reservoir into the pot for brewing. Unit may be turned off manually or shuts off in 90 secs after a cup is brewed. Very few bells and whistles on this unit, but so far it has been working well. Amazon's price was the best I found.

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: This one is much easier to carry and move around. We used to have the larger version for many years. We enjoy this smaller one which is so light weight. We are seniors.

I am so happy with this Keurig. It sits perfectly on one corner of my craft desk and is so easy to use. You simply turn on the power, open the top lid, pour in water up to the 6,8 or 10 oz level marker, close the lid......and you hear the water going down into the reservoir. Then you lift the hande to put in the Keurig k-cup and close it.....whereby the brew light comes on. Just press the brew light. It's so quick and easy...I used to have a much larger unit with a big attached water reservoir but I like this one much better.....always fresh water that I put in. The size can fit anywhere. Very lightweight and easy to clean. I highly recommend it!
reviews.review_header: Perfect Size and Easy to Use

reviews.review_text: I always wanted to buy a Keurig machine but wasn't necessarily fond of clutter on my kitchen counter. I used this machine when I stayed at a friend's cabin and loved the small footprint. I immediately bought one upon returning home & I still love it to this day!

Works great. Threw away my other Keurig without first cleaning it with vinegar. That was stupid. Keurig users - remember to run vinegar threw it when it stops working. Don't just throw it away like I did. Only one thing is a 15 oz. coffee mug doesn't fit under it.
reviews.review_header: Works great. Threw away my other Keurig without first cleaning ...

reviews.review_text: I have had at least 6 of these. always had a big one. This is the best one ever. Water is always fresh and it is so quick. Takes up hardly any room on my counter
reviews.review_header: This is the best one ever

reviews.review_text: good price, fast shipping, item exactly as stated, works perfectly. Love not keeping water in the side filler like the bigger ones. We found mold where the water would just sit in the bigger ones for us.

UPDATE: Spoke to Customer Service at Keurig and they are replacing the coffeemaker free of charge. Hopefully this second one will work. UPDATE2: called Keurig and within 2 days I had the same coffee maker free of charge. Now I'm finally enjoying my cups of coffee. I have not brewed cold tea, but it says to bre tea over ice.
reviews.review_header: Waiting to taste my first cup of brewed coffee

reviews.review_text: I bought this to take on vacation, gotta have my Keurig!! It works great but know that it only makes one cup at a time. You have to add water to the machine before making each cup. I didn't mind because it was small enough to fit in my duffle bag with the clothes and other items i needed for my trip. Love it!!!

This is the 2nd Keurig we have had. The first one lasted a long time and finally had to be replaced. This was a really good price and was shipped immediately. I highly recommend Keurig Single Serve K-Cup. It is compact fits nicely on my counter top and makes a perfect cup of coffee every time.

Love it! Easy to set up, delivery was super, and simple process. Good cup of coffee, too. Keurig is a marvelous company! Superb equipment and outstanding Green Mountain coffee products. Do not hesitate, and you will not be sorry.
reviews.review_header: The BEST coffee maker out there!

name: Keurig K-Mini K15 Single-Serve K-Cup Pod Coffee Maker, Black

reviews.review_text: I had the larger keurig, but got rid of it for this one. It’s much smaller and simpler, with less chance of mold from keeping water in the tank (as with the bigger keurig). This one is so much better. The only complaint is the height of the area where you place a coffee mug; I had to buy all new mugs and search hard for short mugs because most of mine are too tall.

Owned a chili red but helped out my neighbor and gave her mine. She had 2 but gave to son's. When I saw the color JADE, a purchase had to be made. When buying new item I must rid old. Keurig has performed w/o one issue in last 2yrs of use. This time I went for the color. Thank You

I love this little Keurig coffee pot. I have one in the kitchen and we bought one for our back patio. They are easy to use and easy clean up and makes a great cup of coffee. I have noticed most of the motels are using them now too which makes it nice because it doesn't take much room to bring your favorite K-cups.

This is fabulous. We had to go to a reunion and on vacation- away from our big Keurig for ten days. It is terrible not to have our regular coffee. This worked great, was light, easy and simple to use and keep clean. This will go on all of our trips, and we may bring it out when we have company, or use it upstairs.

Love the Keurig single serve coffee maker. It gets used everyday. Easy to use and maintain. I use it with either a reusable filter or the SF Coffee Co. single cups, which are eco-friendly, biodegradable. Definitely, recommend this coffee maker.
reviews.review_header: Glad someone came up with the Keurig Single Serve

reviews.review_text: Love this color and the compact size just perfect as I live in an apartment with not much kitchen space. I used to have a larger one years ago wouldn't fit here so I got rid of it. Love this one as put water in for each cup of coffee so no water standing in water reservoir think this is healthier

This is my 3rd Keurig, I like that you don't need to put in a filter for this one, I love the convience of dropping in your K-Cup and pushing a button, then coffee's ready! I highly recommend this one if you don't need all that extra stuff and like to keep it simple.

I'm very happy with this product. The water is hot enough. Easy to clean. And perfect size in counter. Few things to share - some of my coffee mugs don't fit (even removing the tray). The machine panics if you add too much water and it spills out or you need to run sequence twice to completely empty. But overall really glad I got it !

This silver one is very nice looking and works good. The only complaint I have is you can only fit a small mug in the cup area, even if you pull out the bottom part, it doesn't give much more space. I like to take my coffee to go, so I use a glass measuring cup and then pour it into my travel mug! Extra step, but it works!

got a variety of cups..not trying others on line...NOTE; must pust lower on button, then lift lid and add water then the blue light comes on top buttom blinks..press to make it red. Was abt. to send mine back til I figured this out. ..scrambled it's brain...all well now. love it.

I got this for my guest cottage and it is just perfect. Brews single cups but doesn't take up much of the limited space. I was even able to get the reusable cartridges for it so my regularly visiting family can ise their favorite coffee. Saves money and the landfill!

It fits great under the cabinets and there's still plenty of room to fill it with water. I like that it doesn't have a reservoir. I like this design. We had a version one Keurig that just wore out and we bought the new version 2 model, which takes too long to preheat and make a cup of coffee. I use Smart Water (purified) in mine and grind my espresso beans for cafe americano. I purchased the little k-cup filters and grind my own. Sometimes I use my french press. My grinder has different controls depending on the device. Perfect for a single gal with a small kitchen. Works like a charm. Recommend the seller and the product. Would not be without it! I even carry it with me when I travel.

reviews.review_text: I love this little Keurig. It is perfect for a single person as myself. I like the feature of no water reservoir, fresh water each cup. It is much smaller than other models, takes up very little space on counter. I highly recommend this.

Only con is that travel mugs 16oz are still too tall to fit but thats not a big deal too me. Definitely recommend this model!

This is the simplest Keurig design, which makes it my favorite. I don't need a reservoir, I don't need a pre-heater, I don't need another clock in my kitchen...I just need a cup of coffee. This is actually our second unit like this. We have a K10 at home and the new K15 at my work apartment. For those who have experienced short cups and over flows, let me clue you in on a poorly documented quirk of this design. When you lift the handle to put a pod in, the water flows from the top (where you put it in) down into the heating chamber. It only flows while the pod bay door is open. If you open it, put a pod in and close it all rapidly, you will stop the flow of water down into the heating chamber, and you'll get a short cup. Listen to it and wait for the gurgling sound to stop completely before you close the pod bay door. If you do that, whatever you put in will be what you get out.
Had another one that lasted for years. Finally given up the ghost we purchased this one. It works better then the old one by brewing coffee much faster. Happy with it.
reviews.review_header: It works better then the old one by brewing coffee much faster

reviews.review_text: Purchase this coffee maker for use in my motor home. Fits in small space. Works great. Highly recommend.

The same as a K10, but currently manufactured without the water level indicators. Bought this to replace a K10 which had a rusted bottom and which was acting flaky -- not coming on all the time, just sometimes, no pattern evident. Did an extensive side by side inspection of this K15 with the old K10. I found the two units to be identical, with a few cosmetic differences and two functional downgrades of the new unit. I discussed my findings with a higher level customer support person in their Vermont headquarters. She seemed to agree that the two units are the same. In the new K15 manual the pages that show all the components show two water level indicators that actually have since been removed in the manufactured K15 units. My new K15 did not have them, my old K10 does. These are (1) the water fill tank fill level indicator (10 oz, 12 oz, 16 oz) with in a gray plastic insert which fits in the upper water fill tank, it fits upon a four molded-in tabs on the bottom of the fill tank, and those tabs are lacking on the K15 I received. Thus I could not simply move the fill level indicator insert from the old to the new, I tried to, but lacking a fixed insert tab to act as a latch the level indicator floated, making it worthless. The customer service representative was aware of the change. She was unable to explain why the manual had not been updated. She claimed that in user testing the company had discovered that overfilling the tank was less likely without the fill level indicator. (2) The overflow indicator in the under-cup drain pan. This is a float indicator that lifts up to show a red band indicating that the drain pan is close to full. It is on the K10, and is shown in the K15 manual. The customer representative explained that the company decided that since removing the fill tank level indicator lessened overfilling, that the drain pan no longer needed an overfill indicator. The cosmetic differences include: the font used in the "KUERIG" embossed lettering on the fill tank handle in front is different, the modern font is a bold block font, the older a serif, thinner font. The labeling on the brew button is different.
reviews.review_header: The same as a K10, but currently manufactured without the water level indicators.

reviews.review_text: I absolutely love this little coffee maker. It doesn't hold any water, you just fill up your coffee mug with however much you want (this is how you make it stronger/lighter), and dump it in. You hit the flashing button, and boom, fresh coffee is pouring in about 1 minute. My husband and I use this daily, and we love that you can just make 1 cup at a time. It only takes a second to make another cup, so we don't mind just adding water each time we use it. It's small, quick, efficient, and makes a darn good cup of joe. I would recommend this to anyone that wants something simple, and isn't too picky about having multiple coffee options. I have no problem using my larger mugs, you just slide the base out and you can fit a really big mug in there. If you have a tall thermos, you can sort of cram it in there and lean it sideways, and it will work just fine (or fill up a mug and pour it into the thermos from there). Works great, especially for the price.

reviews.review_text: So our Keurig did clog up and would fill a mug half-way with coffee or not at all. This was our own error, we were using unfiltered tap water and the water around here is incredibly "hard" and calcium built up on the machine. Very easy to fix, mix 50% white vinegar and 50% water. Fill machine with solution, make sure to lift k-cup holder so the water gets down deep. LEAVE IT for about an hour or two. Come back later and run machine multiple times with water until you're happy and there is no vinegar smell. Works like new again. :) We love this keurig and it is a blessing for a new mom who just wants a quick cup of coffee.
reviews.review_header: Broke in 5 months - here's how to fix and keep it running;

reviews.review_text: SInce there are so many reviews out there for this product, I will keep this short. This is the second one I have bought. I owned the first one for a few years after buying it based on a Consumer Reports article that pointed out less expensive products you could buy with comparable quality to more expensive models. I never noticed the overwhelming plastic smell in either coffee maker that I read about in some of the one-star reviews. I like the coffee it produces and that it turns itself off after two hours. I sometimes use the program feature to time when it turns on and that has worked fine. I have had to run vinegar and then water periodically to clear the passages so that the nozzle squirts the water into the coffee properly. Otherwise the water can seep down onto the hot plate and sizzle. The interrupt feature is not as consistent as it could be, but I rarely need my coffee that quickly so it is a non-issue. Finally, sometimes the paper filter folds down and I get some grounds in the carafe, but it is pretty rare and perhaps due to the particular filter. After a few years, the unit seems to need vinegar treatment more often and it has a stained appearance from daily use all this time, so I treated myself to a new one. Now my second one is running as good as the first one did. I will add, however, that my buying decision was aided by a big sale they had on this model for under $20. At full price I might have researched it further.
reviews.review_header: Happy with first one for a few years so I have bought it again

reviews.review_text: We tried getting the Ninja Coffee Bar because it looked fancy, and my 10 year old Mr. Coffee was due for an upgrade. We tried the Ninja and not only did our coffee taste gross, but the carafe was not even close to the size of Mr. Coffee. So we returned the Ninja, and I thought "wait..Mr. Coffee lasted 10 years." We purchased this one when it went on sale, and it did not disappoint! The carafe makes an actual 12 cups like it says. The lip where the coffee pours out is shaped so that coffee doesn't drip out when you pour, that was really my only complaint about the old one. If you want a no frills, unfancy but inexpensive and reliable coffee machine that does the job, get this one!

My wife really loves this coffee maker. We bought this to replace an older Mr. Coffee that had reached its final days. Programming the settings is easy and straightforward. It also looks very nice on her counter top in the kitchen. This model accepts the 12 cup glass carafe and the 8 cup stainless steel thermal carafe accessory. She liked the regular coffee maker well enough so I bought her the thermal carafe as well. I highly recommend this coffee maker. It is excellent quality..

I was looking for a basic replacement for an older machine that dripped hot water through coffee grounds. So many choices in a very wide price range. Do I spend $120 or $40 to run hot water over coffee grounds. Oh, the dilemma! I decided to roll the dice and spend on the lower end of the price spectrum. To my bewildered surprise, this less expensive machine is very capable of the task! Darn thing even has a built in timer if you want to automate your brew kickoff time. Also turns itself off if you haven't touched the pot in a while. If your pretentious, go by a "high end" machine. If your sane, buy this one.
reviews.review_header: It drips hot water through coffee grounds like a champ!

reviews.review_text: Prior to use, I ran a solution of vinegar and water (2/3 water and 1/3 vinegar) through the coffee cycle and had ZERO plastic taste in the system. I read the reviews and heard complaints so I'm passing along to others to save you from plastic tastes.
reviews.review_header: Prior to use, I ran a solution of vinegar ...

reviews.review_text: This Mr. Coffee replaces a BRAND NEW Black & Decker coffeemaker, which replaced a 33-year-old Mr. Coffee coffeemaker that finally bit the dust. (The Black & Decker coffeemaker never completely emptied the water reservoir when it brewed a pot of coffee -- it always left a cup and a half behind. I discovered this when I brewed my second pot of coffee -- and had a cup and a half of water overflow from the reservoir onto my kitchen countertop. Brewed several more pots with the same results: 12 cups of water IN, 10-1/2 cups of coffee OUT. The engineer in me cannot overlook this egregious defect.) Anyway, this replacement Mr. Coffee coffeemaker works GREAT! I've only brewed five (always full) pots of coffee so far, so I can't attest to the coffeemaker's durability. But the coffee tastes good, and all the controls work perfectly and just as described.

MR. COFFEE 12-CUP PROGRAMMABLE COFFEEMAKER, CHROME It was time for us to purchase another coffeemaker and having one of these currently, we decided to purchase another one just like it. My hubby drinks decaf only and I drink 'real' coffee, so for us, having two coffeemakers is a must. You can't go wrong with the MR. COFFEE 12-CUP coffeemaker. There are so many great things about this unit -- Looks great sitting on your kitchen counter Pause control -- can't wait? Remove the pot and the brewing will stop so you can pour your coffee NOW Automatically shuts off after being on for two hours -- beeps when shutting off After coffee is brewed and is ready to enjoy, a beep sounds to get your attention Removable filter basket for easy disposal of grounds and cleaning Nice and clear water window on the side for easy filling Cord storage in the back so you may hide that unsightly cord Brew strength available from regular to strong blend My only quibble would be that the digital clock is somewhat hard to read. This particular coffeemaker has won BEST in the category for three years -- 2011 - 2012 - 2013. The carafe is available in thermal or glass and the unit is self-cleaning. We use good old white vinegar and this works well. If you are in need of a new coffeemaker, this is the one for you. Not only does the coffee taste wonderful, rich, hot, fresh, and delicious each time, but the coffeemaker itself is attractive and you can' beat the price, Start your day off the right way with a superb cup of coffee brewed in your new Mr. Coffee. Thank you.

Well, it works, but not with filters?? I have had the worst luck with coffee makers recently. I bought this one and I am using it with a reusable filter that came with another maker (full mesh on all sides). When I have tried using a paper filter, it overflowed. I honestly can't figure out why. It makes a huge mess though.
reviews.review_header: Works will with reusable filter I already had- does not work well with paper filters.

reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace the same model that had stopped working. It lasted long enough that I thought it was worth re-ordering. On my first pour I noticed a fix to what I had considered a maddening flaw. I could not pour the last one slow enough to make it not spill. The design of the lip was just somehow wrong. I had taken to just pouring my cup standing over the sink. On my first pour with this new pot and everyone since, I am delighted that this issue has been resolved.

This is our second coffeemaker of this same model and we love it. The other one died because I knocked it over filled it one day and water seeped into the electronics. My fault. It brews a pot of coffee so fast too, no more tortuous waiting for my caffeine fix. The water filter disks also work great at removing the "flavor" from tap water. The option to brew strong coffe is awesome and a feature I use all the time, also uses a scoop less of coffee. Easy to use and program too.

name: Mr. Coffee 12-Cup Programmable Coffee Maker, Bundle with 1 Month Water Filtration

reviews.review_text: At one point I had 3 different coffee makers on my counter at the same time trying to find a decent one. Our last coffee maker was an Oster. It was great but after a while one of the hoses under the heat plate would blow off ever few weeks and it got really annoying. We have a Mr. Coffee in our locker room that never fails, always works likes it's supposed to, so I figured I try this one. LOVE IT. No problems with any of the negatives other people have brought up other than the display. It is pretty much worthless :( I miss the cool blue light emanating from the Oster. Unless you're 3 ft tall you can't read it and even then when I scroutch down I have to have my magnifiers on to see the numbers. However, that's not why I bought the coffee maker. I bought it to dependably and repeatedly make great coffee - and that it does!!
reviews.review_header: Just works :) Hot coffee every morning

reviews.review_text: Nice product. The control panel is a little more complicated than necessary because of some unusual features, but it is intuitive and although I shouldn't say this, you really don't need the manual, So, here are the pros and cons: PROs - 12 cups - Nice, but make sure you purchase the larger size filters. The smaller 4 cup filters just won't work very well. - Two hour shut off - a must for a coffee make that is designed to keep the java warm for a while. If you forget it, the coffee might not taste very good as the water evaporates, but it won't stay on long enough to crack the carafe or cause a fire. - Brew strength options - I haven't tried this yet and have always just used a little more coffee to make it stronger, but this feature could save you some money over the long haul - very long haul. - Programmable for a timed start - essential for those of us who like to wake up to the aroma of brewing coffee. CONs - This model comes with a water filter that fits on top of the grinds basket and filters the minerals coming in from the "showerhead spout." The manual recommends that the filter be changed monthly. I have never had a problem with hard water, although I use a water filter on the kitchen sink. Unless you have really foul water, and then again this might not help, I suggest that this is a totally frivolous feature that is designed to get you to trot out to the store and buy more filter replacements since it is recommended that the filter be changed every 30 brews or monthly.. Fortunately, the coffee maker does not require this. You can make the coffee without using this filter. - The unit also has a built in sensor that determines whether you are using a glass carafe (provided) or a thermal carafe. I imagine that the metal skin of the thermal carafe triggers a magnetic switch which prevents the warming tray from going on. I actually bought this unit because I was unhappy with the Mr. Coffee thermal carafe unit I had been using, since it was more difficult to clean than the glass, and the coffee was never really hot enough. All in all, it's a nice coffee maker, but I think these extra features have to add something to the price. I can't help but wonder how much less it would have cost without the water filter and the carafe sensor. Since both of these features are optional, I was tempted to give the unit FIVE stars, but I feel a little annoyed that the manufacturer is trying to put something over on us. Just my opinion. As John Galt says, "Value for value." If the price is acceptable to you, then it's FIVE stars. Get the bagels and coffee cake ready. Breakfast is served.
reviews.review_header: Nice product, good brand history, but some superfluous features

reviews.review_text: Really nice basic coffee maker. We've had a number of coffee makers - different kinds of dispensers/carafes, ones that have hot water functions, Keurigs, espresso machines, etc., but this basic one has been our favorite. We've had it for a few months, so to comment on some of the reviews I saw before purchasing: -- It doesn't leak -- It's impossible to misplace the carafe -- Don't have any kind of basket overflow issues -- Programmable clock works just fine - not intended to be a bright clock like on a microwave -- No issues with filling with water - use the carafe, it's easier to not miss -- Programming is really simple No complaints!

Bought this on August 30th of 2015 to replace an identical model that was also a few years old. The old one didn't stop working, but we got a coffee bean stuck in the water intake and couldn't remove it cleanly, so we opted to replace. Today (8/8/17), this one died. For several months it had been giving the completion beep halfway through the brew process instead of at the end and this morning it made about 5 cups and stopped. I could not get it to start brewing again and the hot plate seemed to turn off as well. Overall, for the price...Almost 2 years of daily use has been great. It makes good coffee in a fairly quick time. 10 minutes or so for a full pot. The LCD is not backlit, so that's a bummer, but it's cheap and works well.
reviews.review_header: Makes good coffee, but don't expect it to last forever

reviews.review_text: We like it. I just get a little weary of wiping out the large accumulation of water in pockets and moisture under the lid when it's time to clean up, empty the grounds. I use three paper towels to mop up all the water and moisture when I lift the lid. But my most irritating little, and it's hardly worth mentioning, is that I need to wipe the pour spout of the carafe after pouring each cup full. It leaves coffee moisture which turns to stain quickly in the pour lip. I know, it's no biggie, and I am far too sensitive over little irritations like this. Yes, it is hardly worth mentioning here......so why bring it up at all? I don't know except it just irritates me. But so does the cat when she vomits on the garage floor! Sorry. It makes great coffee as a "Mr." should, right? Wipe down with a couple of paper towels - or three if you're a fuss-budget like me, and leave the lid open and it eventually dries out totally. Forget my fuming, just buy it. I bet you'll be happy you did.
reviews.review_header: Second Mr. Coffee after many years.

reviews.review_text: Bought for the office over a year a ago. It's been making 1-2 pots every day M-F. I picked it out because it took the large "bucket" style filters (which are cheap!), and because the opening in the top of the glass carafe was big enough to fit my hand in to clean it. Auto shutoff works great too. We buy 5lb bags of Starbucks and grind the beans fresh one pot at a time, so we're moderately discriminating in our tastes.

I've had several of this model coffee maker. They're durable and good looking. I've had them bounce around in a trailer, travel in tour buses and ride in road cases in the back of a semi trailer and handled by teamsters. Never had one fail. I don't bother shipping them home at the end of a tour because the cost is so cheap to replace it, which is why I keep buying more. Very happy with this model.
reviews.review_header: Great coffee maker, I've owned several.

reviews.review_text: Now that I've had this for a year and more than 100 uses I figured I would get a review in. I haven't had a single issue with this coffee maker that wasn't user error. It plainly works and works well. I initially bought this based on good reviews and the ability to get a thermal carafe at some point, though I have yet to make that jump as the coffee is usually gone before it starts to cool down too much. The water filter was good for about a month, and I haven't replaced it since, I just use the maker without it and have had no issues. The water where I live isn't hard or soft, so there's no real need for filtering. The filter is just a carbon filter which would remove little more than odor or taste from the water. I didn't see it as useful unless you had issues with your water. It looks decent on the countertop, and doesn't take up too much room. The lid is a bit cumbersome as it is quite large and can't be opened under my cabinets, but it's really a non-issue as it is easy to move around. If it stopped working today I would buy another without hesitation, but it's so simple I doubt that it will go wrong before several years of use.

I was cautious about buying a $30 coffee maker but all the reviews seemed to say this was a decent coffee maker. I have to say they were right! This coffee maker makes excellent coffee! I like the strength setting which my old $100 coffee maker didn't even have. It looks decent but the buttons feel a little cheap. But most importantly, it makes great coffee and looks good on the countertop. Unfortunately because this makes great tasting smooth coffee, I now drink more! ***Update*** I am not sure if this a bad design or not, but every now an then the coffee maker stops working, maybe once a year, but it turns on but it doesn't brew. In order to fix and not buy a new coffee maker, you need to simply replace the fuse underneath the coffee maker. Just take the bottom cover off and you'll find 2 small silver fuses in series (there are 2 for safety) Take your meter and see which one is bad, or just replace both. They are super cheap on amazon. It's a super easy fix with your soldering iron and it extends the life of a great coffee maker!

The first thing any coffee maker has to do is make a good cup of coffee. If you set this on Strong you get a good cup of coffee. You can decide how strong you really want it to be by the amount of grounds you add. The reason is that it gets the water quite hot. With my old maker I had to microwave cup of water and pour that over the grounds and let the maker do the rest. Other that, this is attractive, inexpensive, makes up o 12 cups, and has a delayed brew option.

name: Mr. Coffee 12-Cup Programmable Coffee Maker, Bundle with 1 Month Water Filtration

reviews.review_text: We are quite happy with this coffeemaker that we have now been using for a month. I noticed many complaints about the clock not being visible, and that is a fact, it is indeed difficult to see with no backlight. We don't really care, we don't need another clock in the kitchen. We don't use the program to have the coffee turn on, I make our coffee the night before and when one of us awaken in the morning, we simply turn it on. We get up whenever we please, and it will automagically shut off 2 hours later! THAT part we really appreciate! :) We use the Strong brew, the coffee is always nice and HOT - we always had to zap our coffee from our other coffeemakers, as it was never quite HOT enough to please either one of us. There is no "plastic smell OR taste!" as is mentioned in several reviews. I don't use the 'water filter' because I fill it from my Brita pitcher. There is no "leaking" and there is also no way the cover can be closed and have the 'coffee run all over the place' because the spout wasn't over the coffee grounds! There is an arm in the cover that will push the spout over the coffee grounds.

We bought this and shipped to my in-laws. My father-in-law only buys what is the top recommendation in Consumer Reports and this product had to be the one, however they could not find it locally where they live and they don't trust (old school) online merchants. They said they love it. For a $30 coffeemaker it seems to do the job. I think part of their raving is how much faster it brews than their old one, but that could also be a function of any new pot over an old one. Their old one could not be programmed to heat at a specific time, so they really like that feature.
