I could not remove the filter while the machine was on without having steam spit out of the machine. I returned this item and just bought another one at Target to avoid any damage that could've occurred during shipping. The new item works great and has none of the issues that my previously defective item had. You need to tamp the espresso very well (and a new tamper would be helpful for this), but it does produce some excellent espresso after 2 weeks of use.
reviews.review_header: The new item works great and has none of the issues that my previously ...

reviews.review_text: I returned this dismal item. Under ALL scenarios water and steam shoot all over the place from the frother under any dial setting but "off." Although there is a hum on the espresso setting nothing comes out under any circumstance. Moreover, the handle will not engage tall the way to the center locked position too. It is shabby, more like an under $39 Chinese-made coffee maker than a modest Espresso from a known Italian maker. I would ordinarily say you get what you pay for, but I do not believe this unit is worth the discounted refurbished price because at least with my unit I don't see any refurbishment. You have to wonder how this outrageous kind of operation defect passes any meaningful inspection regime, assuming there is one in the first place ! If you have a cold and need a Vaporizer, this might be what you need, -- a cup of Espresso, not so much.
reviews.review_header: Expresso Unit does not work -all froth all the time

reviews.review_text: During the 15 months that it worked, it made very good espresso. Despite being cared for as directed, though, the compressor seems to have failed since it abruptly will give e only a few drips of liquid every five minutes or so. The Asurion warranty purchased through Amazon spits out an automatic "Good News! Covered by company warranty" within less than a second of submitting an online claim, and DeLonghi says it isn't . All in all, I can't recommend this except for folks who want the occasional espresso without having to leave their kitchen.
reviews.review_header: Good for a short time, then not covered under warranties

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: this machine just died. the steamer knob no longer works properly, as in i couldn't shut it off. if anyone knows how to fix, please let me know. i purchased this 2.5 years ago. i used it 1-2 times a weekend, and there were months that i didn't use it at all. i was able to get a good foam, often better than what i get at starbucks, which probably isn't that impressive. anyway, for under $100 it worked well for a time. but, i also feel that this should have lasted longer, considering i only used it on weekends, and not every weekend.
reviews.review_header: i was able to get a good foam, often better than what i get at ...

reviews.review_text: Well it makes espressos that taste well. The coffee filter holder is hard to get on, enough where I do it for my wife most of the time. I have to hold my espresso cups in place while it’s dispensing or they will move out from under the nozzles. A lot of espresso cups we went out to get were barely too tall for this as well. I also thought this would make a perfect sized espresso and could walk away while it does, you have to turn the knob off at desired level. Lots of extra work with this really, though again... espresso does taste good out of it.
reviews.review_header: Walks around the counter when dispensing.

reviews.review_text: Well, the espresso machine worked very well during the first couple of months and I enjoyed the good quality espresso. I only used the machine for once and sometimes twice a day. After the first descale the machine started to lose its original power and yet continued to function fairly good. But when I had to descale it for the second time and clean its filters and stuff it did not live up to my expectations. As of now, it's almost one year since the purchase and the machine takes ages to give you an espresso, which tastes like burnt coffee. I am disappointed and considering to buy another espresso machine. I hope this review will help you when you want to buy this product.
reviews.review_header: Enjoy while it lasts! it is not going to last after 9 months

reviews.review_text: I read the reviews from several years ago, and decided to buy this one after my old Krups espresso machine finally quit. This De'Longhi EC155 is one very disappointing product. The instructions state that it needs at least 15 minutes to heat up - gross understatement. In fact, even an hour doesn't seem to help much. The frothing wand adds significant amounts of hot water with the intended steam - which is great for preheating your cup, but not so much for frothing milk. If you are considering this one, I would suggest reading more recent reviews before you make your purchase. I won't be replacing mine with another from this company - or from a corporate sibling of De'Longhi. It does, however, look nice sitting on the counter if anyone is looking for props to stage real estate.

I used to have an EC - 155 and loved it. After a long time ( 2 years) it's pump started having problems intermittently; so I had to return it ( I had Fair trade warranty - what an exceptional service!) .I thought I would have the same unit, since I liked it a lot. Got another one and it was just not the same. In this 2 years the make of the machine went down in quality ( or I just had bad luck and got a defective one ?) . It was very loud and you had to hold your coffee cup while in progress of making espresso. Had to return the item. I got myself a new version - EC - 220 Retro and very happy about it.
reviews.review_header: Not the same it used to be.

reviews.review_text: I believe these heavily discounted De Longhi's are in fact returns. I bought one and found it had water remnants inside of it. I returned it and received another one - this time with a frothing spout that will not stay outside the unit as it is meant to (I have another one so I know how they are meant to behave). A written complaint to Amazon accusing them of selling seconds as new received no response
reviews.review_header: If you are being offered these for $99 they are probably seconds

reviews.review_text: I got this during the holidays as a gift to the household. While a lot of people are satisfied with the little machine, my guess is they're making lattes and americanos. Not sure if it was my grinder or the beans, but for a 2 week period I could not pull a decent shot. I decided to step up to a Gaggia Classic (took the plunge after doing much research) and I must say, I'm glad I shelled out the extra $300. VERY WELL WORTH IT. I should add that I drink espresso, cappuccino, and machiatos. So the shots and its taste is very pronounced. I'm using a Breville Smart Grinder BTW

I am a master barista. Also ex-manager of a espresso/coffee shop. One thing I liked about this machine, is the engineering design of the porta-filter head.the way it dis-assembles is great. The quality of the shots I drew was satisfactory for a non-pro. Machine. The big issue was water leakage underneath machine. It happened right from start of use. I do not know where it was coming from. How ever I do know that pools of water & electricity are very dangerous.especially hidden pools of water underneath a electrical appliance.

Love this machine. Until it failed...twice. I made great cups of coffee with this. Used it every day. Cleaned it out with dilute vinegar every few months to eliminate scale. After one year, it failed. The manufacturer sent me a new one. This one has lasted two years. It leaks from the frother, which I can cope with since I don't use the frother. Now it leaks from the opening for the basket...a lot You can't take out the gasket to clean or replace. I may try to take it apart for the heck of it, but still.... Two machines in three years. Nope, ain't gonna buy a third one.

First of all the frother is on the wrong side of the machine so putting the handle with the espresso into the locked position is hard as heck to attach with each cup of coffee. I burned myself between making cups of espresso reaching underneath the pour spout to try and figure out how to get the handle/level correctly positioned. Sent it back. BTW--I am not technologically or manually challenged. I am pretty handy so this is not just a whining.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: I LOVE this machine and HATE this machine! My wife and I are avid expresso fans and DeLonghi EC155 Espresso Maker pulls perfect shots along with perfect steamed milk. The other comments about the tamper are correct, purchasing a seperate tamper is a must - which is minor. The problem is DURABILITY. We make expresso's daily, purchasing our first machine late June 2010. The machine started dripping water from the expresso pod after four months. This is alwasy during the warm up cycle AND while steaming milk. We literally get 3/4's of a shot of expresso from the dripping while steaming milk! The company said to turn it 'off' for 10-15 seconds as this will reset everything. While that sounded great, it did not work - even with it being off for a full minute. They sent us another machine easily and quickly. We received the second machine around Thanksgiving. Not having espresso drip while steaming milk was GREAT! You have no idea how much mess this makes. By mid January it slowly started to drip again! Today, the NEW machine is back to giving another 1/2 shot of expresso while steaming milk! If things continue like the last one, this will only increase. Two machines - same problem with 4 months and 3 months of daily use. I'll call DeLonghi Monday and post a new report next. However, the durability of this machine is simply NOT there. AVOID this product! The mess this makes is ridiculous taking the joy away from pulling shots and steaming milk.
reviews.review_header: On my THIRD EC155 in 7 months - AVOID!!!

reviews.review_text: We purchased this espresso machine when we got back from Europe in July of 2014. We loved the espresso there and wanted to continue the vacation at home. I would have to say this machine started out awesome. Crema was amazing, espresso was great too. The steam worked great as well. We are now 5 months into using it and it just died. I went back and read some of the reviews after this happened and noticed there was another review that said the same thing. Yes the water starts leaking and pouring out. The last 2 months that it did work the machine was in a pool of water after each use. I am really bummed because I loved the morning espresso but just pulled out my trusty Krupps coffee maker that I've had for 10 years and I am back to my coffee. I am no longer able to return it as per the return policy. If you buy this machine I would say don't get too use to it because your heart will be broken when it just stops after 5 months into it. PS: I cleaned it well after each use so that was not the issue.
reviews.review_header: We loved the espresso there and wanted to continue the vacation ...

reviews.review_text: It was good while it lasted...which was just over a year. My first impression is that it seemed a little cheaply made compared to my last Breville that was about the same price which lasted about 4 years because it is light and you have to hold it in place when you insert the portafilter. It was at first very quite and fast. The steaming wand did kind of annoy me because it seemed to be in the way of the pulls. Overall, I was happy with it while it lasted but then the pump started to go around the 1 year mark. Espresso started dripping out and no crema. This could be fixed by cleaning the boiler outlet and filters but it happened more frequently, every couple of weeks. It lasted me about 11 months, I used it everyday for at least two double shots but I'm going to go with a different brand at almost triple the price next...

First of all, I haven't used the steamer, so I can't attest to how well it works. The espresso this machine makes is pretty good. Lots of crema, and tasty. Also, the manual says to let it heat up for 15 minutes before brewing. I've used it after as little as 5 minutes and it still does fine. But, there are things I really don't like about it. If you buy this machine, here are my tips: 1. Find a cup that is short enough. 2.5-3 inches is all the clearance you have to work with. 2. Have the machine up against a wall. The filter basket can be difficult to put on, and the unit is too light to stay in place when attaching it. Having it against a wall gives you better leverage. 3. Don't let the machine warm up without the basket attached. Doing this makes it much more difficult to attach the basket, making the last issue even more prominent. 4. Don't tamp it too hard. I've found pressing the basket into the tamper that's on the machine, just until you're about to start lifting the unit is enough pressure. If you tamp too hard, you won't get a nice crema... And you may not even get espresso. My last machine was not nearly as picky as this one is. If you can live with the above, then go for it. For the same (or less) money, though, you can get the Mr. Coffee ECMP50, which has none of the above issues, and still makes great espresso.

After 8 months the heater core doesn't get hot anymore I disassemble the machine trying to diagnose the issue but without proper parts failed to do so so as a professional American Consumer I will stick with a company name that has been around 20 years or better, unless you want to replace your cappuccino machine every 8 months to a year.

....Literally, six months later after ordering this product, the wand no longer steams and the espresso will not come out at all. I don't understand. I can tell you that there was a month time that I did not use the machine, so it sat in my kitchen unplugged. Before then, it worked just fine. Nothing should have broken it during that time and only dust touched on it. I have tried everything like turning on the machine and waiting for the light to turn green for ready then turning it off and on again. I have repeatedly turned the steam knob around, but no steaming noise comes out from the wand. I have gently cleaned the machine and there is also nothing stuck inside like a bug. I have NOT opened apart the machine, but I don't think that is possible? I guess you do get what you paid for, but I am disappointed regardless because almost every review was positive about this! It was just today that I bought overly expensive espresso grounds to start using the machine again but found out that it completely is malfunctioned. I wish for a replacement or late return, but it's fine if not. I just won't be doing further business with this seller and brand again.

I wanted to love this so much! Pros: 1. we love the preheat function. 2. it's easy to keep clean. 3. it makes great espresso. Cons: 1. the space for the cup is so small that you have to find a work-around or buy super short cups (which I did). Our work-around was to take off the cover of the drip tray and put a paper towel in the bottom of the tray -- this way we can use more "normal-sized" espresso cups. 2-3: the machine itself is extremely light-weight, but the coffee holder is quite solid. It is almost impossible to get the coffee holder to turn into place. It's sheer luck whether I'll get it to turn into place or not. Unfortunately, I'm looking for a new machine.

I had the same model that quit after at least 2 years of heavy use. I bought a new one in December, but it was never near as good as the other one. It doesn't get heavy use, so it should give me more than this life span. Of late, it would take 3 minutes to give me a cup. Just now, 10 minutes yielded 2 drops (though I'm not sure if this was my sweat or water). Water was being drawn since it came out the steam end when turned on (in the coffee maker setting). Stupid me to buy Chinese junk. Amazon doesn't want to know me, and I long since threw out the Delonghi box and info. My next one will not be a De'Longhi. IN fact, I won't buy another one of their products with such bad customer service response.
reviews.review_header: but it was never near as good as the other one

reviews.review_text: This machine makes great espresso with excellent crema. Unfortunately mine malfunctioned exactly 1 year after my purchase and was thus not covered under warranty. Also the closest authorized dealer is a state away from me. It’s a great product for the money but has a reliability problem

I used the EC155 primarily to make espresso and it did a good job while it lasted. I bought the unit in December of 2013 and used it maybe 100 times over 4 months until the grinder I was using wasn't producing a good enough grind anymore. I only used deionized water in it so there could be no chance of mineral build up and I never even used it close to the minimum number of times for the first cleaning. Fast forward to November of 2014 and I bought a new grinder and wanted to try out my EC155 again. I warmed the unit up and tried to run some water through the lines to flush any old water out and the water would barely dribble out. I cleaned everything per the manual even though it did not need it and tried to make a shot but the pump was shot and could not push water out. Thank god it had not been a year yet. I emailed customer service, it says they will get back to you in 24 hours, yea right, so I called and sat on hold for almost a half hour and was told to send in my invoice from Amazon. I faxed it that same day and waited to be contacted. I had to email them and call them back and insist that I indeed had faxed it and insist they look for it which they reluctantly did. Finally they gave me instructions to return and sent me a new one. Here's hoping I get more than a couple months use out of this unit but I'm not betting on it.
reviews.review_header: ... EC155 primarily to make espresso and it did a good job while it lasted

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: Worked well for 5 months --- probably about 150 to 200 espressos. Now it only produces luke-warm water, not hot enough for a good espresso. Since it has a 1 year warranty I've just contacted them, and will adjust my final evaluation once I hear from them.
reviews.review_header: not hot enough for a good espresso. Since it has a 1 year warranty ...

reviews.review_text: Have had this for a couple of months and still undecided about it. Espresso output could be a little more volume-wise. Tough to get quality crema all the time and, as others have commented, the dimensions are small--hard to fit cups under dispenser (I use with drip tray cover removed and even then a tight fit) and fitting the milk container under steamer is a trick (I usually lift up front of machine to remove container). Can't comment yet on the longevity of the product, though the steamer has developed a small drip. Nothing I can't wipe up but makes me question quality control. But, for the price, it makes a decent latte, even if I sometimes run two shots through to get strong enough espresso.

Seemed okay, if inconsistent, at first, but after three months (pulling two shots per day), the pump is now so anemic it can barely punch out a shot in five minutes, and there's no crema to be found on the result. This is despite thorough cleaning, and is the case even with the filter basket and upper screen removed. Don't waste your money.

I ordered this model because it seemed to be the closest match to the De'Longhi espresso maker we had before which finally wore out. I sent it back because the distance between the nozzles and the base was not tall enough for our cups. I don't know why the company decided to change this dimension. Also, the foam part (don't know the official term) did not rotate out enough for us to get our steel pitcher under it. I can't speak to the kind of coffee it makes because I never got that far. We now own a different model which is much bigger (although it does not hold any more water than our old one did) but at least it doesn't have these problems.

After less a year, the unit is dead. While it worked, it produced excellent espresso with good crema, the ability to use ESE (Easy Serve Espresso) pods is a definite bonus and not too bad for the environment. I used it on average once per day (decaf latte in the evening, full caf latte on weekend mornings) but after 10 months I could hear the water pump struggling to function. I can now get some espresso out of it if I try, but the wand for frothing is completely dead.
reviews.review_header: Great while it worked, dead in 11 months

reviews.review_text: The first year of operation was good. Decent coffee, no issue. Then....it literally fell apart. Now, 1 1/2 years after a normal use (1 coffee a day) the machine is leaking water from everywhere. It's just a mess and it became impossible to use it. It's ready to be thrown away. I suggest you DO NOT BUY THIS if you want something that lasts for a while. It was cheap, and this tricked me into buying it. As always....you get what you pay for. I do not recommend this espresso maker and I won't buy ever again anything from DeLonghi BOOOOO!!!!! shame on you DeLonghi!
reviews.review_header: you get what you pay for - don't buy

reviews.review_text: What an awful espresso maker. There's barely enough space to fit a shot glass under the espresso nozzle. The motor inside was not fitted properly, so it touched the external case. Every time I pulled a shot, the pump would smack against the external case at 15 Hz and make a racket. The resonant frequency of the motor was the same as my cabinet and kitchen walls, so every dish in every cabinet would rattle when the motor ran. The espresso grounds often got into the brew, and were a nightmare to clean. A piece of junk.
Do not buy. I was wiping down the portafilter and had a bunch of the cheap metal rub off on my hands and paper towel. The espresso you drink passes right through this part!

I bought this unit to make espresso each morning. It replaced my Krupps unit that I would use to make a full 8 oz cup of coffee. This unit must be designed for pods and weaker american style coffee. The 2 cup coffee filter packed to the rim will deliver 4 ozs of e medium strength espresso. I found the key was to only deliver coffee when the green ok light is on. The light will go out after after about 2 ozs are delivered then wait a minute for it to come on before delivering any more coffee. If you do not do this step the espresso will be very weak. The crema on top is great, but the espresso is weak. I like a strong espresso to start my morning.
reviews.review_header: The crema on top is great, but the espresso is weak

reviews.review_text: You might want to consider bigger espresso glasses, the ones that come with this machine are too SMALL.
reviews.review_header: This machine can use larger espresso glasses. You might want to consider a "BIGGER" machine.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: I was looking forward to getting my new machine after my old Barista espresso maker finally quit working after 17 yrs. Unfortunately, the De'Longhi did not live up to my expectations. The product feels very cheap, and doesn't brew good shots. I've been using this for about a month, and still cannot get a good shot. I have worked as a barista, and I have experience in brewing a good shot. It makes an ok latte, but if you are particular about your espresso, I'd continue shopping. A couple other issues are the steam wand is constantly in the way of brewing espresso, and the brewing area is so short that typical shot glasses or a cup will not fit under the brewing spouts, making it difficult to collect your shots.

I normally do not write reviews but I feel compelled to this time. This is not an initial review. This review comes with 2+ years of actual usage experience. Let me cut to the chase. 1. The pressure that it uses to make the coffee is reduced significantly with continued use. You can hear hissing sound while not making the coffe. The coffee that is made with weak steam = very weak. 2. It passed the 1 year warranty mark. No luck. 3. I have owned 2 other delonghi coffee maker like this before. They both became defective right after 2 years or so. I agree with most review that it worked well in the beginning. But it does not hold up over time.

I used to own a really nice Breville espresso machine which lasted about 3 years of almost-daily use until the pump gave out (and no replacement parts available). It cost about $350 which was about $10 per month of use. I didn't want to shell out another $300-400+ for another machines, so I purchased the De'Longhi EC155 back in August of 2013 for less than $100. The good news is that it made really good espresso... while it lasted. My only complaint is that it vibrates quite a bit while the pump is operating such that the cup shimmys out of position during operation. It's an annoyance but not a deal killer. Unfortunately, the pump gave out after about 10 months of use. it's still under the one-year warranty but returning it to a factory service center is a hassle. While I will get it repaired under warranty, I will probably buy a manual type maker like the AeroPress or ROK. You get what you pay for.... 3 years out of a 350 machine or (not quite) 1 year out of $100 machine :-)
reviews.review_header: Made great espresso... but only lasted about 10 months.

reviews.review_text: While it worked I loved it. Unfortunately it broke after a year. My husband is a mechanical engineer and after inspecting it he said it was toast and dissembled it for parts. If you want a cheap machine as a temporary deal it's alright. I'd recommend getting something that will last though.

I didn't get far enough to actually make espresso with the machine. Opening the box, I found that the handle on the water reservoir is cracked and non-functional. I decided to run some water through it to see the basic functionality. The machine vibrates so much that the cups rattle out of the way of the water (or espresso) output by the machine, so the water (or expresso) runs into the drain instead of the cup. Also, the machine is smaller than I expected. With the metal plate in place, you need expresso cups no larger than a shot glass to receive the coffee. As far as I can see, it's not just low quality, it's also a bad design.
reviews.review_header: very low quality and a bad design

reviews.review_text: Bought as a christmas gift for my brother who is getting into coffee. Thought it would be nice since he doesn't have any sort of "espresso machine" Well we get it and decide to test it out. Instructions mention to preheat for 15 min then also mention to wait 30 min... so 45 min for 2oz of espresso.. that's a lot, so we wait 15 min fun 5 pulls through machine as it explains to do to "clean" it.. We do that, then refill the tank.. wait 15 min grind good coffee with our Breville Smart Grinder (which is great) pour tamp try to pull a shot.. nothing happens except vibrating so hard the espresso glass could fall off.. take out portafilter it's just a soupy mess rinse repeat a few times same results, we keep raising the grind as we go, so finally we are on the highest setting for espresso grind, we barely tamp and pull a shot that actually eventually came out, took a drink, it's not hot and very sour.. so we wait 15 min.. water temp is 150 degrees.. We kept testing it and it would never get over 150 degrees.. Returning for something else. I know everyone says spending this money is gonna get you crap.. I would expect paying $100 for this small machine would get us at least a couple drinkable shots but no... also Ergonomically this machine is bad.. Steam wand is way to short and close to the counter.. and also you can't fit anything under the portafilter except shot glasses... this machine is a fail.. if it could pull decent temperature we could have looked passed the flaws.
reviews.review_header: Bought as a gift because I read all the positive reviews.

reviews.review_text: I purchased this product a little more than a year ago. At first, it seemed a great upgrade to the Mr. Coffee espresso maker I had, which never really produced crema. The Delonghi was hot enough, had plenty of pressure, and created a beautiful crema. However, within 6 months, the performance of this machine went from a perfect stream of espresso, to coming out in drips. I cleaned everything meticulously. I sought support from Delonghi, primed the pump as instructed, etc. No improvement in pressure, so they determined the pump went bad. They replaced the unit, and I was up and running again. Almost. This replacement, which I believe was used/reconditioned, never had the performance of the original one when it was new, and now we're at a dribble again. My $20 Mr. Coffee lasted 3 times as long as this $80 Delonghi. Very disappointed.
reviews.review_header: Great at first - Pooped out Quickly

reviews.review_text: I already had another Delonghi espresso machine which was semi automatic back home but now I am overseas and I wanted to buy something a little cheaper but the taste of the espresso is definitely noticable. So if you love the strong taste of espresso just try to spend some more and buy a semi automatic one. Also the process of making a coffee is taking way too long sometimes whereas with an automatic or a semi automatic machine you kind of basically just push the button.
reviews.review_header: So if you love the strong taste of espresso just try to spend ...

reviews.review_text: I am on my second unit. I wanted a Bar Pump Espresso maker and this seemed to be the best option. My first unit was leaking water all over the counter, so back to Amazon it went. Amazon was great and had another unit to me quickly. So far no water leaks. Overall it works for the price. Here is the pros and cons. Pros: -Good Espresso with good Crema -Water tank holds enough water to make several Espressos Cons: -Frothing wand is way too short to reach into a frothing pitcher -Unit vibrates when it is working and causes the glass to move around in the tray when it is brewing -No glass or coffee pot to catch the Espresso is included, luckily we had one from an old Espresso maker because your coffee cup won't fit under the nozzle unless it is very small. -Frothing nozzle is plastic...wish they would have made it stainless steel for easier cleaning and durability.

Gets the job done but is in no way convenient. It can make decent espresso (if you know what your doing) and if you are on a budget this is a wonderful option to save $$ on your morning latte. I am a student and don't have the budget to even save up for a nicer machine so I bought this to cut out my starbucks spending. It is a labor intensive job early in the morning but it certainly is saving me a lot of money. So if your looking for the ultimate basic without spending too much up front and are committed to making your lattes then this is for you! I've had it for maybe four months or so and I make a quad espresso most mornings and so far so good.
reviews.review_header: Good starter espresso machine for someone on a budget

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: This is the 2nd time that I purchased this machine and it stopped working in less than a year. This one lasted 9 months, the 1st purchase only lasted 8 months. I will be searching for a new brand this time.

The steam wand is too short and the frothing attachment in integrated in such a way that you can't just not use it, so the milk is too frothy before it is hot enough. Also, a pain to clean. The filter basket is too persnickity, and a drag to clean. Thereis too little height below the filter to allow for anything but shot glasses, so if you prefer to make your espresso directly into your cup, you're out of luck. It is a good looking and compact unit, probably just dandy if you only plan to use it once in a while, but not a good pick for daily use.

This machine worked well and delivered a decent cup of espresso when I bought it last June. I have use it daily to make morning coffee and occasional iced coffees in the afternoon and performed the routine maintenance to keep it clean and descaled.. But after six months, the espresso started coming out more and more slowly. This week, just shy of 12 months since the purchase date, it stopped producing coffee completely. Even without the coffee and filters in place, the hot water barely dribbled out of the spout. Obviously, some pump was broken, right as it comes out of warranee. Since it was okay for a year, I'm giving it two stars. But I'm really disappointed in the brand and will not be purchasing another of their machines.

We bought this in January. It has worked great up until a couple weeks ago. It just stopped brewing. It is still under the manufacture warranty. We called them and they are going to replace it. However, the customer service at Delonghi isn't great. They said they will ship me a new one, but everything in their warehouse is delayed and they have "no idea" how long it could be. So now I am without coffee for a month? Who knows, they couldn't even give me a ballpark idea and were rude and not very accommodating after their product broke in less than a year. Not impressed.
reviews.review_header: Works great but does not last. Broke in less than a year

reviews.review_text: Very small. Only espresso cups will fit. Can almost use a small coffee cup if the metal plate is removed, but not enough room to remove cup without spilling coffee. A normal coffee cup will not work with this unit. Unit only pre-heats a very small amount of water..so you need to constantly switch back and forth between heat and dispense. Coffee is very bland and watery compared to a 6 bar espresso coffee maker. The steamer on the side is spring loaded, so you have to hold the unit with one hand, hold the cup with the other hand, and control the steam with the other hand...The spring tension is too strong. Great price...watery coffee with not flavor.

Takes forever to make a cup of coffee! Have to wait for it to warm up, then run it through multiple times to get several shots of coffee. To steam milk to anything above lukewarm takes several rounds as well. It took me 20+ minutes to make a cup of coffee!
reviews.review_header: Takes forever to make a cup of coffee! Have ...

reviews.review_text: I bought this unit off amazon and have the same problems with two of them. I watched youtube videos, talked with local baristas, and a friend of mine that is a barista. I used a burr grinder with many different settings. I then had a barista grind me some coffee to be sure the grinds were the right size. The machine does not put out a consistent stream. sometimes it is only a few drips. The pump sounds like its begging to be turned off and vibrates the whole unit. If i didn't hold my cup it would fall off the unit and break. After a few weeks of trying everything recommended I gave up and exchanged it thinking i had a bad unit. I opened the second one and one week in it also has all the exact same problems. I will be returning this one and trying a different model.
reviews.review_header: The pump sounds like its begging to be turned off and vibrates the ...

reviews.review_text: I bought it after reading all the reviews as a birthday gift for my husband. It has been quite a disappointment. You need to wait 20 minutes for the water to heat up to be able to make coffee and steam milk. A lot of times the steam turns into water making the milk all watery. The coffee was anything but espresso quality, even my Mr Coffee can brew it better. Once again I think it is excess water getting into the brew and diluting it. As mentioned in other reviews, milk steamer does not fit on the shelf, so you have to hold it in an awkward position. I suppose you get what you pay for, and this machine sure is cheap and inferior and not worth the trouble. Thankfully I was able to return it to Amazon and get the refund although I could not return the tamper and steamer.
reviews.review_header: Cheap, poor quality, not worth the trouble

reviews.review_text: I received my late, lamented machine as a gift in December 2010. For the last 21 months it performed like a trooper. No problems with vibrations, dripping, leaking -- I loved it. A couple of months ago, it started dripping from the steaming wand when turned on, and then later, from the portafilter after the brewing was finished but while the steamer was in operation. I could deal with that. But, suddenly this week, it started leaking from the bottom of the machine, flooding the counter with water. I descaled it and there was no leaking during that process. But then while running clean water through it to flush out the descaling solution it flooded the counter again. It was great while it lasted, and I may purchase another one simply because it is the right size for my very small kitchen, but due to its relatively short life span, it's difficult to give a glowing recommendation. Based on my satisfaction with my machine a friend purchased one last December, but after relatively light usage it has started the dripping from the portafilter after the brewing operation has ceased but while the machine is still on for steaming. I fear her machine may not survive as long as mine. Since it is less than a year since the purchase, she may yet get to experience The DeLonghi Warranty Nightmare described by other reviewers. If I had written this review even two months ago, I would have rated the EC155 five stars. However, for breaking my heart, it gets knocked down to three.

Cups to fit are the espresso cups, machine shakes so much that the cups dancing all around coffee spills everywhere, takes long time , And what i most wanted is the crema, which it does not produce, using Amazones best coffee beans fresh ground with a cone grinding machine, I fill filter to the top, compress hard, light, and not at all , same result no crema , one side delivers a full cup the other side a quater cup, have to hold with both hands the espresso cups , the problem to sut of machine, while one cup dances away, spilling coffe all over. Not enough space for larger regular capuccino cups.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: I've done extensive research after I decided to purchase myself espresso machine. This one came with good reviews and was priced right. After I received it, I was highly disappointed. It heats up very small amount of water, so I have to turn it off and wait. In about month after I got it it stopped working. I called DeLonghi customer service and they replaced it. But after a month it stopped working again. It vibrates and makes loud noise but nothing comes out. I use only filtered water. I wish I can get my money back.

Purchased this in Dec 2013 as a Christmas present for me and my husband. It took a little getting used to. Fell in love with this machine until Feb 2014. One morning it started leaking out the back of the machine along the bottom near the electrical cord. I called the number on the back of the product and they said an "o" ring may have come loose or wore out. In order to have machine replaced I had to cut the electrical cord (not plugged in!) and send it to them. I sent the cord along with the my information (tracked) and literally a few days later I received a new machine. Down side is that this new machine has some quirks. The frothing light doesn't stay on long enough for a decent froth and the drip light doesn't stay on long enough for a double espresso. I'm going to give a few more days to see if I need to call the company again.

This is the second time I have bought and used this machine. Overall, for the money, this is a solid espresso machine. Easy to use and clean, compact size and when working properly makes a good espresso. Having owned this twice there are a few issues that were consistent each time: 1) The steam spout leaks when you are heating up the machine. So, if you turn on the machine and walk away while it warms up you will come back to a small puddle of water. 2) Machine vibrates quite a bit so you almost have to hold the espresso cup in place while it presses the espresso out or it will eventually miss the cup. 3) This machine loses power over time. At around a year with both machines I was unable to get consitent froth/crema on top of the espresso. The above aside, this is the best machine for the money but ask yourself whether you want to buy another one of these every year or so or spend for a better machine.
reviews.review_header: Have owned two of these. Good for price but has issues.

reviews.review_text: Very disappointed in the operation of this espresso machine, however it does make a great cup of coffee. The plastic housing is not made of a heavy weight/durable plastic and the entire machine "dances" on the counter when it's making a cup of coffee. It's very loud and the movement on the counter is very frustrating as I need to hold the cup in place so that is doesn't move away from the espresso stream. Also you need to be advised that the space between the dispenser and base will only allow an espresso sized cup to be used, unlike my previous machine which allowed me to use a larger coffee cup sized vessel. As noted in other comments, when you remove the coffee filter holder after operation, the coffee is not dry (it's a dripping mess) therefore it's not easy to get to the sink or waste can to throw out. Operation is easy, however the round dial on the front is not intuitive in terms of how it points to the selected operation. The water reservoir is large and easy to insert and remove. This replaced a non-functioning Krups machine (also a bar pump) that I had received as a gift 10 years ago. The operation of the Krups was superior for the reasons I have commented on however the De'Longhi does make a better cup of coffee.
reviews.review_header: Great coffee with less than stellar operation

reviews.review_text: Pulls a decent espresso shot & I like that it's compact, but don't love the pressurized portafilters that come with it, and the relatively small volume of water that is heated at a time. But for this price range it's pretty good. One very frustrating temporary issue I had was a strong plastic smell in the water reservoir. I washed it over 10 times with warm soapy water, and a few times with cold water... soaked it overnight in vinegar, and again with pbw, but nothing would get the smell out. You could taste plastic in the coffee for the first solid month of use. The plastic taste has mostly faded by now, but it took 5 or 6 weeks of heavy use and cleaning before it did.
reviews.review_header: Pulls a decent espresso shot & I like that it's compact

reviews.review_text: Really disappointed in this machine.. We had bought the exact same machine in the Netherlands, and it worked fine. Left if when we moved and bought the same machine in the US. Out of the box, it never worked with espresso ground coffee. It would only push through water if we used regular ground coffee very lightly tamped. Obviously, the end result is a very small quantity of very weak coffee. And when you want/need a coffee you don't want to get coffee-colored water in a small cup.. We've taken everything out and cleaned every piece and nothing improved. Will try my luck returning it to the manufacturer, but honestly I feel annoyed everytime I look at it. The water flowing out of the machine - even with no grounds at all - is really weak. Its entirely possible that I bought a bad machine but there is clearly not enough pressure in this machine to make an espresso drink. Think twice before you buy this because it seems like a good deal - and buy it from a store with a good return policy or using Amazon prime because there is a fair chance you will be sending it back.
reviews.review_header: Unable to use espresso grounds - very weak pressure and output

reviews.review_text: I bought one of these after using a friend's. After buying one, I discovered: a) I can't use anything taller than an espresso cup with this machine. That's unacceptable for me. I primarily pull espresso into larger, double-walled glassware. I don't just drink it straight and I don't want the espresso to get cold on its way to my cup. b) The machine I received didn't work very well. I'm not sure what was wrong with it, but I have no trouble getting creamy espresso using other comparably-priced machines. Build quality on many sub-$100 espresso machines is disappointing. It looks nice enough, and might even work, but won't do the job for me.

I had a BAR32 model and the thermostat went out after about 4 years. This model was about $10 less, so I gave it a try. It appeared to be a cosmetic variation of the BAT32, but it wasn't. I was able to use 8oz mugs with the BAR32 with a little juggling. This model had major problems with the 6oz mugs that were easy to use with the BAR32. Even worse was the crema it made. It was almost non-existent with the EC155. I tried various grinds and tamping pressures. I'm currently using my old steam machine. This one is going back and I re-ordered the BAR32.

I thought this would be a good starter espresso machine, but I was wrong. The frother arm is too short so it is hard to get a good froth. I have tried with several different size containers and it was all awkward. It pulled a good espresso ONCE and then every thing after was horrible. We returned it...but had to pay shipping back, which was almost as much as the product!!!! Not good business.
reviews.review_header: I thought this would be a good starter espresso machine

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my parents for Christmas it worked good for a couple on months, although the temperature was not very hot at all, then suddenly after 10 months of use it died!! Only have used purified water and white vinegar through to break up build up. VERY DISAPPOINTED! I thought it was going to be so great after reading all the other reviews. I also bought my husband the more expensive, bigger machine from this company and ours also completely stopped working after a few short months. DON'T BUY THIS MACHINE OR ANY BY DELONGHI.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: I bought this 2.5 years ago and it just died this morning. It stopped pulling water altogether. I tried cleaning it per the manual, no luck. I running a cleaner through it, no luck. I tried taking it apart to see if there was a failing part I could replace and the damn thing crumbled in my hands. In other words, it's your typical Chinese piece of crap designed to fail. You can expect about 2 years of use if you use it daily, maybe longer if you drink coffee only occasionally.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for. A sub $100 coffee machine? Plan on buying another one soon.

reviews.review_text: I first bought an ec-155 in May 2011. It worked great! I had never had an espresso maker before so I can't compare it to cheaper or more expensive units, but it worked really well for what I needed. I used it for a single shot anywhere from 1-4x a day, almost every day for a year. Right around the 1 year mark, it started getting temperamental, and in relatively short order, started making a burning, electrical fire smell when I used it. I contacted the company and although the unit was out of the 1-yr warranty (by about 3 weeks), they agreed to send me a new unit for $14.95 shipping/handling. The new unit arrived and worked great, until about a month ago (10 months after replacement). I keep the machine very clean, clean the filters regularly, but it started being very slow pushing water through the grounds, taking forever to produce a shot and with no crema. Tonight I tried to use it and it wouldn't push ANY water through the grounds, not even drips. I'm debating trying to turn it in for warranty again or just calling it quits with this model. I think I'll probably be looking elsewhere.
reviews.review_header: It only lasts a year or less

reviews.review_text: Worked great for a few months then frother started leaking around 11 months stopped working entirely. I did get a new machine under warranty since t happened within a year but took 3 weeks to recieve it and they will not warranty the replacement machine. Apparently this is common so I expect in another year after this one craps out I will have to find another one

It makes a decent tasting espresso, and it looks nice on the kitchen counter. The motor/pump makes the machine rattle so much that the espresso mugs slide all over the place, so you have to stand and hold the mugs in place. It reminds me of the 'Friends' episode where Ross and Chandler got bullied at the coffee shop so they tried to make their own cappuccino at home.. At least I got a good laugh out of it. I've added some thick rubber feet to help with the vibration, but small espresso mugs still won't stay put. My solution is to remove the stainless steel drip plate and use a standard sized coffee mug. If I had saved the box I would return.

Cons:1. The fact that you cant put a coffee cup under the espresso nozzle is a horrible design, some of us like espresso in cups. 2. When it pours it rattles the cups right off the tray, there should be grooves to hold it, this is beyond stupid in design. 3. The handle and the frother are on the same side and they collide, its annoying. 4. Handle when snug should face 90 degress, not some odd 22 degree angle which it has. 5. Pointless tamper 6. Small reservoir Pros: great espresso pour and heats up fast. All in all, very little engineering went into this design, its truly amazing. Good luck.
reviews.review_header: Too small, thoughtless design however draws a great pour.

reviews.review_text: its so noisy and vibrates a lot even more than my shaving machine. Can get the same results without the noise and vibes for half of that at any store. You get what you paid? And well delonghi service dont care at all. Return in process

This is my second De'longhi espresso machine, first one broke after few years of usage - not bad (bad switch). I bought this model in late November of 2012 and used it with Lavazza Espresso Coffee (it will not use every kind of coffee, has to be ground very fine or it will not have the power to push water through). I only use bottled water with it, and still, for some reason I had to clean it with vinegar two times already (half year) because it would not pump enough pressure - it was slightly dripping - like the seals inside were not holding pressure...? For fast few weeks I've noticed that the front switch is harder and harder to turn. I am not very impressed. Now, I'm waiting for it to brake before the warranty is over. Maybe next one is going to be better.
reviews.review_header: It's OK, but is true 'you get what you pay'

reviews.review_text: too complicated for me before i've had my morning latte. i gave it to a friend who's more of a morning person; he loves it!
reviews.review_header: too much work before my caffeine

reviews.review_text: I have had this product for just over a year, the warenty has expired and the pump has failed. This is the only problem I have had with this product. Sadly the cost to repair it is almost the same as it will cost to but a new one. While it has worked well, using an esspresso grind (fine)coffee, and using the built in tamper, the Creme was rich and the frothere worked well, although the frothing tube is a bit short, but it works well with the 8oz frothing mug. The cup platform is just a little too close to the spout, but just remove the drip platform and other coffee mugs will fit. Bottom line is I will not be buying this one as a replacement!

For an entry machine this is the best but in the long term there are issues that pop up that make it not worth the effort to run. Pros: It makes great espresso It's cheap It will run well for a long time providing you're able to maintain it Cons: The machine is torture to clean. It feels loosely put together and coffee grounds get into every part of it and can lead to mold growth. I had to unscrew and clean out everything from the base of the machine to the filter handle at least once a month of regular usage. The filter is quite small. Even with the big one I was never making two shots because it really is a one shot size. The foaming wand is basically useless because of its small size and lack of pressure. This never bothered me because I only used the machine for espresso but if you want foam then i suggest you get something else.
reviews.review_header: Good entry machine but a pain to maintain.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: I purchased this item to avoid paying $5 for a cup of coffee every day. This was my first venture into at-home espresso making so I wanted to keep it simple and affordable. I did read reviews of this product before purchasing and that helped in my decision regarding purchasing this model. It is quite easy to use; I have made espresso and steamed milk with it. I was actually quite impressed with the steaming. It works very well and gets the milk hot rather quickly. Sometimes the espresso seems to pump out very slowly. It comes out in drops rather than a straight stream. I have cleaned the pod holder and it doesn't seem to matter. One other issue I have is that pods don't actually work; the espresso comes out watery. To solve this, I open the pods and place the grounds into the pod holder and this works well though it is an extra step. So now I just purchase beans and grind them to save money on the pods. If this is your first espresso machine and you don't want to pay a lot of money, this isn't a bad machine. I will be purchasing a higher quality, more expensive machine in the future.

I bought this (full price!) four years ago and am looking for a different machine now. Although this makes a very good cup of espresso, the latte frothing wand started leaking a couple of years ago (I have a jam jar under it to catch the overflow) and it now leaks out more than it brews. Fix the leak issue, De'Longhi and I'd buy from you again!
reviews.review_header: frothing wand leaks after a couple of years

reviews.review_text: It is 1 year and 3 months from the date of purchase ( 3 months over the 1 year warranty ) and a small plastic piece broke that holds the espresso holder up on the machine tightly. Now we can not make espresso. We can steam milk but that's it. We liked it until now. We did not use it every day. Maybe 2 times per week at most. I feel that it should have lasted longer than 1 year and 3 months. It was easy to use and made good enough espresso but for $90 and the minimal use it got, it should have lasted longer. If DeLonghi customer service is good, I will update my review accordingly but right now 3 stars is all I can give.

arrived on time but didn't work.This may be a matter of the packing, i don't know, however even if it did work, according to the instructions, it takes 15 minutes to warm up. my mornings don't have time for a 15 minute warm up, do yours?

I have purchased two of these machines and when it is brand new, it works amazingly. But each one has died out on me less than a year after purchasing it. I thought maybe I had messed it up somehow so I bought another one a year later, but the same thing happen. Works beautifully for about a year or less, then just stops. I think I need to invest in a machine like the 702 that has less plastic.
reviews.review_header: Worked amazingly at first. I was head over heels but died less than year later. Twice!

reviews.review_text: My second EC155 machine has just failed, same problem as the first machine, a failed pump. My first machine lasted 2 years, the second lasted only 9 months. When working, this unit makes a great espresso with lots of crema, and it is this that gives it the high ratings. What you need to watch out for is that it VERY prone to early pump failure as you can see in most of the other 1 star reviews. If you are willing to spend $90 every couple of years, this machine will be good for you. Sad, I liked my EC155, but I am now looking around for another, more reliable machine.
reviews.review_header: Makes great espresso, but low quality pump causes it to fail early

reviews.review_text: VERY DISAPPOINTING. This machine worked for about 8 months just fine. Then I had to descale it, which I know is usual, and it seemed to make the machine run well for about a day. Then it stopped making good espresso slowly, and now it's very watery. Very disappointed.
reviews.review_header: Barely worked one year. And I know how to use it!

reviews.review_text: I purchase an EC155 to replace my Capresso Ultima that finally gave up after 10 years service. Although the De'Longhi did not have the semiautomatic features of the Capresso, I was hoping for a good cup of coffee but found the brew quality disappointing. The crema was minimal and the coffee tasted thin and a bit harsh. I've had better results with some automatic drip machines. I got lucky and found a minimally used Capresso Ultima on Ebay. The brew quality with the same beans and grind is much better - full bodied without harshness and a nice crema on top. Hard to say why the EC155 couldn't do better. The pump pressure is the same in both machines.

I purchased this product as a replacement for my brevile cafe modena which lasted a while and eventually gave out, unfortunately a product that lasted many years being replaced by one that lasted a mere 3 months was saddening. It clogged up within the first month, was laborious to clean the clogs and then started to smoke and not operate properly. I have had this companies products before and was very pleased, this one is not a reflection of the company but merely a reflection of the product itself.
reviews.review_header: I have had this companies products before and was very pleased, this one is not a reflection of the ...

reviews.review_text: Expected life with filtered water from a Brita filter pitcher is 730 lattes, thats about $2500 of lattes at McDs or SB. So this is a great deal, just don't expect more latte service out of this machine because of the steam valve will eventually plug. Vinegar will help for a while but eventually it will plug. On my next machine (the third) I will use distilled water and we will see if it makes it past its first birthday. Ps I cut the little brass valve open with a hacksaw to see how it was made, the clearance is very small so it is susceptible to plugging.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: Bought based on high reviews and low price. Compact. Top warmer is really not usable due to the shape and low temp. I has to be on for a significant time to be able to warm up a cup. Difficult to place two even small cups as they won't fit. There is significant turbulence while coffee is being brewed which makes cup slide (while machine is standing on very even/horizontal countertop), so I have to hold it in place. Apparently two cups brew is possible, but attempted it and had uneven coffee strength. Currently I use it almost exclusively for milk steaming. Would not recommend it if you can spend more and get a better quality piece.

First the pros: it's small, it's got a great layout with tamper on machine and easy to remove water tank. Everything appears to work. Cons: has small hole in the drip tray that will leak on your counter, the part where you place your coffee only has a small plastic piece to keep it in place, emptying it is a pain. Machine rattles so you need to hold the shot glass in place otherwise coffee spills everywhere. Personally, I think it's overpriced, it's not that high quality, but maybe it's just me.

I bought this item twice. The first one lasted three years and the second, well, I didn't keep it. I liked it for the making of espresso, but in my experience, the frother didn't work well, so I ended up just heating the coffee in the microwave. I gave the second machine away in order to buy a better model. I upgraded to a nicer Delonghi machine and I'm happy to say that every latte I have is beautifully frothy!
reviews.review_header: In My Experience, Delonghi is a Nice Brand

reviews.review_text: I feel like many of these reviews are fake / from a 3rd party company to sell it up. I was pretty excited to get this machine. Initially I was quite impressed as it is pretty easy to use the machine and clean and maintain. However after weeks of experimenting, I realize that this is not going to work. The biggest flaw is the single motor. You're either going to get good frothed milk, or a good shot. Not both at the same time, unless you want to wait a really long time in between to let it heat up. I've experimented with many different beans that I grinded beforehand. Another flaw is the fact that the tip of the frother is plastic. I was tempted to buy a metal tip but I realized it's just not worth spending the extra $35 for a good tip for an $80 single motor machine that just can't heat up well. I returned it after a month, very disappointed. If you want a good espresso machine, you're going to need to spend $200+ it looks like.
reviews.review_header: It's not as great as advertised

reviews.review_text: It does not seem to make a pre-measured or set amount of "espresso". Once you turn to brew, it goes until the large tank is empty or until you turn it off. It also leaves a wet goo or soupy coffee grounds in the holder. My old Krups espresso maker, which I blew up after 10+ years, made a cup or less of espresso and left a dry "puck" of used grounds which was easier to cleanup. I've emailed Delonghi several days ago, but have yet to receive a response. I tried calling early this morning, but hung up after 20minutes. I'm probably going to return this product.

Been using this machine since I purchased it in December of 2013 with reasonable success. Didn't use it for a few months and when I tried recently (in the past month or so) both the frother and the outlet where the crema comes out is dripping water in an annoying fashion just when you turn on the appropriate knob setting. So I have stopped using it for now. Not sure if any preventive maintenance needs to be done but in its current state, I find it hard to fire it up. Worked well until about 6 months ago and now I feel quite disappointed. Is this expected lifetime for it?
reviews.review_header: Expected a longer life span for this.

reviews.review_text: Very steep learning curve, conflicting information, and bitter espresso. This is both a review and a solicitation for discussion. There is no way to tell how much pressure the unit exerts. There is a base amount of pressure that I'm defining as filter holder + filter without grounds. But even this amount can be varied because the filter is put together with a screw component that is taken apart when cleaning. This means that depending on how hard you screw it back into place, the base pressure it takes to push water out will differ. Then there is the question of tampering. If the base pressure is already 15 BAR, then any amount of tampering will make it harder to push water out and results in higher actual BAR. If base pressure is always lower than 15, then without what the actual number and how that pressure changes increases with tampering force, there is no way to get exactly 15 BAR. In the end, it will come down to trial and error. I'm probably never going to make a perfect cup of espresso with this machine. My spouse love the machine and would give it a 4/5 and says the espresso is not bitter when they make it.
reviews.review_header: I'm probably never going to make a perfect cup of espresso with this machine

reviews.review_text: I wish there was a way to do a double shot, but it only does really shallow cartridges. Also there is no way I can fit a mug under it, which is a bummer. You can only use really short cups under it. I may return this based on my needs.
reviews.review_header: I wish there was a way to do a double ...

reviews.review_text: We purchased the De'Longhi EC155 in June of 2013, so not quite two years ago. I have used it daily, and for the most part, it worked OK. I also make sure that I clean and maintain it strictly according to the manufacturer's instructions. Despite that, it has died. I called De'Longhi and was told it was likely a bad pump, and that unfortunately, since it was out of warrantee, there was nothing they could do for me. I could ship it to their repair facility and be charged, or take it to a local appliance repair store. Most of the estimates I got were a minimum of around $50 just to look at the thing, which is hardly worth it for an $89 unit. Ultimately, they offered a 20% discount on another unit, but why would I buy another De'Longhi when the first unit died after so short a time and the company doesn't own up to the poor quality? The puzzling thing is that it had pretty good reviews on Amazon, so maybe I just got a lemon. Regardless, not a machine, or company, I would recommend going forward.

Just unpacked my second unit which failed right out of the box. Amazon is now stating the following Item "Under Review While this item is available from other marketplace sellers on this page, it is not currently offered by Amazon.com because customers have told us there may be something wrong with our inventory of the item, the way we are shipping it, or the way it's described here. (Thanks for the tip!)" I could have used that information before doing an exchange for the same item, or it at least have it emailed to me, by amazon after completing my exchange." I will return it, but will buy from my local retailer instead. We're working to fix the problem as quickly as possible.
reviews.review_header: Worked for one weak, stopped pumping replacement did the same right out of the box.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: i used it for almost a year with some minor inconveniences and then it expired a few days before the warranty expired. it was replaced (it took about 3 weeks) and the replaced one lasted about 3 weeks before the pump gave out again. since the warranty is valid for one year from the original purchase date the replacement was not under warranty. when it works it did a good job but from other reviews the pump assembly is crappy and they continually leak from the bottom.

So, this is my first espresso machine. I've worked as a barista before, so no surprises, could get it working. Heated milk piping hot, just like I prefer it. It's small, so that's convenient. UNFORTUNATELY, the machine is only what you see in the picture minus the cups. If you don't have proper cups, it might make your experience a little difficult. Also, the steam wand is positioned low. Again, if you don't have one of those metal mini pitchers (what is it called?), might be a little difficult to make a decent layer of foam. Overall: Not bad, but you might have to pick up extra stuff

I bought this exactly two months ago and out of nowhere the frother just stopped working. Yesterday it worked fine but this morning I turned it on and when I tried to use the swivel jet frother nothing came out. When I originally got this espresso maker it took a while to make a decent shot of espresso. It came out very diluted. I was almost at the point of returning it when I found out that I had to tamper the coffee grinds extremely tight in the filter holder. After that it made a decent cup of espresso. It wasn't until this morning that it stopped working. This was definitely a waste of money.
reviews.review_header: After two months it doesn't work

reviews.review_text: Pretty disappointed. This machine makes fabulous coffee....when it works! I'v only had it 5 months and it basically just stopped working, like other reviewers have said. One day it was fine, the next day, nothing. I turn it on and just nothing happens, I can't even explain why! For a hundred bucks, I expected more than 5 months use, especially when I only use it at weekends. Do not waste your money!!
reviews.review_header: Pretty disappointed. This machine makes fabulous coffee

reviews.review_text: First I'll start off my saying I began my espresso purchases with a Mr. Coffee Espresso maker from Wal-Mart.com. After receiving the item the handle of the filter basket arrived broken. I promptly returned the item and began a search for a new one. I was really looking to buy a very inexpensive machine, not wanting to spend over $40 or $50. Thus, the lower price of this machine caught my attention. It is the 'cheapest' pump machine you can purchase. After reading thru pages of the several hundred reviews written on this machine I decided it was the one for me. I rarely saw negatives posted and for every negative comment on one topic I saw 5 positive topics that countered what the other person said. Meaning 5 people to 1 didn't have that problem or the 1 person was doing something wrong. I am by no means an espresso savy person. This is my first machine ever. I'm just tired of paying $3-$5 for a cup of whatever at McDonalds or Starbucks. To sum up this machine it's not EXACTLY what I thought. I have 2 negatives that, in my opinion, almost make me wish I looked harder at this machine. 1. It is VERY loud and vibrates hard when in use. When you actually are pouring the espresso shot the machine is very noisy and it literally moves on whatever surface you set it on. It moves so much in fact that whatever 'cup' you put under the spout, you literally have to hold it there with your hand or it moves completely off and falls off the machine. This caught me off guard as I only saw 1 negative comment about this. So either my machines works but is somehow broken and vibrates so badly I don't know if that's how it works or if it truely is broken. Whatever the case--I do not care for the vibration the machine causes. Thus I downgraded it 1 star for this bad vibration. 2. There is NO room for a cup under the filter basket at all. The only item I can get to fit to 'catch' the espresso is a shot glass. Thus, I can't even pour two espresso's at once for a 'double' b/c a double shot glass doesn't even fit. This really surprised me b/c I saw no negative comment about this at all. Literally, the only thing that fits is a small, shot glass. So, I'm unsure what other people are using, but it's the only thing in my kitchen that fits. I ordered 4 espresso cups that have yet to arrive. Unless they're as tiny as a shot glass (which they aren't) there's no way they will fit either. So I'm perplexed as to what to use. Thus I downgraded it another star level for no room. 3. The frothing wand is a bit short and as I read, the end of the wand is useless. I took it off to clean it and I can't even get it back on tight enough to where steam doesn't pour out of the top of it--yet it's screwed back on as tight as it goes. The wand definitely needs to be longer and more flexible. It is flexible somewhat, but it's flexible as in it'll move where you want it, but it won't stay. It gently glides back into another position no matter how far you move it. I ordered a 20 ounce pitcher and I'm unsure how I'm going to use it b/c the arm is so small. Other than those three negatives I've been happy. I've made about 5-8 shots and each have been perfect. Frothing is a bit hard to accomplish as I've yet to get lots of froth from milk. However, I just need more practice. I'd love it if someone who had vibrations problems like I'm having fixed it. I'd also love to know what people are using to catch their espresso shots. Thanks. Hope this helps anyone as this is a 100% accurate review from a brand new purchaser.

So far so good. Almost bought an expensive machine, but decided to give this one a try. The portafilter fits very tightly, and the machine weights practically nothing--dinky. So, you will actually need to hold the machine down with your other arm when turning it into position. Also, the steam wand gets in the way when we put the portafilter into place. You'll have to push that to the left so you can line up the basket into the group correctly. The espresso from this machine tastes pretty good, not excellent. We use very high quality beans meant for espresso brewing. We have used these same beans with a higher quality machine and gotten better results with taste. Finally, the water tank is very small. We make two quad shots each morning (8 shots) plus maybe a double later in the day. If you make that amount, you will need to refill the tank often. I did make sure to save all of the original packaging just in case this one does not hold up.
reviews.review_header: So far so good. Almost bought an expensive machine

reviews.review_text: This was my second De'Longhi EC155.. My first lasted 2 years, so I invested in the second. I am very disappointed. The pump on this machine has quit working after 15 months. OK, but you cannot purchase a replacement pump from De'Longhi. When I checked on Amazon and other online options, the price of a replacement pump is about 2/3 the cost of buying another machine. Not ok. So though I was very happy with the product I cannot recommend this machine to others. The price continues to increase but the longevity is decreasing. Time for a different brand.
reviews.review_header: I am very disappointed. The pump on this machine has quit working ...

reviews.review_text: This machine is great for the price ! I don't use the built in tamper though, as I prefer the 49mm red topped stainless steel one available on Amazon. I use the Lavazza crema gusto coffee which is perfect for espresso . This is good for home use ! No more percolated coffee for me since I got this machine - I'm an espresso addict now . Update - good while it lasted, but pump failure under 2 years.

I purchased the De'Longhi EC155 15 Bar Pump Espresso machine on January 8, 2016. It made good Espressos and Lattes, but 14 months after my purchase the machine failed to heat up. The warranty is only good for 12 months so I am out of luck. It is designed well, but not to last.
reviews.review_header: De'Longhi EC 155 only lasted for 14 months.

reviews.review_text: I read many reviews before buying this unit. I also read the instructions before operating. Here's the skinny on my experience. I opened the package and all seemed fine before I popped the top lid open to discover the handle on the water tank was broken on one side (see picture). I should have sent it back, but decided to live with it. Then, I ran through the flushing/priming procedures. I'm still not sure if this unit is defective, but MAN ALIVE this thing shakes/vibrates like crazy! When using espresso cups, I have to hold the cup in position so that it does not vibrate off of the platform. Next was the water/coffee delivery problem. Just as some others have complained about, I tried to brew my first cup and got bubkes, zip, nada, I took steps to avoid the errors that other made while using this machine, but still had problems. I tried again, but this time, I let the unit warm up for 30 minutes. Voila! I now have espresso (ok, not quite yet). It took a little trial-and-error on placing the right amount of coffee grounds in the holder and how hard to press the coffee down. Tips: Let the unit warm up for 15 to 20 minutes. Fill with espresso coffee grounds to the top, pack lightly, fill again to top off, pack a little harder (but don't push down too hard), and brew. Play around with it. I'm getting some great espresso now that I have the hang of it.
reviews.review_header: For the price, it beats StarBucks.

name: De'Longhi EC155 15 BAR Pump Espresso and Cappuccino Maker

reviews.review_text: First One Lasted 8 Months (12/6/14). Second One Lasted 6 Months (8/19/15). Won't be a Third One. First one started leaking badly all over the kitchen counter top & lost pressure enough so that we couldn't draw a decent cupper. I tried all the adjustments I could find off YouTube and elsewhere but to no avail. Second now is doing the same thing. Really, really, really disappointed.
reviews.review_header: First One Lasted 8 Months (12/6/14). Second One Lasted 6 Months (8/19/15). Won't be a Third One

reviews.review_text: Pump went bad after 4 months. Too much of a hassle to contact them about it, especially when I'd prefer an automatic. Someone else had mentioned their pump goes bad within a year after 3 purchases and I believe it.I also have always had a problem with the machine leaking, ever since the first day I got it. It's good if you don't mind pulling your shots and comes with a warranty (in case it stops working). For now I'm just going to toss it and pick up an automatic one.

I bought this espresso maker after reading all the glorious reviews and although it is a pretty good machine I do want to point out some of the things that I found to be annoying. It does produce a good espresso shot with a bit of crema. The biggest flaw in the design for me is that there is not enough height between the metal grate that the shot classes sit on and the spouts where the espresso comes from. I can barely fit a shot glass in between there which is annoying. If it had another 2-3" between there a person could put there milk pitcher in there create there foam and walk away while the milk heats. Further more it would be nice to use a single 2 oz. shot glass to pour your shots in which creates one less dish to wash after. I would've also liked to see a bigger wand to steam the milk. Everything is just so compact and crunched. I was definitely disappointed by all of that. Overall it's a good machine for 80 bucks but if I would've known I would've stepped up to a higher end cappaccino maker that had more space overall.
reviews.review_header: It's a good cappaccino maker for $80 bucks but not without it's faults

reviews.review_text: Full disclosure: I am a former business owner of an espresso cafe. So my standards are kinda high. I wanted to get something for home that would make a decent espresso and not spend a bundle of money because I know these machines don't typically last. This machine was for my mother. The espresso is pretty good if you have the precise grind and tamp it properly - quite a bit of cream. I knocked off 2 stars for ease of use. The porta filter is very hard to crank on to get a tight fit. Terrible for my mother who has an old wrist injury and arthritis. Furthermore, the frothing wand does make killer froth, but it is just on top and does not inject the milk with frothy creaminess, very flat hot milk results. I find myself having to turn the steam off several times during steaming to wait for the green light to come back on because it peters out pretty fast. I also find that during the pouring of the espresso, whatever you have to catch the espresso (and it had better be short due to low clearance) vibrates out of the range of the drip almost immediately, so I must hold the pitcher EVERY time until I shut it off. You must also time the drip yourself as it is not a machine you can preset to shut off at the proper time. That being said, the espresso really is decent and would probably save a college kid lots of money. The saving grace is i didn't spend too much on it, so when i replace it I will definitely pop for a step or two up.
reviews.review_header: Okay little machine for the price
